reviews.review: Fun!. Did this as a team building exercise and had such a good time. We escaped with twelve minutes to spare. Such cool puzzles and things to figure out. Would do it again.

Great fun. We booked The Vault as a family with two children. Than was a fantastic experience. Starting outside and continuing in the premise it was really exciting. Next time we want to try The Architect.

Great and memorable way to mark our visit to Amsterdam. I booked this as a surprise for my wife who enjoys puzzles and mysteries. The TripAdvisor reviews were very positive so I had high expectations which I'm pleased to say were comfortably met.Our host was very friendly and set the scene well for our chosen mystery, the Architect. The difficulty level was about right - we successfully solved most of the challenges, with a couple of helpful nudges from our host, though stumbled close to the end.The setting and attention to detail was excellent and really created a believable atmosphere. While more participants might have helped us solve it faster, it should be well within the capabilities of a couple who pay attention to everything being said and -- most important -- remember to communicate everything, especially if separated!Highly recommended!

The Architect- Brilliant!. We arrived early but were invited to sit and wait indoors in a really impressive hall. The woman conducting our experience was friendly and helpful and kept in character the whole way through. This room had a good flowing story and the puzzles were varied and exciting. We escaped with 3 mins to spare! Really good fun and definitely a good one to do with a bigger group

The Architect: Great experience!. After a somewhat disappointing first escape room experience I could not wait for a (hopefully) better experience which I definitely found here in the heart of Amsterdam at Sherlocked. We did The Architect with four people and, with four minutes left, escaped just in time. I really loved the venue which gave the escape room an authentic and mysterious feel. The host was welcoming and helpful. The interior of the room and the puzzles were very well-thought-out: everything matched perfectly together and looked as if it really belonged in that room. The puzzles were challenging but not too hard I think. Since I don’t want to spoil too much, I’ll just give you this: There is more than meets the eye in this escape room.
Puzzled ! !. Amazing experience, very fun activity even while being just 2 persons. We enjoyed it a lot and recommend it as a must In Amsterdam !

Intense!!! Most fun I've had in a long time!. For us, a family of four with two adult children, it was a perfect family adventure. It took nearly the entire time to complete! It was so intense and challenging that we spent the next two days just talking about the experience. Although there is an explanatory e-mail, the entrance is a little confusing, you have to wait for a few minutes at a fairly non-descript door until someone comes to let you in. Once inside, everything was perfect. A lot of thought went into making this an absolutely fantastic experience.

Excellent would like to go again!!. Had a great time, really good and enjoyable, great for a group it was just me and my husband but we had a blast. Mystery wasn't found which was a shame but this is why I need to go again! lol really enjoyed it and would recommend this to anyone. Best with a group of minimum 4 people.

Loved the experience!!. Our family (4 adults) had a one night lay-over in Amsterdam. What to do? We found Sherlocked on Trip Advisor. We were captivated from the first moment we entered the room. It took all of us to solve the room. We did escape but with only 3 minutes to spare! This was a super fun experience for the entire family. Highly recommend it!!

Perfect Break-in experience. We did the break-in room with friends. It was so immersive from the very start and had us very excited up until the very end. Best one I have done so far, very much worth the price.
perfect puzzle room 😍👍🏼. i had fun it's first time in realty puzzle room i advice to play this game more than 2 person 🇰🇼👍🏼👍🏼🇳🇱

Best escape room EVER. You’re 4 art dealers trying to break into a vault – that’s all I can say without spoiling too much. We had the time of our life! Make sure to be in the right mind set – it’s way more fun if you go along with the story and let the surroundings (an actual underground vault) and the atmosphere inspire you. Money well spent for the thrill you get! Special shout-out to the people running this place for their acting skills – very convincing!

The best breakout room I have done!!!!. We did this activity as a work team building event whilst in the city and it was fantastic. I have done a number of break out rooms in Manchester, and this was the best I have done. It was very clever and really well set-up. I highly recommend this.

A great time in the heart of Amsterdam. Sherlocked is a super fun escape from the bustle of the city. It's an escape room, with two difficulty options, the Architect, and the Heist. We played the Architect, and it was great fun. You'll need to think literally, as well as outside the box. It's great fun. If you have experience with escape rooms, perhaps try the Heist, as we found the Architect a little easy, but it was a lot of fun. Communication is key!
Incredible immersive experience. The break-in vault experience was incredible - I have seen many escape rooms in the UK but nothing compares to the scale of this production.

Great night out with friends. We did "the architect" with a couple of friends. For most of us this was our first escape room so we did not really know what to expect.The room itself is beautifully decorated and you're immediately immersed into the earlier part of the 1900s.The puzzles were fun and challenging, but certainly not impossible to solve. However teamwork and communication are key!We managed to get out with a few minutes to spare.

Great fun however quite expensive . Booked this as a suprise for my husbands 40th birthday. Booking was done online from home (scotland) and no problems with this. My enquiries were answered via email quickly. The escape room itself was good fun and our quiz master was friendly and spoke good English which helped! The only down side to this was the price as it was quite expensive. However as it was a special occasion was worth the money. Would recommend doing this as something slightly different!

Wow, highly recommended!. We were two people who played the Architect and escaped! It's definitely the biggest and most unique escape room we've been to. The game master was excellent. The puzzles were great. We definitely want to come back! :)

Terrific escape room in the heart of Amsterdam. Sherlocked is located at the Beurs van Berlage which is a five minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station. You will find the entrance at the Beursplein, next to the café opposite to 'de Bijenkorf'. Make yourself known by ringing the bell. The host will pick you up at the door and, after greeting you, will guide you to a place where you can leave all jackets, bags, and valuables. All valuables as well as bags are left in containers which will be locked so don't worry about anything getting stolen.After storing your belongings the host will guide you to the catacombs of the Beurs van Berlage and will tell you the story about the Beurs van Berlage after which the challenge will start. We played The Architect, which was absolutely terrific. The room is decorated beautifully with the decor completely fitting the early 1900s style of the Beurs van Berlage. The puzzles and riddles are not too easy and have been thought out very well. Clues provide hints in a very cryptic manner causing one to really think twice. Opposed to other escape rooms puzzles and riddles are diverse requiring the players to use all their senses. Hints are provided through an old fashioned phone in the room. Puzzles aren't necessarily lineair meaning players can work simultaneously on solving different mysteries. We were with five, which felt like an ideal team size. Unfortunately we did not manage to escape within 60 minutes as we got stuck in the last fiveteen minutes despite being very very close. Escaping, however, isn't impossible within the hour, just be sure to stay calm, think clear and retrace the steps you've taken. According to the host 60% of the players manage to escape within the hour.Despite failing to escape we had the time of our lives. Playing Sherlocked is a great experience and I would definitely recommend anyone looking for a great activity with friends to play this game. We will definitely come back to play The Vault! I think Sherlocked really lives up to its promise of being among the best escape rooms in the Netherlands. Hopefully the portfolio will be expanded beyond The Architect, The Vault and (currently) The Port Game.

Good fun - something different to do for an hour. We did this last night and it was really good fun. We were a team of 5 and made great progress.....at first. Then we got stuck and faffed bout for ages but in the end we solved the puzzle with seconds to spare.Good value, good fun, fab staff and an amazing location
Awesome. Really great for people who like to think outside the box and have a puzzle adventure. Great for groups of friends or work colleagues. Would definitely recommend!

Excellent. Went with a group of friends. Was so much fun definitely recommend. The building its in a very old and creepy. And the room and setting was great. The staff made it extra mysterious non of us knew what to expect.

Good room. Terribly run. Turned up for the room on our second day of holiday very excited after reading the reviews. When we arrived another group was already waiting and fifteen minutes after we were meant to start that group was taken to the room. Ten minutes after that (and getting no answer from the contact number given) someone finally arrived to tell us they had double booked and they couldn't give us our experience that day. It was reorganised for our last day of holiday. The morning of our new experience we were phoned and told they couldn't fit us in that day and we would have to do their other, shorter room. Shorter room was well themed and fun until one of the props didn't work and the guy obviously wasn't paying attention because he kept giving us clues for puzzles we had already solved. After he finally realised what was wrong he had to come into the room and fix it for us. Barely gave us any money back even after all those problems and even though they originally said they would take us for drinks after to apologise as soon as we finished we were given the cold shoulder. Other reviewers don't seem to have these problems so maybe you will be lucky but this was honestly the worst escape room experience I have ever had and the constant problems really put a damper on the holiday.
Amazing!. We spent an incredible hour of fun and joy with friends discovering mysteries and how to get out of the room! Excellent!!

One of the best . It was an amazing experience. The scenario was beautiful we felt us inside a book and, in addition, the story with all his mysteries made that one incredible adventure. I don't recommend play the game as a par, I think the best way is to do that with 4 people, as a par we didn't have enough time to complete the game, although we had a very god time here. If I plan to visit Amsterdam again, certainly I will get here again :)
Excellent. The game was just amazing and the staff was super niceIf you are coming to Amsterdam, I truly recomend it !!!

Good but could be better. The building and setup of the escape room are excellent - great venue. We were a little late for the room and staff were very accommodating. We are fairly experienced with escape rooms having completed more than 10 if them around Europe so had a good idea of what to expect. However we got very obviously stuck twice and felt it took too long to get a hint from the moderator which left us feeling quite frustrated. We felt the price was a bit excessive. We thought the main room itself was too big and the game would have worked better in a smaller space. Having said that, the props and feel of the space are excellent and there are some very original and lateral thinking puzzles.
Excellent. We were so close to finding the end. It was such a great experience. I highly recommend this attraction.

disappointing. we are an experienced couple with escape rooms (done over 10 in Israel).in our opinion this room is not suitable for 2 people - we did not finish in time (a shame that they allow couples to play).most of the riddles were good, but there were too many for a couple. probably would have managed if they gave us a little more time to finish (but they stopped the game exactly after 1 hour).we asked for a walk-through for the few remaining riddles (after we already got out the room), but the staff refused to tell us (too bad, because we would not go there again and it could have make our experience better).it is very expensive (compared to other rooms in Amsterdam).overall the room was nice, good theme, sophisticated riddles, but we got out of there with a bad taste. we would not return there.
The best escape room so far!. The room was beautiful, the atmosphere fantastic, the staff were brilliant and the game was just amazing. Best escape room we've done so far.
Best Escape Room. Its not just the room which is amazing. Its the staff who handles it too. The surprises are too many in the "ARCHITECT". Would recommend to everyone

Sher-mazing! . Fab fab fab! I suggested this to my husband to do for his birthday as he had previously been to an escape room on his stag. It was fantastic! Very well thought out and you can really immerse yourself in the whole experience. The staff are approachable and very believable in the story the lay out too. It really gets you thinking and was a great way to spend an hour working as a team with my hubby- got to keep his brain ticking over now he's the ripe old age of 32! Would definitely recommend a visit!

Nr 1 escape room and with good reason!. The Architect was the best escape room I have ever done! It was clever, the puzzles were intelligent, the room had some fantastic features and the story really took us in. It is amazing to experience how everybody finds their role in the group when escaping and solving riddles and puzzles. Next to this the staff played their part really well and made the experience a lot more fun.

A MUST DO ESCAPE ROOM. This is by far the best immersive experience! The Vault and the Architect are awesome. The Vault is very difficult, so I would caution you to have a good reliable team for this set up. The Architect is pretty straight forward and solvable by most people. The experience is un-paralleled and so much beautiful detail put in every part of the "set".Well worth the money!

Fantastic hour of lateral thinking & teamwork - very enjoyable!. I booked The Architect as a finale to a 2-day city trip for myself and my 15 year old daughter. She was a little apprehensive but was soon put at ease by the warm welcome. We got to work quickly and made great progress, then BAM we were stuck! With some gentle guidance we were soon back on track. We had thought being a mum & daughter team of 2 would be a disadvantage but no, all the information you need really is there - you just need to think laterally. Totally recommended.
The architect. Great fun. Good way to bond with friends. Booked online and host was expecting us. Smooth experience.

Fantastic atmosphere and well judged puzzles. We've done a few escape rooms in the UK but this has been the most enjoyable one so far. Really interactive and exciting puzzles with plenty of surprises. Puzzles range in challenge but are generally logical and not too frustrating as long as you remember not to overlook anything! A lot less random searching required than other escape rooms we've been to. We managed to escape within the time, which was very satisfying as we got stuck for a while on 2 or 3 of the puzzles. If you're planning a trip to Amsterdam please do try Sherlocked, you won't regret it!

Best Escape Room I've Ever Done. We were astounded with our experience at Sherlocked. The whole event is so emersive and beautifully presented. Much better than the escape rooms I have tried in the UK or Prague. This one will be hard to beat. The staff are fantastic. The setting is beautiful. The puzzles are tricky but solvable and a lot of fun. We did the Vault, and by 'did', I mean failed, but still thoroughly enjoying the experience. If we were in Amsterdam for an extra day, we would have definitely gone back. I've already told many friends at home that we need to arrange a trip to Amsterdam specifically for this escape room. I honestly can't praise this experience enough.

Too tricky for us!. Having done the architect room last year, this time around we decided to tackle the vault. The tasks are extremely diverse, and require great communication between team members. We didn't make it into the vault, it's so complex and far more difficult than the architect, we would love to go back and try again!

Makes you feel like you're in a spy movie. My family and I did the Sherlocked Vault experience and it was actually incredible! This was our first 'escape room' and hopefully not our last given the outstanding experience we had. Everything seemed so realistic and had your adrenaline pumping to work out the clues. It honestly felt like we were in a spy/heist movie.

A MUST DO IN!. After hearing a lot about escape rooms, we thought it was a must do for us, we researched and came across, Sherlocked mystery experience. We booked 'The Vault' experience for 4 people very easy, I was very impressed with the communication from them, for instance they emailed me to check I understood where to meet and to confirm my phone number to be contacted. The morning of the experience I was quite nervous but as soon as it started we were fully engaged! Its just so well put together, and the team were also so helpful in some clues to guide us along the way. The set was out of this world and felt like we were in a movie set. None of us would hesitate on doing another one of Sherlocked experiences, we even tried to book another one the next day but there was no availability....ah well looks like we are heading back to Amsterdam ;-)

Wow, great experience! Must visit!. Me and my wife had "The Architect" experience (the only one with minimum of 2 people).It was great! Although, the time ran out before we had a chance to complete it, we really enjoined it. Just few more minutes and we would complete the last challenge! Despite that, it is ultimate fun and exercise for the brain. The atmosphere is like in the movie, very authentic. Adrenaline kicks in, and you, like a real detective, solves the mystery of the room. Must visit place! Note: no phones/cameras allowed!

Best escape room we've done so far. We've been to three escape rooms so far, and this one is our favorite. The room is larger than any of the other rooms we've been in, and there were also many more puzzles than the other rooms we tried.The decor is incredibly detailed and immersive, the puzzles used some really innovative mechanisms, and the story was really nicely woven into the puzzle. The staff were also really nice and helpful with hints, but weren't pushy about them!It was so much fun! Definitely do this if you're in Amsterdam and like puzzles!

Best Escape Room So Far.... We've played a few Escape rooms in the UK but Sherlocked topped them all - We played the Architect's Room & the set design is amazing - Using the Beurs van Berlage building as it's backdrop meant that the game had a feeling of authenticity other rooms have lacked. We managed to escape but the variety and ambience of the puzzle solving really clinched it for me - an must-play if you're ever in Amsterdam.

Excellent!!. This is a highly entertaining and challenging experience. We had a ton of fun and were absolutely enchanted by the adventure. We did the Architect and it was mind blowing. I definitely want to try their other experience!

amazing experience. we went once,to the architect room, and the riddles and clues were very fun and well put together. The staff were really friendly and the location was great.Totally recommend this for people who love challenges.

Totally recommend this. If ur coming to Amsterdam i really recommend that u try this escape room. It was an amazing experience. By far the best thing I've done in Amsterdam. It was challenging and wasn't easy. Had a great theme, and overall a good experience.

Totally immersive experience. We did the vault break in game and would highly recommend it. The experience was totally immersive and starts unlike any other escape game I've tried. The challenges were tough but solvable and the staff were fantastic. I would suggest going for a late night session too as it adds to the atmosphere.

Awesome Experiences. We visited twice, to go to both escape rooms. Both are awesome! A great, historic, atmosphere, partially due to the integration into the beautiful Beurs van Berlage building and the way story-telling is woven into the experience and smart puzzles! The two escape rooms differ im difficulty but I would recommend both to anyone looking for a challenging, atmospheric experience!

Great experience. We tried the architect (6 of us) and it was certainly the best escape room experience we ever had. The atmosphere is great and the host was kind and knew when to direct it in the right direction. Looking forward to try the vault on our next visit.

Wow😃. We signed up in advance (if recommend on line booking before you go) on the advise of a friend who had already experienced 'Sherlocked'. It seemed a little bit pricey, after all it's just a room, right? Wrong!....... It's a brilliant experience that lasts around 80-90 minutes (70 minutes maximum 'doing' the activity) We went as a family of four with two smart 18 and 19 year old girls and it was a challenge. If you like puzzles and secret stuff you'll love it. We'd never been to Amsterdam before and there's so much to see but this was the highlight . We have tried one other similar experience but it doesn't compare, this gets 10/10.... Just do it! Thanks 'Sherlocked' you were awesome

Best Escaperoom in the NL. I've done the architect last year which was super back then and recently The Vault. I can't put into words how awesome this break-in experience was. By far the best escaperoom I've done so far in the NL. Break wrecking puzzles, some very inventive technical aspects and the most impressive surroundings you can imagine. They have the coolest gigantic save I've ever seen. If you go to Amsterdam this should be one of the few things you shouldn't miss!

Best escape room ever. If your visiting Amsterdam, don't leave without doing the vault. It was hands down the best escape room I've ever done. It was so exciting. It had all the best elements. Do this, don't miss out!

One of the best we've tried!. This is one of the best escape rooms we've tried. We were only two persons, and did The Architect. You might benefit from being more than two, but it's possible, and we just made it on time. Great story, and innovative room.
Best Escape Room!. I had a group of 6 and between us we'd done a few escape rooms - sherlocked was easily the best one we've done. Its imaginative and great fun - our hour (well just under!) flew by.

Really cool!. We went in "The Vault" room with a group of five friends. Work together keep sharing the hints you find and you'll manage. The atmosphere they created is just fantastic, the location is inside the original Caveau of the Beurs! We felt like secret agents in action, definitely good for a group of friends, but i would go also with my family.

The best escape game in europe... at the moment. we played many escape game around europe and this today is the absolute best. great place and full of atmosphere, plot twists and challenging puzzles. Try it, try it, try it
Excellent experience. THE coolest escape room experience activity I have tried! Very well organized with cool and original features. I liked it very much! Highly recommend

The Architect is great for teams of two!. This was the first time that my girlfriend and I tried an escape room and even with just a team of two it was great fun. I think that it was quite well-pitched. The puzzles were challenging, but not so difficult that you left feeling stupid. The staff know just when to redirect you if they see that you are stuck for a while.We were not successful in the end, but the staff were very friendly and made us feel positive and like we had done well.Lots of fun, and highly recommended.

Sherlocked Indubitably . Spent a 3 day trip in the Dam on a Stag do for my youngest son, he booked a lock in game at SHERLOCKED what a great experience 6 of us took the challenge and managed to complete it. No secrets given away except to say GO FOR IT a very brilliant game that will test your skills in a set time. Worth every Euro.... we are looking for other Sherlock puzzles around the World The Challenge is On do try it you'll be hooked

Family fun. This was our first escape room experience and we were not disappointed. There is not much you can do to prepare for this, but do listen to the host before you go in, work together and keep talking to each other. We managed to escape but the clock ticks fast.

Complete novices - will be back for more!. Neither of us had ever done an escape room and literally trusted the trip advisor reviews by just going for it without any idea of what to expect. Could not have been a better decision - it has easily been the most exciting part of our trip. It is all done to the highest quality - our host was very friendly, setting/props were truly believable and most importantly, we were 100% engaged with it for an hour. Thoroughly recommend if you like a mystery/challenge and have never tried this as it seems from reviews that this is one of the best escape rooms anywhere in the world and we would certainly agree! Thank you

The Vault: First time experience of an escape room, WAS NOT disappointed, excellent!. I booked this activity for a group of 4 whilst on a lads break in Amsterdam. As this was the first time for doing such an activity we don't know what to expect. At the beginning we were given a back story to the room puzzle, after that we were locked in a room of well thought out challenges to solve to escape the room. Not to spoil anyone's experience I will just say the challenges require team work, thinking and all of your sensors. If you are lucking to do something fun and different in Amsterdam I would fully recommend this activity ran by very enthusiastic and friendly staff.
so fun. great activity nicely organized by friendly people, five of us worked hard, did not succeed but came close, highly recommend
Awesome!. Just an incredible experience of teamwork and accomplishment. A great story with many cool puzzles that made our brains work! Highly recommended.

The Vault: Amazing location and great fun!. This was my first escape room experience ever, and I was very sceptical at first because I'm not usually a big fan of riddles and puzzles. But this turned out to be really fun! The location was amazing, and really got you into the mood. I felt very adventurous ;-)The friends I went with are "Escape room experts", one of them has done no less than 8 different escape rooms. They said the "Architect" (the other escape room by Sherlocked) was their number 1 out of all escape rooms they had done. They said they liked the riddles better, compared to the Vault (the one I went to with them), because they found them more challenging. But they all agreed that the Vault had the best location, and that it was one of the best escape rooms they had done. Also, I should say that we only just made it at the Vault and only because we got a few tips when we got stuck, so don't think it was too easy ;-) Anyway, I guess I am hooked now, and I will try the Architect escape room, too :-)

Great way to spend an hour . Took my 13yr old son to Sherlocked for his first escape room experience. We had an excellent time, from beginning to end, thanks to the professionalism and attention to detail of the Sherlocked team. We spent a very enjoyable hour trying to figure out the 'Architect' puzzle, with just enough tips to ensure our enthusiasm levels were maintained throughout. Thanks again!

Great Fun, Very Challenging!. We went as a team of mother, daughter, and son. We were a bit too slow in the beginning, which cost us needed time. Another 5 minutes, and we'd have been out. Darn! Very doable activity, though. Loads of fun! We were so immersed, that we rather lost track of time. Highly recommend the experience!
Sherlocked is awedome. The architect was just amazing, we did not expect the surprises along the way and it was a real highlight of our Amsterdam experience. Thoroughly recommend

Great "Escape" the room !. Super activity to do to have some fun ! Really good one in the "Escape the room" field, a little different from a reguler "Escape" ! If you like those kind of game, definitely do this one !

Simply a great escape room. I have done several escape rooms. The architect is the best. Good story, good props, innovative puzzles. Sometimes you have a room with several boxes, all with combination locks. thats ok, but not great. Sherlocked clearly wants to stay away from offering standard rooms. Definitely worth the money and since i'm Dutch that means something :)
Amazing fun! . Very authentic & challenging, lots of fun!! Visited with two of my friends, would be suited to all age groups though. Would defo do again!

Fantastic experience for family. We had the pleasure of tackling The Architect tonight and give it our highest recommendation for all, but we will focus our comments towards other families with kids/teens. Our children are ages 9, 11, and 13yrs and we had done one "escape room" prior to this (the previous experience was helpful, but by no means necessary to enjoy this activity). The Architect adventure is exciting, challenging and surprising in numerous ways that reflect great creativity and originality. Everyone in our family was able to contribute and was entirely immersed in the experience. We would suggest that there be at least 2 adults for an adventure like this and definitely it is necessary that some of the kids are somewhat older (12yrs and above) so they can be more involved in puzzle solving. That said, younger children provide their unique perspective - and good ears and eyes that can sometimes be key to finding or solving something that adults struggle with. This is a fantastic way to spend time together as a family. It requires true teamwork and cooperation. Siblings need to support and listen to one another in order to be successful...and are thrilled by the fruits of their joint efforts! We hope others have as much fun as we did.

5man group was wowed by the vault . This was our first escape room and didnt know much about them. We were surprised by the Whole setup that was extremely Well done. The staff was amazing, the location and all the riddles. We didnt make it :( We Will advice people to listen to the objective carefully, because we had a Guy Who misplaced a puzzle piece so we could nt solve the puzzle. It was by far my very Best experience in Amsterdam and a completely worth every penny and more.

Absolutely amazing experience!!. The Vault - first ever break-in experienced and really was the best type of 'escape room' that we have played. The whole set up; location, staff, timing, props, puzzles... everything was so well thought out and put together! Really cannot recommend this experience enough, you HAVE to try this out!!

Like a movie. We knew Victor and his mates are true wizards. The Architect was a very neat escape room with great details and unexpected situations. But, when trying to open The Vault, the escape room experience just gets to another level. If you have seen the Oceans twelve movies, you can imagine what it feels like to play this game. Your actors skills should be good and your concentration and communication even better. This one is tough and time flies for sure when you're having fun. Only 5% of the players manage to open The Vault. We didn't unfortunately. But, I'll be back!

Simply enthralling. Me and my family's first experience of the sort. Excellent overall: the staff, the games, the wow factor. We've been to a few other escape rooms since but this one still remains our number one pick.

Great team building with special puzzles and great staff. We had our team (5p) event at the Architect rooms and everybody had a great team. Challenging puzzles for experienced escapees and first timers with different technical tricks and solutions I personally haven't seen yet.We got helped twice by Yoka and it was right at the right time and the right amount of help as she still didn't make it easy.We got out 8 minutes before our time ran out and now proudly carry our secret society pins. The location is also as perfect as it gets.
The Vault. Great experience, all in English so no language problems. You are involved from the very beginning and definitely need to think out of the box!

Awesome experience but poor staff. The staff were really nice, but at one point, we were stuck. They gave us hints that led us to something we already found. They weren't paying attention I guess. Kind of disappointing. Not to mention that we were going at a speed that wasn't as fast as possible or panicky because we knew that we had 12 minutes left, but just then, the operator person called and said sorry your time is up. ???!?!! They said that "sometimes" the clock resets itself... Thanks for the heads up! It was really fun and would do another escape room again. Glad we did it, but too bad we were misled.

Super Awesome. A must have done activity! We did the Architect with a group of 4 and it was an awesome experience, very well balanced assignments both for beginners as experts :), beautiful room..! we are looking forward to the Vault!

Amazing experience - best part of our trip! Great value for money & a fantastic unique attraction. Travelled as a party of 4 for a 50th Birthday, this was a first 'locked room' experience for any of us & we had no idea what to expect. Seems like a nutty thing to pay a decent sum of mobey to be locked in a room for an hour - turns out best decision we made all weekend!Excellent interactive attraction where nothing is as it seems. You need to work as a team & use all of your senses to ensure success. We achieved it with 1 minute to spare! recommended 100%

Done them both. both are amazing!. The Architect is the easier one to do. You start in one room and have to get out. Really good experience. The Vault is half an hour longer where you must break into a Vault. This experience was amazing, very exciting and an adrenaline rush! we missed the exit just by 20 seconds..

Awesome!!!. What a fantastic thing to do in Amsterdam!! Nice central location but you don't even know it's there. Well organised from the moment you arrive. Thoroughly enjoyed. Would recommend this to anyone travelling to Amsterdam.
Well put together escape room. This is one of the better escape rooms in Amsterdam. The locks are in good shape and so are the other hints/objects.

Hen Party Escape. My fab friend had organised Sherlocked for my hen party! And it was so fab! We had a 'break in' rather than a 'break out' experience! So so fun! We really got into it! A lot of time effort and creativity has went into this game! Would 100% recommend! Also in a really central location which is super for tourists like us! Great job!

The Vault: best escape room ever!. "Sherlocked" was my first escape room and I loved it. I did several others throughout the Netherlands which all seemed pretty much the same but "The Vault" is next level, Escape Room 2.0!I allready got excited after the introduction video and the starting location, and from there on it only got better. You have to put in effort to get started, there are actors involved, the puzzles are creative, hard to solve and the storyline is amazing. This truly is the best Escape Room I've ever been to, and I doubt I'll ever get to do a better one.
Great & Different. I've been to Sherlock with a group of colleague's and it was a great experience! The room is set up well, has a few scares and the host was great. Would recommend to everyone!

Are you a hardcore escape room fan? If so, don't miss this one.. Escape rooms are a newfound passion for us, and we’ve been to a handful in The Netherlands. This one is at the top of our list for several reasons. First, the host was very, very good – he understood the pageantry and atmosphere that is needed with the introduction and back story to the room. Second, the room itself was deeply convincing, and had some highly unique aspects to it that were unexpected. Prior to this room, we only failed to get out of one escape room, and I was really disappointed when that happened (brooding and cranky actually). Well, the third reason this place is at the top of our list is because although we didn’t get out of this one, I didn’t feel disappointed – this room beat us fair and square. There were only two of us, and we just plain ran out of time. We can admit defeat and we give a respectful tip of the hat to this room and declare it better than us. In fact, we had considered doing it again to give this one more shot. If you’re a fan of escape rooms, don’t miss this one.

Never had such a good time before! Don't miss this if you are in Amsterdam. I've done escape rooms in my own town and enjoyed them, but this place blows them all away. The setting, set setup and the quality is of the scale. Its like comparing your local traveling amusement park to Disneyland. The level of refinement, quality, thought and execution are beyond anything I could have expected. The staff was wonderful and performed beyond anything we could have expected. We did both the Architect and the Vault. I recommend the Architect for first time people and if you are ready for the big one, move on the the Vault. We solve the Architect with 4 seconds to spare but came up short on the Vault. However, we were the last people for the night, 23:58, so when the timer ran out, they didn't stop the game. They allowed us to keep going for another 30+ mins and that was great, as we were able to see more of the game that way. Very nice of them to do that and stay that late. So, if you can hang out that long, I recommend doing the last event option for the day, as they won't have anyone scheduled after you then you might get to see more of the game if you falter. I can't say enough about how great this experience was.

Amazing experience!. There are several games. We did "the Architect" with 2 adults and 4 kids from 10-15. It was fun for everyone and all participated in the finding the clues. We also did "the Vault", It was more difficult, 4 adults, and they also had great fun. Definately one spot to recommend in Amsterdam. The people are also very nice, answering emails even late at night.

Great experience . This was a first for us so we were unsure what to expect, but reading the reviews it seemed like fun so we went along... and we weren't disappointed, it was brilliant!! We did The Architect and solved it with 3 minutes to spare... what an adrenalin rush!! There were 4 adults in our group which seemed the right number, too many and it could be a bit crowded, but the main thing to remember is to work as a team. Thought it was the highlight of the holiday but then my partner proposed to me in Dam Square, so it came in a close second

Fun well-designed activity. The mystery was well-designed, challenging but not too difficult. The room have beautiful architecture and very nice features. I would recommend it for groups of 4 or more.

Fun Team Building - Escape Room Game. Escape room- The Architect - I've never done anything like this before. I spent 1 hour as a team member in a break out of Hendrick Berlage's office. It was really fun mystery. The time passed very quickly. The last 10 minutes was really exciting as everything came together.

Thrilling and challenging. This experience blew me away. Both The Architect and The Vault are thrilling and challenging in a well thought through story line. The convincing interior design together with the smart use of technology makes this an experience you won't forget. Don't miss this

Sherlocked's 'The Architect'. Well-designed and nicely decorated escape room containing lots of logical puzzles guiding you towards an escape. The room encourages teamwork which makes the escape room even more interesting. This was the fifth escape room I have done and this was the best one so far. Really good entertainment!

An adrenaline rush!. One of the best attractions we visited in Amsterdam. I was worried it may really easy but it's just the right level of challenging. Good story line too and friendly enthusiastic staff!

Had a great time. This was my fist time I did anything like this, I really enjoyed myself. Interesting location in the old stock exchange as well. I would recommend this to anyone looking to do something a little different in Amsterdam .
A nice place to be locked in for an hour or so. If you want to enjoy a piece of architecture and enjoy a game at the same time, make sure you book this Sherlocked in Amsterdam.

Fun experience!. Fun experience! At first I was not sure what quite to expect; Sherlocked's 'the Architect' pulls you into the basements of the historical Beurs van Berlage building for an exciting game that asks for outstanding teamwork and good nerves ;-). I would highly recommend if you are looking for an original activity in the city center of Amsterdam.

Greatest live game experience ever!!!. Absolute must to experience when visiting Amsterdam. Great to do with friends, family or co-workers. We did "The Vault", nice thing about it is that it's with live actors and you are right in the middle of it. Games and puzzles are for everyone alike and sometimes very challenging. Would really recomend anyone to try it out. Game on! 🔑

The Vault. A next level break-in experience. After we did Sherlocked's 'The Architect', we craved for more and decided to go to 'The Vault'. Although we didn't manage to complete this one, it was a worthwhile experience that is up to par with The Architect. Beautifully designed, interesting mechanics and simply put just a very fun experience.
Great Fun. Have done a few escape games but none on the scale of this! Great fun, great puzzles and overall a great way to spend and hour or so!

It sparks a whole new adventurous side of yourself!. Great experience from beginning to the end. You feel like a real Sherlock Holmes trying to solve the mystery. Would definitely recommend this for everybody who can spare 1,5 hours!

Fantastic and challenging fun. Five of us took part in the Sherlocked game and we had a fantastic time. Without giving away any of the surprises it kept us all on our toes and we were so close to completing the challenge!We especially liked many of the elements around the actual room game. For example, we had to meet at a different location to collect our 'mission' and break into the room. The interaction with the staff really added to the experience.I have never played a game on this scale and we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The one note of caution I would give people is that some of the tasks are quite physical so don't be surprised if at least one of you has to crawl about!A great way to spend an hour and a half and I would thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam

A really great and adventurous experience!. Waow! I've just played the Architect with 5 friends and I'm still excited! This was my first "escape room" and I can't wait to play another. Sherlock's "The Vault" is now on top of my list. Without spoiling anything, I can say that the Architect will surprise you, challenge you to work together and amaze you with cool details. The decor is stunning and the whole story behind the Architect is really interesting. Just go and check it out, you will certainly not regret it! ;)
An absolute thrill-ride of an experience!. From start to finish, The Vault offers an amazing ride. Great crew, exciting puzzles and mysteries, beautiful location!

Wonderful experience. We were a bit short of time to solve the mystery but we had so much fun in this room that we forgot about this frustration. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a real brain challenge.
The best game ever. I have played lot of games but this one was totally different. It was so exciting that I still don't realize the game is over.

Not to be missed!. The Architect blew us away with the unique puzzles and the amazing interior. 6 of us played and enjoyed every minute. On top of that the location is easy to find near the Dam square. Definitely add this experience to your trip!

Amazing Experience. My two colleagues and me were in Amsterdam for the UpTheGame Escape game Convention. Of course we had to play some games...We heard a lot of sherlocked so we booked quite in advance to get a slot.As we run an escape game ourselves we had high expectations and sherlocked did not disappoint us. The quality of storytelling, design and items are extrordinary. We saw some effects we havent seen in a live escape game before and we played a lot.So Big Ups for sherlocked....we highly recommend to play it!!!We played "the architect" and next time in amsterdam we definitely try "vault".Thank you to our game master who did a very good job and the whole sherlocked team for designing such a good game.

Superbly organised and immaculately planned to the last detail - Tons of fun!. I did the escape-room exercise at the Sherlocked venue in Amsterdam last week as a team building exercise and I was thoroughly impressed by every aspect of the way it was planned. Our hostess, Tanja, set the background story out with great enthusiasm before we entered the escape room. She was detailed in her explanation and prepared to answer our questions about the mystery without throwing away hints. Then we entered the room and found it extremely well planned and accurate to the last detail. Every last object and mark in the room was put in there after due thought and served a purpose. The antiques in the room helped further establish the storyline - and from sounds to smells - it was all there to get us engulfed in the mystery. The level of difficulty was just right - not so hard that hardly anyone solves it, and not as easy that it may be solved within 15-20 mins. Great for team building or just some fun with friends! Highly recommended, well done to the creators!

Puzzled in Amsterdam. An experience not to be missed. Team work required to solve puzzles. We all loved the game (ages 11-50+) and would recommend it thoroughly. Will be back to have a go at the other room very soon. Easy to find, 5 minutes from Amsterdam Central Station.

The fact we didn't make it didn't influence the fun factor at all!. In a historical building you must find your way in a beautiful room. The details are superb. Some clues are quite difficult, but just when you think it is impossible you will get some help. It has some nice surprises and really unexpected twists. I was with friends and my children (14 and 15). It was our first escape experience and we immediately decided that we would love to play some more. Just one clue.... Stick together :-)

Wow! The Vault. One of the most amazings escape rooms I've ever done...and I own one. The story is really well themed since the beggining to the end. The scenery is unique in and old building and the clues are well built mixing mechanical, logical with a lot of technology.Congrats guys!

Fantastic experience!. We loved every minute of our experience at Sherlocked. Much better than the other break out experiences we have done. The game is really well thought out and the attention to detail is obvious. Really atmospheric and lots of fun!
Sherlocked experience. Great fun and very well prepared investigation pattern, difficult but manageable within timing provide good team work.

Awesome and unique experience!. My friends and I did the vault break-in experience of Sherlocked. It was my first time to do an escape- (or in this case break-in) room and I absolutely loved it! The game is excellent and well-thought-out. You can see that the makers have carefully considered and planned everything well in advance. You are not bound to one room, but you have to move quickly from one location to another, which makes the experience very adventurous. And it is not easy at all! Especially if you are with six girls who all yell and shout at the same time, hence we didn't make it;). However, I highly recommend this game to anyone!

Absolutely brilliant!. This was a great experience and I can only recommend it. The room was much bigger than expected, everything was very professionally set up with nice effects and challenging riddles to solve...we went with 4 people and did not manage to get out in the end...we will definitely go back to try the other room.

We want to do it again!. 'The Architect' was a thrilling experience. The building and the (beautiful) design of the rooms immediately take you back in time. You become the leading role in an exciting story which titillates all your senses. Teamwork and super sleuth qualities are required to solve the mystery as soon as possible!
MUST!. Sherlocked is an awesome sensation that you simply MUST do when visiting Amsterdam. The story, the details, the journey, the tension.. They all add to the magic of the ride.

Sherlocked. This is a fun experience for families or groups of friends and takes about 60-70mins to complete!!!! You are challenged to find various clues and ideally the tasks should be completed within 60mins!!! This was a lot of fun for our family and we managed to work as a team and resolve the conundrum in about 53mins which was cool!!! Thoroughly enjoyable and one of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam, would highly recommend it!!!!

An authentic magical experience!. The building itself, the clearness of the concept, the beautiful details. This was an experience to remember. Our team of 6 worked our way out of the room in 38 minutes. Communication, a curious mind and a logical thinking spirit will make your mind go crazy about Sherlocked Amsterdam. An absolute must do for people that like to be surprised as well as people that forgot how wonderful it is to create a curious mind. Thanks Sherlocked Amsterdam for inviting team Buro Curious!! Keep up this wonderful maker spirit and fill the world with beauty.

Do not miss this Wonderful Adventure. We were a group of 6. My husband and I, two 9 year olds, a 12 year old and their granny. We did the architect. The whole experience was wonderful. Everyone considered it an Amsterdam highlight. Having done 2 escape rooms in Budapest previously we considered this the best we'd experienced to date. The girls who briefed us before and afterwards was incredibly welcoming and encouraging and contributed hugely to the whole experience. This is a fantastic activity for young and old. Don't miss it!!
Great experience. Fantastic experience - definitely not your traditional escape room. Very immersive and well thought-out!
Do it!. Me and my team of four had a great time! We managed to get out but it was not easy, we made use of full hour. Sherlocked is perfect for the team building events.

Great experience!. So I had the pleasure of doing the architect escape room at Sherlocked. You have to try to escape the room by solving al kinds of puzzles and riddles. It's nice to do this with a group of at least 4 (we were with the six of us). You get one hour to get out, and if succeeded you get a nice small souvenir and your picture taken afterwards. It's really a cool experience and we've already planned our next visit to do the other experience they have. A must see/do! :D

Mindblowing fun!. This experience was absolutely worth it! A perfect blend of puzzles and suspense and riddles made the time fly by! You definitely need to stay calm and think...some things can be a bit challenging. Pay close attention to your surroundings and to what your teammates are saying/finding. There is no way you will regret this! We started with The Architect and are already planning our visit to their second room!

Best Escape Game so far, but a mistake almost ruined it.. I've done already 6 escape games in different cities. By far this was the greatest one. The atmosphere, the location, the riddles itself, the effects, the surprises....ARE JUST THE BEST EVER.Unfortunately due to problem (laptop sound was on mute and unable to activate) we were stuck for at least 15 minutes until the gamemaster came in to help us out.If you're in Amsterdam, go for it! It's worth the money!

Great Fun . Our group of four friends did the 'vault' on a Friday evening and it was great fun! We were all new to escape rooms but found it really enjoyable, we got to grips with things quickly and all enjoyed trying to crack to code. We didn't manage to break in, but we all agreed it was fun trying and we would do it again. Great operation in place resulting in a great experience hosted by great staff. Go try it.

Best Room we did so far!. This is not your generic review. That one is from a couple which already played in several rooms and was ABSOLUTELY captivated by the atmosphere, details and creative/unique riddles of this one!There are sick mechanisms and unexpected twists unlike anything we've seen in other rooms (in multiple countries). Bonus; it's in an epic building.For hours after the experience we've been recapping and running the riddles over and over again in our minds grinning like kiddies admiring their newly built lego fort.A must do!.

Very Impressed and Totally Surprised!. I didn't know what to expect when I went to Sherlocked but it blew my mind! A great way to spend time with friends, very challenging, and extremely well put together. You can tell the care that went in to making it a good experience. Well worth the money, well worth the time!Afterwards we went for a drink and we couldn't stop talking about how much fun we'd had. And we kept trying to open all the secret compartments in the bar we were at.Oh, and we totally made it out with 11 seconds to spare ;) 10200 ftw!

Team "modern family" party. We did the sherlocked escape room game and i was extremely surprised by the way this gameplay was supported by the actors and what they let us do in this perfect located adventure game in the building "Beurs van Berlage"! A must do for fans of this kinda gamed.

Best "escape" room ever.. The best escape room I have ever done. We did “The Vault”, which is not your traditional escape room. Rather than trying to escape, you are trying to break in. Unlike most escape rooms, this one is interactive with the uses of walkie talkies and other other items. Other than that, I can’t say anything else or it will ruin the experience. Although we didn’t “win”, we will be back to finish were we left off. This is a must do and is worth every penny.

Up for the next level! Great!. I really enjoyed the evening at the Architect's room at Sherlocked. We've managed to escape om time.:) Yeeehhh! Great location, challenging assignments, mysterious plot - love it!

Best money I have ever spent. Me and my friends went to Sherlocked this month and I'm out of words. Best experience of my life. It was intense and full of suprises. Nothing ever is what it seems.My advice: GO AND NEVER LEAVE!If I do go back to Amsterdam is to just get on a plane, land and go straight to Sherlocked to try the other experience. LOVED IT!!!!

Loads of fun. I wasn't really expecting much as adventure rooms aren't really my cup of tea, but I actually had a really good time! We did the Vault which was a lot of fun. We were about 10% from the end (apparently) though the people running it said we actually made it further than a lot of teams. It was a good mix of fun bits and trying to work out the puzzles. It is a bit pricey, but I'd definitely recommend it even if you're not really sure about the whole adventure rooms concept.

Didn't get to finish it but left with WOW factor. They start you off in a weird place don't think of anything negative it's part of the game. They have gone outside the box with the escape games. It was truly amazing and if I come back to Amsterdam need to do it all over again and hopefully I can finish it.
Amazing.... We went there with friends and their kids and did the architect. The atmosphere is really mystical and the riddles are very cleverly made. I can definitely suggest to go there ...

So much fun!! A MUST!!. Me and three friends grouped together for Sherlocked and had the time of our lives!! We worked together and laughed the whole time. I highly recommend doing this. It's great for any group/family.

Stupidly fun!. Me and my three friends went to this attraction and it was by far the most unique and interesting thing we did in Amsterdam! Incredibly thought out, this required team-work and everyone's unique brand of smarts. Perfect for first time puzzlers (like ourselves) the room was challenging but not to the point where we couldn't finish in time! Above all else, this experience was a very fun, unique laugh which also challenged us mentally. This has made all three of us want to continue with our 'puzzle solving' ways. Brava!

Brilliant!!. Loved it!! I did this with my husband, adult son & friend and we escaped with seconds to spare!! This was the first time in an escape room for my husband and myself but hope it won't be the last! It was so much fun. I recommend Sherlocked to everyone. It's a great experience!!

Absolutely fantastic. What a fantastic game we loved it six girls on a weekend in Amsterdam. We completed it in 44 minutes with no clues our only regret not having time to complete the Vault as well. Truely a great time was had by all and all of us contributed towards the solution THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

First time in an escape room for all of us. Conclusion = fun!. We went with a group of 5 adults and 1 child. It was the first time in an escape room for all of us. We all had a good time, especially the child. I think we would all do another for sure!

Something different. I can't explain how much I loved sherlocked! My boyfriend and I unfortunately couldn't get the very last step to escape the room but we had a great time trying! The girl looking after us said we did well for a two person team but to be honest it was the experience more than anything that made it so fun. It was so authentic. It was my first time trying something like this and we did it for my birthday which was that day. I want to try more of them. I just hope they live up to sherlocked!

great room, lots of fun. we had a lot of fun in the room, the riddles were interesting and not too hard, the atmosphere is great and so is the theme (and following the theme of course).some thinking is in order, some key finding and some parallel work and communication is required.oh, and DO NOT take the table apart ;)

Great family outing. My wife and I along with our two adult children had a great time at Sherlocked. This was our first escape room experience and it did not disappoint. We were not able to complete but we all hope to return again.

great family fun!. We are a family of 5 with older kids and we did The Vault. This was our first escape game so we didn't really know what to expect. However, we were intrigued and captivated from the moment of the email a few days before to the finish of the game an hour and a half after starting. It was brilliant fun and a memorable birthday treat for my son. It's described as "challenging" which is fair, but not impossible! We didn't complete it but came very close and loved the challenge. The staff are great and it's very well done throughout. Obviously, I can't give much away, but the idea is you're "breaking in" rather than trying to escape and there's lots of twists and turns along the way. I'd highly recommend this for adults or families with teenage kids. Brilliant!

The architect vs The vault. I have done both the rooms at Sherlocked. The architect was very good and very enjoyable. The game was well designed with a nice mix of puzzles. For this room I would say 5 stars for sure. For the vault I was very disappointed. The room is trying to be different so I can appreciate the designers took a risk but it just didn't work. There also seemed to be a few red herrings that caused confusion more than anything else. Of all the rooms I've done (over 10) this was the least enjoyable room. In conclusion my advice is 100% to do the architect but I would not recommend the vault.

Best escape room so far!. I'm a fan of the escape rooms and I already did 6 of them.... This was the best by far!I did "the architect" with 4 other friends and it was super funny!Everything was really really good: the story, the setting, the atmosphere, the design and the puzzles.I loved the details of the rooms and the variation of the puzzles.It is advised for group of at least 4 person.

Mesmerizing. I am proud to have been part of the very first team to ever play Sherlocked's first game, The Architect. It opened up a world for me, that I was so mesmerized by that I came back to play the game twice more (with different groups each time)

What a thrill. Ringing the bell at the Beurs van Berlage at 8pm is already quite cool. Then taken into the basement and seeing the building empty is something else. But then we were locked up and left alone to find a way out of Berlage's secret office. Amazing.You really don't think of anything but the next clue while the clock is ticking. Not finding the solution or the next clue is frustrating, managing to get a step further a relief. Then getting out in time, worth it!Clever clues, beautiful set and a great story. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.
Great team building exercise!. First time here! It was really interesting and fun to do with my committee as we all had to do a team building exercise and what better way to do it than Sherlocked!!!!

Feeling as a part of the story. Its located in the centre of Amsterdam, at a historic building. The session is about 1,5 - 2 hours. Bring yourself, some good (or forthcoming) friends, and enjoy. Take the whole thing serious, and you find yourself in the middle of a movie. Its a lot of fun!Our best decision that weekend visit was to try this concept.

My first escape room. For sure this has been the first of the escape rooms I'll be doing. Amazing adventure and one of the best thing to do in a rainy day, as it happens often in Amsterdam. I strongly sudgest to give it a try!
Beyond expectations . First irl escape room. Beyond expectations. Always a new riddle. Always a new puzzle to solve. Expect to be overwhelmed. Thank you for an amazing experience.

Loved 'The Architect'. This was our first escape room experience and it was better than I ever expected! Lots of fun and completely different to anything I've ever done before! Would love to go back to Amsterdam because it's such a beautiful city and if I ever got the chance to come back I would definitely book 'The Vault' experience as I know it would be just as good if not better! I would definitely recommend 'The Architect' to anyone wanting to have a bit of craic and do something different :)

What a great experience. The experience and challenge are great. You're taken on an adventure that is well worth your time. Loved it! We had a lot of fun and are looking forward to our next time here... of course in another new escape room experience.

A locked-up adventure beneath one of Amsterdam's most architectural acclaimed buildings. Since they opened their doors (and locked people behind it) we wanted to experience 'the Architect' by Sherlocked Amsterdam. They are number 1 of Amsterdam for a reason! I always think it is very important that an escape room's theme is chosen because of its surroundings and by what the existing building is trying to tell with its looks and feel. The Architect uses the historical background of the beautiful Beurs van Berlage building in a believable but mysterious way. We played the room with 6 friends and all of us had a part in solving the bigger picture. Without knowing we actually set a new time record!!! We can't wait to play the second adventure (The Vault) that Sherlocked has in store for us with hopefully many other top quality mysterious assignments to follow!

Loved "The Architect". My first escape room experience, but this one will be hard to beat. Great story, wonderfully designed surroundings, good puzzles and surprises around every corner. My adrenaline was pumping and I was sad to see it come to an end. Now I want to play the other room: The Vault! :)
Absolutely fabulous!. What a GREAT experience! Sherlocked is both fun & challenging. Lovely scenery, excellent story and awesome details. Thanks :)

Best adventure I've had in a long time. Do you like an adventure? This is the best experience I've had since a while. A perfectly crafted mental ride that makes you want to continue on and on, it's almost sad to finish it. But oh so exhilarating all the way through. The ambience is amazing and the clues are difficult but definitely doable. I'm hardcore fan now of escape the room!
Amazing . very fun and interesting experience!!! really recommend to go with friends and family. fun. Thank You
Great!. Great experience! recommend to everyone who wants to do something different with friends and like to play games. It's an unsual experience where you join all the fun with some brain skils

Great fun and something to exercise the grey cells. Not having done a locked room adventure experience before we were not sure what to expect.It was great fun, especially for our family with two adults and two kids aged 15 and 17. The host was friendly and helpful, and the setting felt authentic enough. The challenges were varied and not too easy, nor too taxing. By the end we were all very into it and very glad to finish just in time. Ideal family and/or teen activity

A whole new level of escape room experience.. A great story, a concept that starts outside of the room with a team on a mission, that drives on a real global issue. The puzzles are hard (experienced players do better). The space feels real. And the game is layered with twists and levels (in thinking and in spaces). Go dive into it!
Really good. It was an amazing experience, recommended for both visitors and residents. Would definetely suggest, staff really friendly.

Incredibly fun experience. We arrived there not really knowing what to expect and it turned out to exceed whatever expectations we had by far! Incredibly fun activity to do with friends, we were so hyped solving all the clues that we didn't even pay attention to time pasisng! The place is amazing and all the details in the game are so well done. Totally recommended!

Awesome Concept, Amazing Staff. Having never been to an escape room, I was a little skeptical about the experience but it turned out to be the most fun I've had in a long time. We were a group of 6, and although we didn't make it out in time, the game kept us on our toes the entire time and we're all looking forward to trying out the "break in" experience next time.

Awesome experience. Sherlocked was my second escape room and I cant even compare the two. The Architect is a next level of escape rooms, the room itself and all the details are mind-blowing. We experienced all kind of emotions, from pure happiness when we solved a difficult task to frustration when we didnt know how to proceed. Although we didn't finish in time, our host was supernice and showed us what would we find at the end ( and its really impressive). I'd say it is one of the must-do activity in Amsterdam, we were international group of 6 people and I think we will never forget this :) Looking forward to try The Vault!

Wonderful experience!!!. I went their with my family and the experience was wonderful. The hosts were amazing. Their performance made you really believe the story. About the activity itself I cannot tell you much but be prepared because you will be astonished!!

Super fun!. A really cool (and immersive) experience. Unfortunately we didn't finish the Vault - leaving us with many unanswered questions - but it was a great challenge, kept us active and thinking. Would definitely recommend it!!!!

First Escape Room! . We arrived to sherlocked on our first trip to Amsterdam not knowing what to expect. Right from the start, we were intrigued and trying to search for hidden clues. Our host was wonderful and gave us a mysterious introduction to the room. Once in there, we were utterly absorbed in hunting for clues and tying to get ourselves out. It was so cleverly done and there were lots of surprises that kept us all on our toes. We were thrilled when we managed to get out and now can't wait to try another escape room soon. Thanks for a great experience!

Great experience. We were a group of friends, one group tried to break out while the others were on a different game. The objective for us was not only to fulfil the task but to beat our friends time!! We were greeted, given an overview of the story and then placed in the room. What fun.We were lucky enough to escape and when we heard our friends hadn't solved their clues in time it was even better !!Definitely recommend this activity. A great way to spend an hour or two with friends!

Absolutely brilliant. We arrived at the venue, some had a little experience of these games, I had not. We were introduced to the task and then began the adventure. The clues were varied in difficulty and the time flew. We had two groups doing different tasks. So there was a little extra rivalry to beat their time as well as beat the task!! Without giving anything away we managed to complete our task while our friends didn't complete theirs !! Result !!!Strongly recommend this if you are in Amsterdam!

Great 1st experience. This is was our first experience at an escape room and didn't really know what to expect.We got taken into the building and were given some history and a storyline by the host.We entered the room and instantly you are given the first clue and you are ready to go.Without giving anything away it was a grwat way to spend our morning, kept us working together and interested throughout. Very clever.Highly recommend it.

Thrilling. Had a really good time doing The Vault with some friends, even though our problem solving skills left much to be desired. The set pieces were wonderfully engaging and set a "movie like" atmosphere on the experience. Would recommend to anyone looking to test their skills and have a good time!

Intriguing, fun and very well made. Our very friendly host gave us a lovely welcome before locking us in!!! What followed we are not allowed to say. Only that it was cryptic, fun and original. Shrelocked is a wonderful experience and you are in genuinely beautiful surroundings with antique artefacts. This is not some cheap theme park experience but an engaging way to spend a little over an hour.Unfortunately we did not escape but this didn't detract at all from the enormous fun we had. We WILL be back for their other experience.

Cool adventure!. The Architect is a great mystery experience! It's challenging (we didn't make it), fun, surprising and is certainly something you should check out if you haven't done a Sherlocked puzzle before (or if you're just visiting Amsterdam).

One hell of a ride!. We successfully escaped The Architect a couple of months ago and couldn't wait to visit The Beurs van Berlage again. The Vault was supposed to be even more spectacular and more difficult. We weren't disappointed; the setting and atmosphere were absolutely amazing. Even though we failed miserably we all had a wonderful time. Can't wait for the next room!

Awesome experience. We did The Vault challenge and it was an absolute thrill! Unfortunately we can't say too much about it, but the atmosphere was great and it was very well put together. We didn't make it in time, but since it may be one of the most complex escape room game in the world according to the creators, the experience itself made justice.
MUST DO. We went in expecting great things from this, it was way better than we thought. It was put together so well. Hats off to the technicians who put it together.An absolute must do.

Great stuff! . This escape game is so much fun! Took about 50 minutes and we loved every minute of it! Staff were friendly and inviting and the game itself was challenging, fun and exciting, exactly what you want from an escape room!

So much fun!. I visited with friends and did the Architect challenge, we loved every second of it! The game is so well set out and challenging. This was our first escape room challenge and we can't wait to book the next one! Fantastic value for money and brilliant entertainment. You must give it a go!

Awesome experience!. Great mysteries for all! My husband and I enjoyed every second of it! Will definitely return again for more. Staff was very nice and decor was really nice too, it really sets you in the mood!

The best escape room EVER!. I've played a number of escape rooms before and Sherlocked (we played The Architect) really blows the rest out of the water. Highly recommended -can't wait to play The Vault :)

Awesome puzzle. Did this one a rainy day with a bunch of friends! You're dragged into another world where you're instantly forced in the role of a detective mastermind. This is where it gets really interesting, 'cause all of your friends play that same role. Working together and listening to your fellow Sherlocks' suggestions is key to increase your chance of solving the life size puzzle! Lots of shouting, swearing, sweating, frustration and fun will follow. All components of a great puzzle in an amazing setting!

Good fun. As my first escape game/break in, I didn't know what to expect. We did the vault break in, and after initially feeling a bit silly and giggling about the game, we got really into it and started working together to solve the puzzles. We didn't manage to break in but had a great time, and all the staff were very convincing when in character. Definitely worth a visit!

Amazing !. This is by far, the most incredible escape game that we've done! For the record, we've participated on 6 escape game in France before this one. First, the building is stunning and worth the experience. To talk about the game itself, without spoiling anything, let's just say that you're in a big room and every steps doesn't require to be completly fluent in English (but good notions are needed). Every aspect of the mystery match perfectly with the background story.To conclude, if you're a big fan of escape game and you're in Amsterdam, this is THE experience you need.

Mysteriously fun!. If you're visiting the city, or even are a local, with a group of people you want to have fun with, this experience is a no brainer. So entertaining that you'll be sad when the time is over. But no worries, there's a prize at the end if you did well! :)

Very nice. I have been to a few rooms before, but this one blowed my mind!
I went with a few friends as a bachelor party.
Really worth playing this escape room!
Hope they open a second location, we live to come back.

Ruddy mysterious!. Myself and 4 friends went last night and it was incredible! So mysterious and meticulously organised. Our host was fantastic and really set the scene for us. The room is also beautiful. Highlight of our trip!

New addiction. This is so much fun. So well organized. With lots of different puzzles to solve. It keeps You allert for the full hour. All bassed on a great historic story. In a n amazing ambiance. I love it!!!!!!!

Great fun. Great fun to be had at sherlocked! It was our first escape/mystery room and we really enjoyed it. Definitely tests the mind. However, I would recommend that you go as a group (there was just two of us) it seemed like there should be more people to get through it easier. Staff were friendly and informative and rang to give us hints when needed. Would recommend a visit!

Customer service sucks. Worst escape room experience ever!. Definitely would not recommend this place. I've heard that customer service for this room sucks, but I could not imagine how bad it really is. When we've just arrived we noticed that we should call or text some guy who opens the door. After having a few calls and messages unanswered, the guy appeared in hurry to let us in. It was 20 minutes wasted in the cold. During the game my teammate got in emergency situation with his health, we tried to signal the operator but it was useless. He was unreachable. Horrible!Once the time passed we were told - that's all and we should quit. Nevertheless that we asked for final solution (having passed 95% of the quest) - they declined to give us neither time nor solution and asked for payment for the next session (start over).Me and my team are doing quests and escape rooms over the world and it's the first time that we are having such a terrible service. Demanded payment for 2nd hour of the quest, declined to help in emergency situation, made us wait in the cold outside for 20 minutes... The worst experience ever.

Just terrible experience, would not recommend at all!. Really bad experience. We've done many escape rooms around the world, and this by far is THE WORST experience.To start: We waited 20 minutes to be let in by the host.The game: Lack of instructions make the game not fun at all. Not to metion that we had an emergency during the game, partner was in extreme pain and was knocking on all doors - host did not open at all. Just terrible experience

Surreal level of immersion!. Did the vault with a company group, cannot even bring into words how fun and well crafted this escape (or break in) room is! The authenticity of the location is incredible and from the second you begin straight to the end the experience is immersive to an adrenaline inducing level. Loved it. Hands down best escape room I've visited. Can't wait to go back for the second one!
The architect escape room. I had an amazing thrilling time with friends escaping this perfectly designed room. Don't hesitate to book. Just do it!
The Vault. Hadn't done an escape room before but had a really good time attempting this with my friends, even though we were completely hopeless! Very well organized and a great experience.
fun fun fun. I recommend this game if you are in amsterdam. we were a group of 4 people , and we loved it.not easy but not very hard.

A really good and fun escape room. This escape room is awesome. Me and my friends had so much fun! The puzzles are not too hard, not too easy, the theme is fun and very well present, which makes it exciting. It has some original touches to it as well. The host was very kind an introduced to the game very well. I have played 8 escape rooms so far, and this is one of the best. Especially for bigger groups (4+ persons)

The Mystery starts before you get there! . 3 of my friends and I attempted to take on the vault! The fun started with the emails we received and the instructions of what to do on the day.
