It felt like we were really part of a heist that took part in two separate locations! We loved it so much that we booked the architect escape game right after for later that day!

The Vault experience at Sherlocked. The Vault at Sherlocked was an AMAZING experience from start to finish. It was so well done, our group didn't know who was in on the game and who wasn't. We unfortunately didn't make it to the end but every detail was great. Highly highly recommend it!

High Hopes, Utter Disappointment . My friends and I who have each done 5-7 escape rooms each in all different European countries decided to give Sherlocked a try after reading promising reviews. Sadly, everyone left with a bad taste in their mouths and frustrated with the whole experience. You go in and learn about the impressive story and history of the building, then are introduced to the room. We soon realized the gamekeeper will use a phone to communicate with the group - no doubt designed to help you in the right direction (this concept is used in every escape room we have done). However, what it turned into was the gamekeeper calling us to stop messing with the old books, or stop touching this old item, don't touch the couch ect. We began to dread every time the phone rang because we knew it was to have us stop touching something. It eventually had us tiptoeing around the place.Keep in mind, we weren't being destructive, it's just that nothing is a prop, which blows my mind because I'm used to having everything in the room being fair game to hold and study. When we were done, the gamekeeper was not friendly and seemed generally annoyed with us. Do your yourself a favor and skip Sherlocked. We went to a couple other escape rooms in Amsterdam and had a blast. Check those out instead.

Incredible first time escape room experience. Last week me and some friends went to the Vault escape room by Sherlocked. For us this was the first escape room we did but it was an incredible experience and we're sure we're going to do the second escape room by Sherlocked 'the architect' as well. The vault was thought out really well. Fun problems, awesome location and a mystical atmosphere came together. Great stuff and well worth the money!

It was great.nkids were way ahead of their daddy.. We arrived a little late. The staff were super in getting us settled and started. Some of the kids had done other escape rooms before but said this was really well done. The place is really well done. It's really nice that they take a photo of you group after. Highly recommended. It's not cheap but it's value for money.

5 star isnt enough !!. OMG - if you have teenage kids ( mine are 12/14) this is brilliant, I cant tell you too much as we are sworn to secrecy ! but all I will say is that this was by far one of the best things we did in Amsterdam , it involved thinking and working out clues using all of your senses and yes mum & dad will have a brilliant time too - its just as much fun for adults as for kids , great team effort -we all left feeling ecstatic. Cannot recommend this place highly enough -WHOLE FAMILY LOVED IT !!

Sherlocks from Downunder. A fun challenge with a variety of clues to solve. Communication and team work a must! Guidance provided at the right time, before you get too stuck! A great 'bonding' experience.

Great experience in an beautiful environment. We visited Sherlocked for our Christmas outing at work. We were surprised by the high level of detail the room was created with and the puzzles were very well designed. Won't tell you anything else as that may spoil your experience. Definitely worth going (and it is a great team building exercise as well!)

Great experience and so much fun!. We had a great time trying to solve the riddles and break into the Vault. We did not quite make it within the alloted time, but that did not make it any less fun. The setting is beautiful, the hosts are convincing in their roles, the special effects work really well and due to the time pressure, you get totally carried away. We were a team of six colleagues and we all enjoyed it. We will definitely recommend Sherlocked!

The Architect - Great game!. We played The Architect as a work team activity, what fun we had! An exciting and puzzling experience, well organized and challenging enough but not impossible. We were sad it was over!
We were a group of 4, this seemed like the perfect size team. Can't wait to try The Vault next!

The Architect. We had a really great time. It was really challenging and it was easy to do simple mistakes because you got too carried away and not stopping to think. I highly recommend this, you should not leave Amsterdam without trying it out.

The best escape room experience. This was defenitely the best escape room experience I ever had. Complex puzzles, scary effects, secret chambers, everything was there. Brilliant experience. We had so much fun with our team.

Best game out there!. Sherlocked blew Escape the rooms in New York away! The idea of having to solve things in multiple rooms and using all the players in order to accomplish and find the things you need. It was not only challenging but so much fun and enjoyable! Jacob (Mark) was very awesome too! I highly recommend this to everyone who visits Amsterdam!
Had great fun with my colleagues.. My team decided to go for this event as a team building exercise and it was great fun. Now we want to go back to try the other rooms they have there.

Adrenalin pur. Hi, after Shopping and sight seeing in Amsterdam, Sherlocked was the final piont on our Agenda.And it was the highlite of the trip , for us a family of four.After the friendly welcome and introduction, we were locked in the old and historic surrounding of H.P Berlage.... and then the clock started to tick ...Unfortunaltely against us, because we missed the final clue.Nevertheless on the way back home we had a lot of hilarious "what if" duscussion and tons of adrenaline.For sure this was not the last escape room for us.For other families: the Kids will love it. It is mysterious, thrilling, not spooky and not scary. Any member of any age - in my opinion above 10 - will be part of the game.The advices came in English, but language was not an issue and no reason for missing the last secret.Have fun and go for it!!
great fun!. We played on a sunday night, which was a perfect closing of the weekend. The game is fun, well paced and made me feel like a boy for a moment. I will look into booking another game!

Vault break in. Last year we tried Sherlocked first escape game and we loved it. This year we came back for their new room and I must say, we where disappointed, maybe because we expected to much for the price we paid (149 euro is a lot). The idea of a breaking is nice and the beginning very good (I'm not going to put in spoilers) but it did not kept our attention till the end.
We made it!. Amazing Experience! Would highly recommend to anyone. Good team building and so rewarding when you make it out! Proudly wear my badge!
"The Vault", "mission impossible" where you are Ethan Hunt and the team. "The vault" feels much more real than other escape rooms, I'm interested to hear if there is a better experience anywhere.

Fantastic. Superb experience which we all enjoyed immensely. Challenging but absolutely logical. The host was great. And I'm enjoying wearing my emblem proving we cracked the room in less than 60 minutes!

Sherlocked is a MUST do when you come to Amsterdam . A must do!!!! My husband found this online and it sounded interesting. We thought we would give it a try. Great experience, tons of fun and we want to do it again. I'm not going to give anything away but will say the staff is wonderful. The puzzles are challenging and the story like awesome!!!!Do this on your next trip. You need to have at least two people to do some of the puzzles, and a minimum of four people for others. We had a great time with two people but can see how a group would be even better and lots of fun too!

Family Fun!!. I have been traveling with my three kids- ages 12, 14, and 16. We scheduled both games in one day and they were both fantastic!! We had such an incredible time and worked well as a team. The kids were still talking about it at bedtime. It was a fantastic experience.. Have I mentioned that we LOVED it?!
Good fun. Nice team building activity. Mentally challenging and exciting puzzle solving activities. Before going don't read up on what will happen in the room, could spoil your experience.

Awesome experience!. Recently played Sherlocked's new break-in experience! Our game started at 12 midnight which I think also kind of added to the atmosphere of the game. I really liked the fact that it wasn't easy, a real challenge. Unfortunately we didn't fully complete the challenge, which did make me lose a nights sleep, thinking of all possible ways we would have been able to make it. All in all I really enjoyed it and highly recommend trying one of their (as of writing) two experiences! The Vault was the first time, but I'll sure be back for the other one soon!
Just great!. Amazing experience, great effects and a lot of fun for a group of friends! Definitely something to try!

Sooooooooo good!!. Okay so first off, you need to experience this and I advise booking in advance of your trip to the beautiful city of Amsterdam!. We had one of the last bookings of the day (10pm -12th November 2015). Admittedly we were a little stoned on our arrival but the lovely member of staff must expect this kind of thing (its Amsterdam after all) but i also think it added to the atmosphere when entering the room, it was a truly amazing experience, one i will never forget and am now seeking further escape rooms to conquer!....oh yes we actually escaped as well (to all our surprise).

Mind games.... Well, what can I say? A truly well planned and well thought out attraction. Even though I don't believe our group managed to complete the task itself, it was the most fun I've ever had in 1 and a 1/2 hours! Absolutely brilliant, a must do and a must recommend!

Amazing . What a great way to spend a few hours Amsterdam entertaining throughout really gets the mind going , maybe going to the coffee shop before isn't the best idea I wasn't the most helpful to my team but when in Amsterdam Thanks again

Positively breathtaking.... The original "Sherlocked" escape room in the basement of Amsterdam's old stock exchange is an incredible adventure. Beautifully designed up to the smallest details, the approximately hour-long experience manages to give you the sensation that everything - EVERYTHING - is possible. Intricately thought-out and meticulously constructed surprises and puzzels await you at every turn. It's a 360-degree world of mystery and intrigue that I wish I could have never left - and I secretly hate myself and my team members for almost having broken the speed record; we could've been revelling in the room's glory even longer! Can't wait for their new - and supposedly even more mind-boggling - escape room to open this winter. Go get Sherlocked!

Love Love Love. Best thing i've done in my life and best experince ever. The only thing am upset about is we didnt get a chance to complete it we only finished 80%. But if your looking for a chance to bond and enjoy putting your brain to the test then it really isnt a waste and definitely would love to give it another shot

Amazing real life experience. This room is very well setup and it will really draw you into the game world of scheming and break-ins. The location and design of the room are wonderful and very detailed. The puzzles will challenge you to step up and think out of the box. A recommendation for anyone looking for a great new experience!

Perfect location, everything well thought, detailed and in sync with the overall concept.. Perfect location right in the center of Amsterdam (very close to Central Station). Ambiance, decoration and props of the playground are all well thought, detailed and in sync with the overall concept.We were glad to find the secrets with 24 minutes left (Architect) :)Thanks for the experience and I will surely tell everyone to try Sherlocked !Keep up the good work and am looking forward to play The Vault !
Very good escape room. Very interesting idea and rooms. We reserved both of the rooms but we didn't finish any of them :)). Anyway, you should try this ! It was a lot of fun!

Awesome experience!. My fiancée and I are big fans of the works by Arthur Conan Doyle and enjoy everything associated with Sherlock Holmes ranging from literature, films, tv series, PC games over to the ultimate experience which was this place and we highly recommend it! It was just us two against the clock in The Architect room and it was a treat like no other. We enjoyed it immensely and were pleasantly surprised to learn that our expectations were fulfilled and beyond. The nice lady guiding us through was ever so friendly and polite and we thank her for letting us enjoy this awesome escape filled with puzzles, clues and riddles. In summary it was a most memorable evening and we hope to visit again in the future:) Thanks from Filip and Katerina:)

The Vault is not living up to my expectations . Having loved "the architect " we were excited to try the new room. What starts out great quickly turns in to disappointment when inside. There's not a nice flow between puzzles and the instructions are being given by a walkietalkie which is often not easy to understand. This game is clearly still in beta phase but even if they solve the bugs the puzzles still came over as uninspired to us. Sherlocked the architect is still one of the best I've ever played but for now you should skip the vault.

Mystery. My girlfriend's family came to visit us to Amsterdam and we thought it would be fun to do something different than visit. I booked it for the five of us and damn it was intense. The whole background history is well done and intriguing and once you step inside the room good luck getting out. I will not say more as I am now part of the society but you should definitely go if you want to discover all the secrets from this society.

One great hour of tension, fun and team spirit!. A friend of mine told me about escape games and recommend me this place as I went to Amsterdam for a weekend. Normally I am not a big fan of games and mystery, but I gave it a try and just to say it already in the beginning - it was more than worth it!We went there in a group of five people, a charming young lady welcomed us and told us everything about the game. In the next hour we had time to solve the riddle, which was quite fun! Especially all those "Heureka!" moments and the feeling to act in a team were great! I would say the game has the right degree of difficulty: it is not to easy and you have to tax your brain. And even if we did not make it to escape the room in the end (we were really, really close! :) I am thinking about to test also the other venue called "the vault" by my next visit in AmsterdamAll in all I can say it was a fun experience and it confirms me that it is worth to try new things.

The most awesome experience I've had in a long time :). Me and my friends did the game yesterday. In the beginning I was quite skeptical about such a activities, but I have to say that I changed my mind straight after entering the building. This game made me to feel something I normally don't experience in my daily life: you forget all the real life that exists and enter a place which is completely mystical and so real at the same time. So much excitement, emotion and surprises! (especially this one part, where we all had to make a human chain... but I won't reveal the stuff, go and you will see it :P Awesome way how to experience something new: highly recommended. You will have a lot to talk about after this :)
The Vault: a new experience from Sherlocked!. It's something really especial, very, very exciting! Would you dare????Something like playing with your friends and at same time challenging yourself.

Review of the new room....The Vault.....Disappointed. Our family did the new Vault room this past weekend. We had previously done the architect room at Sherlocked in the past and had loved the experience so we had high expectations, but sadly the sequel room was not on the same level as their first room. Without giving anything away, a number of puzzles in the room were not quite working, the interactions with the guides is via walkie talkie and poor in-room speakers and is difficult to understand and is quite disruptive to the flow of the game, the space is much larger and just does not have the same feel as the first room. We knew within the first few minutes this was going to be a different experience. They are still in the beta phase with this new room, and "are still working out the bugs", but fail to mention when you sign up that not everything will be working. Even if they get the bugs worked out, it will still fall short of the the first room (which was really great). If you are in Amsterdam and want to do an escape room try the Architect room at Sherlock, but skip the Vault.

Excellent way to spend an hour. We had a work team building event here which was excellent. Can't say too much so as not to ruin the surprise for others. We did the "architect" which was a little easy but made that we didn't argue. Recommended for people aged 14 and over

Architect - Excellent group activity. Participated with a good group of friends in what was personally my first escape room experience here with Sherlocked, and I was very positively surprised. The setting, staff and storyline grab you from the moment you walk in, and the puzzles are clever and satisfying. Expect many "Eureka" moments :)Can highly recommend this to anyone looking for an unforgettable experience w a group of puzzle-minded (Zelda-fan) friends!

The Architect - Great experience with friends!. What a challenging and immersive game! The location is amazing and sets the mood for the compelling story. The puzzles make use of the space in some very creative ways. Guaranteed fun with a group friends. Totally recommend it! ;)
The Vault. This escape room was an awesome experience. Challenging puzzles and cool ambiance. Some rooms could use some better responsive technology, though

Great experience.. Had my first escape room experience with Sherlocked and I loved it. The surroundings are daunting, the atmosphere thrilling, the clock is ticking and you have to get out! I had a blast with Sherlocked and if all escape rooms are as good as this, I am hooked.
Awesome!. Amazing and thrilling experience, great details and beautiful decorated. Definitely worth doing this, makes you want to do more of these games.

Amazing experience, a must do when visiting Amsterdam!!!. We booked the 'architect' escape room on a Saturday evening. Very nice atmosphere, great setting in the beautiful Beurs van Berlage building. The room, riddles and puzzles were very challenging, but we managed to get out in 45 minutes. Pretty quick, and all six of us are proud of it! We will come back to try out the Vault, the new escape room which just opened a week ago!

Nice way to spend an hour. We were 6 friends and we dis the Architect room. It was nice, but not more than that. You can do it if you have some time to spend, but i expected to something more exciting.

Fantastic varied and detailed adventure. This was one of the highlights of a recent trip to Amsterdam for a friend's 30th birthday. The puzzles were tricky and varied but manageable (with the occasional hint). We had to work together and apart and managed to get out with just 4 minutes to spare. To tell you more would spoil it! Also- it was all in English for us and our lady guide was lovely.
It was awesome!. Just do it :) really fun!! Go with some friends/family. If you like those games, you would really enjoy it!!

Thrilling. We went as a group of 5. We found this just the right level of challenging, and we got so into it it was really exciting whenever we solved a puzzle. Got out just in time! Originally I had booked for The Vault (the newer room), but was emailed beforehand to inform us that our allocated time had been changed from 8.30pm to 10pm, and that we were doing the older escape room instead, as the newer one was not ready yet. I didn't mind though, because in the end we still loved it. This was our first time, but we would definitely do more in future.

Fantastic Experience. Went away for my Stag do to Amsterdam for 3 days, group of 8 mixed ages from early 20's to over 50's.Read about Sherlocked here on TripAdvisor and decided to give a go as a ice breaker/party starter for the weekend. And we were not dissapointed.Originally we booked the new room (The Vault) along with the original Architects room but unfortunately was informed before coming to Amsterdam that the vault wouldn't be ready due to technical issues and our booking will have to be cancelled.A quick response back to the booking managers email and they kindly agreed to give us the exception to have a party of 8 participate in the Architect room together.A fantastically thought through experience, which everyone in our group thoroughly enjoyed. Great puzzles and tasks and certainly was above all of our expectations. The setting in the old Stock Exchange building gave it such an authentic feel too.Unfortunately with 8 people we still didn't manage to finish before the hour was up. Our host told us we were very close to the end and we struggled on a particular section which we lost a lot of time on.We all agreed we'd love to do it again and solve the mystery and hopefully next time take a shot at the Vault too.If heading to Amsterdam for the weekend with friends, family or whoever I would strongly recommend giving this a go.

Awesome!. I've done close to 10 escape rooms now, but this one is for sure amongst the best! The story is really nicely laid out, the room is impressive and it contains elements I didn't see before while still being challenging! Would highly recommend!

Best escape room. My wife and I have done several escape rooms throughout Europe, this one was probably the best thought out. Because we travel alone, we end up doing escape rooms for three with just the two of us and usually we are okay. That was definitely not the case here, this room was hard and you really need at least three people, better would be five. We didn't make it out in time, but we were told that it would be almost impossible for two people, so that's not on them The amount of thought and care that was put into this room is impressive. The types of locks and puzzles varied which is rare for rooms, and the level of communication needed it great. All things lacking in most escape rooms. If you can only visit one escape room, this is the one. I only wish they would bring this to the US, as our escape rooms are terrible compared to European ones, especially this one. Great job, Can't wait to go back with a bigger group and tackle the Vault.
Sherlocked. Really nice experience, would recommend it to anyone. Great staff, very atmospheric room and challenging puzzles!!!
Great escape game!. I had a lot of fun with my friends, trying to get out of this escape game. Very challenging game with a good story behind.

Super choice for a fun and amazing experience. There were just three of us in attendance, but it did not for one minute detract from the fun of the experience (our first, as it happens). Very cleverly executed and the staff were BRILLIANT, FRIENDLY and EFFICIENT. We almost made it out, but sad to say ran out of time - definitely a must do if you are in Amsterdam and so centrally located. Oh, and we had NO trouble locating it - you would have to be blind to miss it, so don't know what all the fuss is about it being difficult to find, as recorded by other TA contributors. In fact the very large cafe next door to it provides wonderful snacks and drinks should you, like us, arrive a tad early.

Exciting, full of style and elegance, modern mystery solving challenge(s). Challenging puzzles to be solved with your friends or family on an absolutely awesome location. A both delightful and mind boggling experience.The location and the escape room itself have so much character, elements are stylishly designed and decorated, and the history of the location is integrated in the puzzles.It feels great to be solving mysteries together without the need or usage of modern technologies like the internet and smartphones.It's not easy to solve everything within the time limit, but we almost had it!Definitely recommended if you visit Amsterdam and looking for something fun, stylish and challenging.

Do it!. What a fab location! It's presented very well, in beautiful and atmospheric surroundings, and the puzzles are hard enough you certainly feel a sense of achievement when you solve one. We where a group of 6 adults, and it was a perfect end to our break in Amsterdam. Thank you. Would highly recommend.

Brilliant fun!. Came as a group of four, really impressed with the whole thing. Great fun, the set was great and all the props were fantastic. Really clever puzzles and clues, best thing we did all weekend!
A great game is a foot. A great game and definitely the highlight of our holiday. Really well thought out and in perfectly atmospheric building. Highly recommend giving this a go!!
Great fun for all the family. Family of four, (two teenage girls) played this game and although we were totally useless and needed lots of help, we had a great time.

Best escape room I've played! . This was the fifth escape room I've done on my travels and Sherlocked was definitely the most exciting and challening. Really original concepts and fantastic attention to detail in set design and puzzles. From the moment you walk through the large door into the old historical building you feel like the game has already begun. You dont have to be a mastermind to complete the game and escape, its just takes some thinking outside of the box and teamwork. Great activity for the whole family or with a bunch of random people you've just met traveling, as I did. Definitely a highlight of my time in Amsterdam, don't miss it.

Best game in Amsterdam. Me and my friends had an amazing time solving all the puzzles. The game is full of surprises and it definitely challanges the mind as much as your team spirit. I've been to similar group activities in Amsterdam and this is by far the most exciting. I can't wait to go back to solve a new mystery!

NOT TO BE MISSED. Sherlocked is one of the best escape room I have ever done ( and I did 24 !!!)- Intelligent Riddles- Perfect Gamemaster ( Thanks Alna !!)- Gorgeous set design and many surprises along the wayIf you know or not the escape rooms, its a MUST to do this one in Amsterdam

One of the funniest and excited things I've been to!. Locked into a room for an hour with good friends, trying to solve a lot of different mysteries. We didn't make it, but very close! Awesome host, speaking fluent English. All in all a perfect game!!!

Details, mystery and FUN. Sherlocked was my first experience of this kind and I had SO much fun. Went there with four friends and was slightly worried because I tend to get a little claustrophobic but I had absolutely no reason to. Mysterious, detailed and very challenging yet not impossible. Clues were always given to us in various clever ways when we got stuck. Really couldn't recommend more!!!

Great setup, very cool puzzles, a fun thing to do. The game was great and is full of... "things" (won't spoil ANYTHING)If you're a group or 2 people, and want to do something besides "the usual stuff", THIS is exactly the thing! No mater if tourist or resident.

Sketchy start, but super fun!. We went first thing on Sunday morning. The shop keep was a bit tardy. After feeling like the whole thing was a sketchy gimmick, we allowed the young Dutchman to lock us into an underground room. But, that was when the action ramped up!Cool room. Lots of unique and interesting clues. Don't worry. It is not a real life reenactment of the Saw movie!! It is a fun, challenging, family oriented game. My wife and two kids each had valuable contributions, although my oldest daughter was the MVP!!Unfortunately, we didn't complete the challenge. We needed 5 more minutes but the stingy shop keep told us to move along. Bummer. We will conquer the sister company in Brussels!!!

Exciting and nerve-wracking!. Sherlocked escape room is the BEST ROOM!
We had so much fun unraveling mysteries and puzzle.
You get caught in the moment and you just have to go with your instinct. There is nothing like it!
Super fun time!. My family and I did Sherlocked and had SUCH a fun time! It was our favorite thing we did in Amsterdam. Great scenario--challenging but not impossible.

Fantastic Fun!!!!. A complete spur of the moment decision to go, have never done anything like this before but the whole family enjoy puzzles. It far exceeded my expectations, enough of a challenge to be really rewarding when you solved bits - but enough help given to avoid frustration. We had a slight problem with a booking not being registered (we booked at short notice and I suggest you book at least the day before) but this was dealt with in a really friendly and professional way. Go! Enjoy! I just wish there were more people I could talk to about what's inside!

I want to forget it, and do it again. Oh.. my.. god! Seriously, we were still shaking 20 minutes afterwards. We made it out in time by a hair and I found it pretty darn hard at times (my children weren't as phased; they were racing through the room at rocket speeds). I think this is BY FAR the most exciting, fun and challenging experience you can have with your family or friends right now. We honestly want to forget it, and do it again.

Fantastic! Exceeded my expectations!. i went to Sherlocked with a group of colleagues and it was absolutely fantastic. The level of detail of the whole experience went way above my expectations.I would absolutely recommend it! And definitely return to visit a different room!

WOW. My first Escape Game experience and i was not expecting that. As far as i was concerned there would be some riddles and hidden keys, but i could not be farther from the truth. Amazing challenge and unfortunately we did not do it. Maybe next time!

Best activity in Amsterdam with friends. One of the best activities in Amsterdam to do with a group of friends! After hearing the story of architect Berlage you get locked up in a room and have to find your way out in one hour. You really have to work together as a team to get out, that's all I'm going to say ;) We managed to get out in 51 mins, woohooo! Can't wait to play their new escape room!

Well designed and excellent fun. We have friends who live in Amsterdam, so have visited a number of times. They wanted to come up with something new for us all to do, so we did the Sherlocked escape rooms. It was excellent! Our time slot was midnight, because it's so popular and was all booked up for the rest of the weekend. However, doing it late at night actually added to the excitement.We were a group of 4, which I would definitely recommend (as other reviews seem to as well). Clues were given to us when we needed them, but the whole thing was designed really well.They change the task every few months, so I'd love to go back again and do the next one.This was a great fun activity, and I'd certainly recommend it. However, you can do these types of things in any city, so if you're visiting Amsterdam and only have a few days, it wouldn't be top of my list with so many other sights more specific to the city. Having said that, it was great fun and for those who live in Amsterdam/are staying longer, I would definitely recommend it. Book early!

Awesome, do it!!!. If your in a group whether it be from a group of mates out for a laugh or professionals on team building exercises this is simply awesome! I recently went with a group of 6 mates on a stag do and although initially we were anything but prepared for a mental workout (combination of tiredness and indulging in Amsterdams finest) we all soon got stuck in and left buzzing, all running over the experience - what we got right and wrong - it was fantastic!!! The venue was in a nice location, the building clean and the staff friendly. The game itself was well thought out and flowed really well.My ONLY complaint would be the lack of water on hand when in the game, admittedly i didn`t bring any nor ask for any and im sure they would have provided me with a refreshment if i had of asked however just note, you are in a room for an hour and it did get a little warm so bringing a small bottle with you isnt the worst idea. Overall a great activity to do - if you have a chance - do it!

Challenging but fun!. As with other reviewers, this was our first time in an escape room and we weren't sure what to expect. We received a very warm welcome in this beautiful, historic building and after being asked to leave our mobile phones and bags securely at reception, we were given some background information and led into the room. We took part as a family of four, with two teenagers. It was a good combination of easy and difficult clues/challenges and we all enjoyed it, especially the way it made us work together. At times we got a bit stuck but were given some further direction from the host if we were clearly not getting anywhere. All-in-all, this was great fun and I would definitely recommend it.
Awesome!. Defenitely the best escape-room out there and a must-do experience right in the historical Amsterdam city centre.

Excellent. We weren't sure what to expect but after reading really positive reviews we gave it a go and we were not disappointed! We had so much fun and once our time ran out we were all dying to keep going! It is also worth mentioning that my mum is claustrophobic and was a bit concerned before we went that she would feel uncomfortable in the room but this was not the case; not once did she feel claustrophobic during the challenge as the room is very spacious.Highly recommended (although I would suggest a group size of at least 4 as a couple of the challenges required all of us).

A great challenge, totally worth it!. Didn't know what to expect, so I was greatly surprised by the whole experience. Great puzzles that really had me thinking on what to do next. Won't give you any spoilers, but I really enjoyed it all =D

Cool atmosphere and fun. Had lots of fun in this escape room. It was my first time experiencing something like this, but I would definitely recommend this to others visiting Amsterdam. At a certain point I wasn't sure if I was still in the game or that I was back in real life. This made the experience very cool for me.

My first escape room, nice experience. This was my first escape room, so I can't really compare it to others but I liked the overall experience a lot. Some of the puzzles are easy, some are quite challenging. Most of them are original and fun to solve. And if you get stuck the host will timely give you a small hint.

Awesome escape. It was very nicely done. The staff is nice and the decor is great. Pretty much all puzzles/mechanisms work well and the level of difficulty is high but doable. All in all a cool adventure if you want to do something different and at the same time you get to visit a cool piece of characteristic architecture of Amsterdam.

Fantastic game - host could be friendlier. Let me start by saying that Sherlocked is definitely one of the top escape rooms in the Netherlands.The room is well made and the location is fantastic. Not only it's right in the middle of the city center but also because the building itself lends to the story at hand. But even more importantly than that, the game play is exceptional. First time player would have an experience of a lifetime while escape room enthusiasts would appreciate the ingenuity. It's not a static room where one puzzle would simply lead to another. There are mechanics involved and their effects are quite a delight and there are many puzzle designs that are outside the box. You'd be pleasantly surprised quite often. So yes, do play this room. Highly recommended.Having said that, the room does have some holes in its choice of storyline. There is not much progression of the narrative during the game which is somehow salvaged by the explanation at the end but still it could have been better integrated to the design. The atmosphere is a bit lacking with the absence of sound and light play but this might actually be preferable for players who are not too keen on feeling too nervous during the game.The puzzles are challenging and success rate is only around 30%. They are not impossible but it might be frustrating for people who are not used to solving riddles and figuring out codes. Some clues unfortunately was made rather unnecessarily difficult as it is hard to even see or hear it clearly. Our team did manage to make it out (with 10 minutes to spare and without any hints given by the game master) but we were told that this was not usually the case and we couldn't help thinking that simply making some clues easier to read and others clearer to hear would help players a great deal.Last but not least, the host/game master could have been a tad friendlier. He never tried to learn our names and did not seem to be interested in finding out where we are from. We assumed this was because he opted to stay in role at all time which was commendable but role playing should not be in the expense of hospitality. When I played escape rooms at other establishments (either in the Netherlands or in other countries), the hosts were interested in finding out how you experienced the room and were eager to connect to you as fellow escape rooms enthusiasts. Neither I nor my team mates felt that connection here.Still, do try the game. It's that good to overlook these inconveniences. If the organizers are able to improve on these other aspects, though, I have no doubt it could be one of the best escape rooms not only in the Netherlands but the world.

Fun adventure. A fun trap room, quite a few puzzles to get through, and the room/building is a great setting for this adventure! Recommended. Only a small bit of feedback, would be great to get a water or a quick drink either when waiting or when we're done with the room!

Beautiful, challenging, brilliant.. We've been to a few puzzle rooms now and this one really stands out. The decor, the story, the creativity that went into the challenges is really inspired. I loved that it was truly difficult at times (although I'm not sure if I'd say the same if we hadn't júst made it..). I noticed a review here complaining about a 'lack of logic' to the quests and even though it's a bit junior of me, all I can say is 'awww shucks'. Everything's wildly connected here and indeed nothing is spelled out for you. If you're stuck, it's not the game and it's not the host; it's you. We were thrilled every time something clicked with us, even (and especially) after reaching that point of desperation, when you think you've run out of clues. In short; can't wait for their next room and this one is highly recommend!

Sherlocked - Solving clues. Our group of 4 did Sherlocked on June 10 before heading to the airport to head back to the U.S. It was a ton of fun trying to solve the mystery. Well worth the money. The 1 hour flew by. Looking for something different and love solving puzzles, mysteries then this is for you.

Sherlocked rocked!. This game was very cool, think the guys did a great job, we found ourselves caught up in the game completely as if our lives depended on it. Felt rather foolish at times when the solution was staring us right in the face ;) YOu tend to over think things. It felt like being a kid again, next room please!

Loved this!! A must do activity!!!. This was an amazing experience and excellent value for money; particularly if you have a group of 6. It's 119 Euro's for groups of 3-6. Experience lasts for 50-70 minutes; depending on how quickly you unlock the clues. Book early as it's very popular. The venue is just 5 minutes walk from Central Station. I won't say too much about the experience so as not to give too much away, but you basically have to work your way out of a locked room by solving clues and puzzles. It's extremely clever and so much fun!!!

Sherlocked: a great addition to the Amsterdam experience. We had a great time at Sherlocked! I was especially surprised by the originality and attention for detail and awesome staff. If you would like some original fun, I highly recommend spending some time at Sherlocked.

Sherlocked experience . It was our first real escape roomAnd it was amazing, it focused on teamate work and test your abiltys as a family.It has lots of surpises but theres a lot to do in just one hour so prepere yourself for the option that you wont secssed to get out.

Exciting game. This was my first escape game experience and I loved it. Be aware that it is addictive, I have escaped 5 rooms by now and won't stop. Sherlocked it a beautifully decorated room with many clever puzzles. We played with 5 persons and that was perfect. 4 would also do fine. I hve done other rooms where 5 would be a crowd, but not here. Unfortunately we didn't make it in time, but we were almost there. Thankfully there are more nice escape rooms in Amsterdam.

Very well for group or team activity. We did the escape room with collegues. It was very well thougt out and quite exciting to do. By working together you solve puzzles and follow clues. Nice to do with a group or team!

Challenging and engaging activity that bonds everyone together. Having never tried any escape room before, Me and my friends were tempted to give this place a go after reading about it's rave reviews on trip advisor. Finding this place was abit hard as it is located at the corner of the building with its view of the signage being partially blocked by the cafe beside it.We were greeted by two friendly and welcoming ladies upon entering. Before entering the escape room, we were told a story linked to the room that certainly set the mood for an adventure! The room was detailed and we were given an hour inside. I am glad to say me and my friend certainly enjoyed the experience.

Thrilling activity. First off, the place is a bit hidden away, ignore the google maps direction, the entrance is situated opposite the department store and on the main road side. The two staff were friendly and informative and gave a nice "act" as well to get us into the mindset. The room itself is large and full of plenty of places to search for, the room will test your reasoning and senses. There is a good range of different puzzles to solve, worth the price. Having an official photo at the end could have made it better though!

Best activity ever!. I have made my boyfriend the happiest guy after this birthday suprise. Together with 2 close friends (so with a team of 4 persons) we had an amazing time. Do it, it's a great experience and both fun and challenging. Thanks Sherlocked, for being a great adventure!!

absolute highlight of a brilliant weekend. thrilling, challenging & great fun. Nothing is quite what it seems :0) this was a brilliant find. Booking is essential - as is team work. Ideal team size is probably 4 people - that way you don't have too many people all going off or being the boss. This event uses all your senses & reasoning skills & is incredibly clever & well thought out. We were a mixed sex party of 4 & we completed the challenge with 6 seconds to spare! It was worth every penny & we would recommend it to anyone. Well done to Sherlocked for a really top attraction.

Absolutely brilliant - highlight of our trip. I was so excited about this experience beforehand that I was worried it would let me down and not meet my high expectations. I was so wrong...it was better than I could have hoped. If you do one thing whilst you're in Amsterdam, make sure it is this. I see a lot of people moaning about the price, but when we split the price between our group it worked out around £15 each which is great value for money. We did escape the room, but only just. It's challenging enough without being impossible. Do it - you must!It's also worth finding the entrance in good time, because it's not the most obvious, so give yourself a spare 15 mins before hand for that.

An actually fun 'group' experience. keen attention to detail - challenging, but doable - fun activity for a group, or if possible try to join an open night. If only we could wipe our minds and do it again!

Great experience!. An awesome escape room! This was my first time trying an escape room, and it was a great experience. They set the mood with a good story and authentic room, the escape itself had great riddles and was well put together, and demanded good teamwork. Can't wait till they finish their second room in this awesome building!

Great activity!. Highly recommended, excellent escape room! Great puzzles, good backstory and very well thought through. Not too easy, not too hard. We managed to solve all puzzles with a small nudge from our host here and there. Our host was fun and maintained the entire backstory in a good way as well. Enjoy

Highly recommend! Definitely do this if have spare hour in central Amsterdam. A real life escape game that you play with friends, lasts for 60 minutes. The aim of the game is to solve riddles to ‘escape’ the locked room. Cost is 122.40 Euros for up to 6 players (including paypal fee), and we thought this price was well worth the experience. This worked very well for our group of five friends (aged 28-33). Sherlocked was very difficult to find, as located in a HUGE building with many different halls, and initially we were trying to get into the building from the wrong direction – suggest go early and leave yourself plenty of time to find the entrance! (it took us over 15 minutes, on top of the 5 minute walk from Centraal Station) When you arrive there is a cloakroom area and a lock box where you have to leave your mobiles and cameras etc as these are not allowed inside the locked room – in case you spoil the surprise for other future visitors! The hidden rooms are extensive and this location was even more fun than other similar games I've played elsewhere! Definitely recommend if you have a free hour and a half in central Amsterdam.

Awesome. It was awesome. The puzzles were very accecible, and yet challenging. Very nice location, and easy to find in Amsterdam. On top of that, the owner is sympathetic.I highly recommand this great experience.

Booked a few corporate/team events here: Everyone LOVED it.. I booked several corporate events and team outings at Sherlocked. After going through the game, whether the teams completed it or not, they came out full of energy and adrenaline and could not stop talking about how cool the experience was for days. Further, on several occasions, we had to cancel and re-schedule meeting due to our own planning complications. It was a really bad headache for several weeks but the Sherlocked team went above and beyond to accommodate our scheduling hassles. I mean, really, in a few cases we had to be a very terrible customer I am very grateful that Sherlocked took it all in stride so that our events could be successful. So please don't read this and think it will be ok to abuse the Sherlocked team's kindness and professionalism. :-) I was just very relieved at how well taken-care of we were in a city that is not known for outstanding customer service.

expensive but detailed. I have marked this down a star purely on price. 130 euros for a game was probably putting this out of reach of too many people when we visited. We took the risk as we have done quite a few games in the uk and the game looked very inviting. its not the most challenging game that we have done but the room was very well presented. The pound to euro situation will be making this alot more affordable to brits now than when we did it in December, so that alone makes it worth considering. Loads of work went into this . Good game.
Fantastic. This experience was really great. Was not sure what to expect but was welcomed and played the game. Only disappointment was that we did not quite make it out.

Expensive but worthwhie. A very well done escape room in a great location. Difficulty level is easy-moderate, but lots of fun & unique twists & moments. Definitely worth a visit, but make sure you book in advance!Its definitely on the high end (129 euros) but its located very near the Red Light District so I imagine rent is probably expensive.The gamemaster (female) was friendly and accomodating.

Challenging all your senses... Did everything work as planned?. Great room great location! Definitely recommended.You can see the effort put in, looking at the details and sophistication!
Only comment to make is that we got the feeling not everything worked as planned.

Brilliant!. We really didn't know what to expect, although we didn't complete the room we all loved the experience. If you have any hesitation just go for it. It's a great way to spend an hour in Amsterdam. Can't wait to do another! Will be heading back in Autumn to visit their new room!
must-go in Amsterdam. Delicate design. A lot more than just word and number puzzles. Mysterious location and atmosphere. Not 100 percent perfect, but totally recommend it.

WAAA awesome just in the nick of time. This is a must do thing when you like to solve puzzles, only down side is that you need to resever way ahead.
But the thrill when you unlock the last door to exit the place WAAAA
Amazing!. Seriously the best group activity I have done! Highly recommend to do this! Can't wait for the other room to open!!
The best group activity!!!. Don't miss it if you are with a group of friends! I think it was worth every penny and great fun. Lovely staff and an amazing setting :)

Great trip with the family!!!. My wife and I took the family to Sherlocked today. What a blast! None of us had done a locked room puzzle before so we did not know what to expect. Everyone in the family contributed and had a great time (our kids are 15, 11, and 8 years old)!!! The puzzles were fun and very thoughtful, and the detail in the room were really great. We solved the puzzle and got out with about 8 minutes to spare. Really fun experience for the whole family.
Truly great !!. A brilliant experience. Very detailed, very well-wrought story, and lots of interesting twists to the plot. Highly recommended !!

A great way to spend an hour with friends - a must-visit. We've been to a few escape games before, so knew roughly what to expect of Sherlocked. However, our expectations were far surpassed. I won't give anything away, but the complexity and the set up were better than any escape games that we have done before. Plus the location is great, the building is very interesting and the introduction was also fun. We did manage to complete it with a few minutes to spare, but this was more challenging than any other escape game that I have done before! Highly recommended - shame we can't do it again, but hopefully they'll open up another facility by the time we're back in the 'dam.

Great Game. We hadn't done one of these before so was not sure what to expect but now would highly recommend. We didn't manage to get out in the allocated time but had an absolutely fab time trying. It was great working together to solve the clues and we are still talking about it and planning another.
Intriguing. unique experience. you'll be amazed during the game, and after that, the beer with the team has a different flavour :)

Play, mystery and guaranteed fun!. For one hour there was nothing on our minds that wasn't Sherlock. We were locked in and needed to solve mysteries from times long past (or so it seemed) while finding our way in and out of secret locations, answering mysterious phone calls and reading too much into absolutely everything. I loved how much it relied on teamwork and am terribly sad it won't make any sense to go again until there is a new mystery. This outing was full of play, excitement, occasional giggles and pure joy. Mixed with a hint of frustration, of course. But the good kind!

Great Experience. This was so fun! I've been to Amsterdam several times and was bored with tourist attractions. I went with a group of five people not really knowing what to expect, but was very pleased when we finished the game. Although we didn't win, we still had a great time and will be back for the opening of the new room. I highly recommend Sherlocked!

Great time!. Came with a group of 6 people, and we had an absolute blast. It was hard enough to keep us interested, but not impossible, and we finished before our hour was up. If anything, we wanted it to keep going. Really well executed, and creative puzzles. After visiting Sherlocked, we went to another escape room in Amsterdam, and while it was fun, it just didn't have the same attention to detail and clever stuff that Sherlocked had.We can't wait until you do a new room!! We'll be there.

Nerve wracking -- which made it perfect!. We did this with a group of friends for a fun goodbye party- we kept talking about it for days whenever we would see each other. It was such a fun intense experience and you learn new things about your friends. Each person's unique gifts were used. This is a must! It felt very real and not corny or dorky at all.

Awesome experience!. Most of all I liked the atmosphere of this quest. It's great that you can solve all the puzzles only if you collaborate as a team. I was happy to see how different points of view and types of thinking helped us escape the room. I absolutely loved it!. Highly recommend!

An incredibly exciting experience!. Without giving away any details (all is explained when you take part), escaping the room was one of the most fun things I've ever done. A fast paced brain teaser. SO much fun with a group of friends. I highly recommend it!

Great family activity!. I recently went on a trip to Amsterdam with husband and my family (all adults). I pushed them to do a puzzle room because I heard they were so much fun. Everyone was hesitant at first, but the eventually agreed. They were NOT disappointed. We all had a blast. It was great because all of the activities were different so it catered to a wide range of skill sets and everyone gets to participate. We all loved it and would highly recommend it to everyone. It was a highlight for the trip for everyone.

Great Fun!. Two weeks ago me and two friends went in the room. Actually I thought that these kind of games weren't really my thing. But when I arrived at Sherlocked and that nice young lady took us to the basement of 'De Beurs van Berlage' I was immediately sold! What a beautiful room, what a fantastic atmosphere! It all felt extremely real! We all got really excited during the game and all my senses opened up. After the game I felt so much energy and happiness, probably because me and my friends had felt so much 'togetherness' while playing, that the continuation of the evening was great too!! Oh and btw: funny thing is we didn't even made it until the end, still it was so much fun and there were anyway so much discoveries to be amazed about!

The coolest game in Amsterdam. Thrill seekers united. This room is all you wanted. Get in, be surprised and make sure you are alert at all times. It seems difficult but if you communicate, look carefully and don't be afraid you will fix his mystery within 1 hour. It's more than fun. I loved it and am hooked. Thanks Victor & co!

Must Experience. Went with a group of 4 adults and my 14 month old son. Very well put together and makes you work on your communication. Wish we were staying to see their new room in June. Will come back for sure.
Finaly something that's really changing... Unlocking the secrets together. It was a real good experience, difficult and well preformed.We will be back for more ! Thank you for a great time!

Brilliant experience which stimulates thinking and working together. Brilliant experience today! Well thought out room and story. The host was nice and made sure we had an awesome time even before entering :)
Can't really tell to much else as I don't want to spoil the experience for others.

Amazing experience, very rewarding. We enjoyed every moment :). We loved every minute of it: the athmosphere is great, the puzzles were very nicely balanced and the reward/feedback when you solve puzzles was good! I want to write about all the cool things we did and puzzles we solved, but obviously I won't ;) I can't wait until they launch their next room! Just go here and experience it for yourself, you definitely won't be disappointed!

Great theme, fun game!. A friend of ours invited us there in January, without giving us any hint about what we were about to do. And then what a nice surprise! We quickly let ourselves being snapped into the mysterious, somehow obscure world of Berlage... One hour of great fun!
AMAZING. A great experience, fun, challenging and always on theme. The atmosphere was brilliant as was the setting. Loved this experience.

Lots of fun!. I went to Scherlocked with a group of friends this March and it was so much fun. We had a great 1 hours full of thrill and excitement. It would be a great place for team building events as well. If you love crime and investigation, this is the perfect place for you. And, the more of you, the more fun :)

Awesome. I've been to 3 escape rooms. This was by far the best. Great location, mysterious puzzles and nice surprises made this an extremely rewarding hour.I'll be back when there's another room.Jeroen
Best escape room game ever.. The amount of details that they've put into the room, atmosphere and puzzles is just amazing. Don't miss this one, you'll have a blast!!

Not to be missed!. If you enjoy challenges, surprises and using your brain, then Sherlocked is for you. Housed in the bowels of the Beurs de Berlage, just next to the Bijenkorf, the team have created an atmospheric series of rooms out of which you need to escape. What appears at first glance to be a sparsely furnished room becomes a labyrinth of surprises, which only you and your team can unlock. Our group of six managed to 'escape' in 47 minutes, which we were quite pleased about until we heard that another group had managed it in under half an hour. We will be recommending the Sherlocked experience far and wide!

Authentic and refined. Bonding, exciting, surprising and super real. Intelligent and subtle. I loved the fact that all your senses get involved in finding your way in a room that unfolds in more and more surprising details.

Thrilling!. It was really really fun! When we arrived there, there was nobody except the lady who gave the instruction to us. She told us that we were the last group. So, it was already exciting.Then we got a clue and we had to start by ourselves from there. The clues were not easy yet still understandable. And fortunately, we made it ;)This game is very very recommended!

Indeed nerve-wrecking yet fun activity to do!!. I went to this game with 5 friends at midnight. It's our first real-life escape game experience, we totally don't know what to expect and are afraid that we are not able to escape from the room within the allocated time. I heard and saw in the review that it's pretty cool activity, and in the end of game, we made it with 3 minutes left!! I can't say much detail about the game, but it's highly recommended activity! Love all the details, the puzzles, stories, and old designs. Everything falls perfectly to get the suspense ambience yet exciting at the same time once uncovering all the clues. Not to mention, the most important thing is I am still mesmerized by this after the game ended and want to write nice review about it (it's my first review, usually I never write a review because there is never something that makes me hooked so much afterwards!!). Looking forward to their next escape game for sure.

Exhilarating!. An exciting, challenging and fun group activity, a great alternative for the regular stuff! It will leave you and your teammates laughing and talking about it for hours afterwards. Signed, Agent 2586.

For sure locked. Exciting till the last seconds...first time...not the last! They will open a new room this spring, but I'm not sure it'll be at this location. Top location. Excellent activity to do with friends and/or children. The guy who welcomed us was a bit mysterious too which made the experience complete. We want to be locked again for sure!

Soooo much fun!. I recommend this highly. Very well planned and executed. Such a blast! We finished with 11 minutes to spare, it was so much fun none of us wanted it to end. We can't wait until it changes or there's a new one so we can do it again!

The best experience we've had in Amsterdam. Our group had no idea what exactly to expect. The whole concept is shrouded in secrecy and mystery, which made the whole experience even better in the end. It was a perfect combination of adventure, teamwork, and mystery-solving for our team. Although we were with a group of friends, I'm sure this would also be perfect as a teambuilding activity. Our game master was a great storyteller, who really made us dive us into the story around the experience.Also, the location is brilliant, in the cellars of one of the oldest stock-market exchanges in the world! It's really close to the central station and many bars, so obviously we went for a beer after our escape to recap on the experience. Perfectly built escape room, and the best experience we've had in Amsterdam!

""Excellent!" I cried. "Elementary" said he.". This was absolutely fantastic! We were with a group of 6 and were grateful to have a mix of ages... the 16 year old and 10 year old were a real asset ; ). Fun in retrospect to think about everyone's different puzzling perspectives and abilities. The guide was super friendly, the space and whole experience is well thought out and executed fabulously. We didn't quite solve it in the allotted time, so a wee bit of dissapointment for that, but would do it again in a heartbeat. Can't say enough about how much we loved it and we are so looking forward to the new room they will be opening in...June?
i am hooked.. I knew it would be really cool, but never expected it to be this good! The room is beautiful, with amazing detail. It was my first escape room, but now i am hooked.I loved it!

Beyond expectations!. Just keeping it short! This escape room is really great. The location is awesome and so is the staff. I never attended an escape room before, but I am sure to visit more, it was truly a great and exciting hour! I would definately recommend this to anyone. Can't wait for the next room these guys come up with!

Amazing!. Amazing experience! We had a wonderful time, this was the first escape room for us and we were not disappointed. We are a group of 6 friends who all love to puzzle and play games and we all loved it. The room was set up beautifully, with lots of unexpected events and the level of difficulty was excellent!

Unforgettable experience!. We visited this place a part of my companies kick off weekend. This is a lot about team building and trusting every single person in your team.
It was an amazing experience and I am proud to be a part of this secret society! You have to try it to know what it is about!
Wow!. I expected a lot from this game, because I read all the great reviews about it beforehand, but it was much better than I imagined. Definitely one of the best things I have ever experienced.

Awesome experience. The puzzles are great, with the right level of difficulty and they are incredibly creative. It's great that puzzles require imagination and thinking out of the box instead of plain knowledge (like geography, music or sports).The room atmosphere is incredible, full of mystery and hidden parts to discover, it's like being part of an Indiana Jones movie.Very rewarding experience and worth every cent. Definitely recommended.

Coolest evening experience in Amsterdam!. I did Sherlocked with two other friends and we had such a blast - I didn't want it to be over. If you loved Fort Boyard as a kid, this will make you feel like you're living it - in a locked room and in one of the most historical buildings in the whole of Amsterdam. The team behind it is excellent, it's an exciting and fun way to spend an evening, the design will blow your mind and you'll get to know your friends better than you thought. Don't miss it!

insane!!. Anytime you're in Amsterdam, you must play this game!It's absolutely crazy to do it in the center of the city! It would make you to be a team even to random people, but you need to switch on your brain and force mind to unexpected puzzles!So amazing!

Uncover the conspiracy under the world's first stock market.. This is an exciting attraction in Amsterdam. Discover a little history about the world's first stock exchange at this escape room game. It's great to do with a group of friends. Me and a group of friends went to play this escape room game. There were also new friends of friends which I hadn't met, but got to know very well by playing together. There were great puzzles, music and challenges that were both creative and intricate. Secret doors, hidden levers, and let's just say group electricity moments really made it a fun time. The location is great for jumping to a cafe or restaurant afterwards and chat about the game. Great clean fun for family and friends.
Very Cool. We came to Sherlocked as a suprise present for a couple of friends, but were very happily surprised ourselves. It's an amazing experience. We all loved it! A lot of fun and very exciting!
Fantastic. I don't ever write reviews. This was a great way to spend an hour, and I will be back for the new room!

Nice escape room. We loved the room with all the nice details, it is a very fun way to spend the hour. You will have to crack the nut, but it is doable. Location is great if you would like to have a drink, enough bars in the area. A lot of fun but a bit pricy, although they are cheaper during weekdays. Cindy B.

extremely fun and exciting. Sherlocked was an extremely fun and exciting game. The puzzles and clues are challenging but definitely doable if you cooperate, which is great! This execution of the escape room idea is mysterious and surprising and makes me very much look forward to the next edition :)

Fantastic puzzle room in reality. Over for a day in Amsterdam for a conference and was put into a room with 3 strangers. It was a great experince to work together to figure out the clue, figure our the solution and move on. A great ice breaker, a great laugh. Very well done and an hour well spent in team work. You need to be 3-4 people to enjoy it properly, more to many fewer will make it tricky.strongly recommend it

Unique small group activity. Really fun with a group of friends! Unique way to see a different side of yourself and your friends. The clues are engaging and varied but not so complex that you need special knowledge or brilliance to solve them as long as you work together. It is really well designed and beautiful too.

Fantastic experience. I've done this with friends when visiting Amsterdam. It's a very surprising experience and they've been putting a lot of effort in the details. Fun for groups with at least 3 people. :)

Very good!. Had a great time figuring out how to solve the puzzles and finish the game in time. A great thing for team building, cause you really need to listen to one another, act, interact and work together!

Best escape room so far!. At a very beautiful location there is a very fun escape room, full with surpises and challenges. This is the most fun escape room i have done so far. RECOMMENDED, you will not regret at all!

As close to the Crystal Maze as I've felt in years!. For British audiences the above title is probably already enough - and so it should be! Challenges air on the mystery and mental end of the spectrum. Really fun game to do with a good group of mates. Do it.
amazing experience. What an amazing experience - very unexpected, creative, mysterious and so much fun! Really recommend it.

Great fun!. I didn't really know what to expect from this mystery game but believe me you wont be disappointed! Its probably one of the best things i did while in Amsterdam. An afternoon full of surprises! Would definitely recommend booking up with your friends or family for something different to do on holiday! Will be back asap

If you liked Myst you'll love this!. When I was a kid growing up in the 90s I was entranced by the video game MYST. With its beautiful sound design and ambient puzzle worlds, it was an amazing alternative to other computer games of its time. Fast forward to 2015 where an ingenious team has put together Sherlocked – a delightful experience in which puzzles are embedded in the physical artifacts and architecture of an elegant and mysterious confined space. The main difference, aside from digital/analog? Time. The clock ticks down just over an hour until you and your teammates can escape the mysterious chambers. In fact our team failed to solve the mystery – we got very very close! – but we still had an awesome time.
Mystery, storytelling, teamwork. A place where mystery, storytelling & teamwork comes together in one game. Without any doubt a must-do!

Badabing Badaboom. Fjew that was checking my excitement abilities. But darn-it, we did not make it in time. Amazing in what state I get with the rush, the excitement and the group dynamics. No drugs, just pressure and th challenge. Awsome. Thank you. Wanna do it again but I can't. Hope there will be a second one soon!!

Incredible. I loved the intellectual challenge, the pleasure of the group work, the artistic beauty of the design and variation in the puzzles we had to solve. The whole team came out elated and shouting of excitement.
Amazing experiece. Totally enjoyed the whole experience! The setting was great and the riddles and games were fun! Will definitely do this again in another city.

Number 1 experience. We had a little malfunction at the end, despite that we had a great time and the host was so great that we didn't even mind! We were also offered a small compensation. For the rest they are number 1 experience, I wish for more rooms!
Great fun!. I went to SherLocked with a group of friends and it was so much fun to experience it all together. I want more!

Great experience for the puzzle minded. With a bunch of friends we went for the Sherlocked experience. And it was, well, unforgettable. The room has the right atmosphere, gloomy, challenging. It was not as easy as I had expected, we really had to work it. The thrill that you experience when you solve part of the puzzle is an awesome feeling. Highly recommend it!
Good fun, brain food. I thoroughly enjoyed this escape room. The puzzles are challenging and you need to cooperate to get some solved.
Surprising adventure at midnight. Surprising, intriguing. Not easy, a real challenge! Well organized. Not scary but exciting, definately. Nice to do with group of friends.

Great experience! Go and see!. It was a great experience; the room is exciting and looks amazing. The clues trigger your mind but are solvable; not too easy and not too hard. Compliments to the makers! Definitely a fun thing to do in Amsterdam for residents as well as tourists!

Absolutely Brilliant!. The amount of work that they've and continue to put into this escape room is staggering, after each session they need up to 2 hours to reset the room for the next group.
Some contraptions are so detailed and the location fits perfectly!
Would recommend this to absolutely everyone!

An Awesome Group Outing. A group of us went to Sherlocked for Halloween and it was outstanding. Even though we're all friends, we learned a lot about each other and had so much to talk about afterwards. I'm so psyched for what these guys come up with next.
Fantastic experience!. I can (and have) advise this to anyone because it is mysterious, because it looks good and because it feels good.
Amazing and extremely fun experience!. 10/10 would do it again! It was extremely fun. It questions your ability of communication and teamplay, which can be pretty hard with such a game, haha.

brain challenger. In a city most well known for all the 'leisure activities' it is refreshing to have something exciting and brain challeging at a stone throw away from the central station and dam square! I couldn't recommend this place more!

Truly magical mystery (escape) room game!. Sherlocked is the best escape game I've played, on a whole other level. The puzzles are diverse, the room is decorated with incredible eye for detail, and there's a special reward in store if you make it to the end ;) The room will challenge your creativity, intelligence, and ability to communicate with your friends. I would highly recommend it.

Incredibly exciting experience!. I absolutely LOVED Sherlocked! We went with my family of 6. Everyone go to do their part, everyone loved it. When we stepped out of that door I had such an adrenaline rush! I recommend everyone to do this!
Good fun. We visited with a family of 6. The time just went so quickly. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience, would recommend.
Amazing!. What an experience! We had amazing time and were blown away by the quality and intricacy of the puzzels. If you have the time I definately recomend this!

Great Experience, but pricey. I had a fantastic time doing this my last night in Amsterdam. It was challenging, and great sober fun. I was with two friends and didn't have to suspend disbelief too much because it was so well put together. But I really wish it wasn't so expensive because it was a stretch to be able to afford it, as a friend booked and told me how much it cost afterword.

Amazing. I have never been to anything like this before and from start to finish it was a blast! We were 4 adults with one young adult 14 year old (who was the best of course) and we had so much fun. It is money well spent and now we are all hooked on puzzle rooms. Thanks Sherlocked!

Nice time, but bit expensive. We visited Sherlocked during Christmas holidays, the location was perfect, in the middle of all the action. But I must say, maybe my expectations were to high because of all the 5 star Tripadvisor ratings. I think the price is to high for what you get. I loved the puzzles but sometimes logic missed. Guy who hosted the game was very nice
Very good. A great illuminati puzzle quest with perfect interrior.The logic of some quests was not entirely clear but overall it was a very good experience

Great game, great challenge! :) . Excellent game. Our brains still ache. It was really fun, challenging and definitely something we will do again, and again, and again. Can't wait till we can play the new game in March.

Brilliant!. Recently went for the midnight experience at Sherlocked with a group of 6 and thoroughly enjoyed it. Some of the intricacies of the room were quite amazing, the story behind it was great fun and the hints were very clever. The creators clearly took a lot of care making it a unique experience so we had a fantastic time. As a sidenote, you do not need to speak to Dutch to be able to go to Sherlocked. Absolutely recommend it!!

The greatest escape game I've played. This escape game in the heart of Amsterdam is the most exciting and well executed escape gameI've played so far. It is so beautifully made and constructed. For anyone not familiar with the concept of escape games: it is, in my opinion, one the coolest new type of activities to come out in the past few years. Seriously, it is a ton of fun.I went with 5 of my friends and from the moment we were in the room we were superexcited and running around, trying to work our way through the well-placed clues as quickly as we could. I don't want to give anything away but there were some definite "wow"-moments.Don't hesitate for a moment, this game is an absolute blast, and will leave you talking about it for a long time after!

The perfect activity for friends and family. Well that was amazing! My boyfriend and I got chatting to one of the creators whilst working from a cafe in Amsterdam and we were intrigued from the moment he said he was "creating games". When he explained the escape room concept we thought it would be the perfect activity for us to do with our families on Christmas day so we booked right away. We kept the game a secret from our families (there were 7 of us in total) and when we turned up at the venue they were a mixture of scared and excited. As soon as we were left in the room all fears were converted into excitement and we had a superb time! We can't wait for the next room to be finished so that we can go again!!!!
Great alternative activity. I had a great time! The riddles were definitely solvable though not too easy. This was my first escape room experience and most probably won't be my last!
Awesome. We had such a great time playing this game and we will come back whenever the new room will be announced. We had fun and shivers at the same time!

would recommend this to anyone!. First escape room ever and it was so much fun!! At first I didn't know what to expect or even if it was something for me, but this experience rose high above all my expectations! The room, the story and the execution of all the different game parts were very well tough out and beautifully done with great eye for detail and me and my friends left the room more than excited! Had a great time and would recommend this to anyone!

Great experience. Can only say positive things about Sherlocked. Great way to get to know your friends and how they deal with situations where they need to use the brain.
Would recommend this to anyone!

Very exciting!. Sherlocked was a great experience! Without revealing to much; there are so many hidden treasures, puzzles and keys to find! Its very bonding for groups and you'll all run out high on adrenaline!

Mind blowing experience!!. I HAD SOO MUCH FUN. The staff were amazing and completely immersed us into the scene straight away. The group element and cooperation made it an experience that I will never forget and it also made me realize that the woman by my side is my one true love!! So much awesome!!

Fantastic experience. Thank you so much to Victor and his team for helping me plan my anniversary surprise for my partner. They were extremely accommodating and the activity was above and beyond any expectations I could have. For the service and hospitality alone - Sherlocked has to be one of the best experiences in Amsterdam.

Get Sherlocked. Fun experience! Hard to describe without giving anything away - lots of running around by everyone involved to figure out all the pieces of the puzzle. Do it with at least 4 people but preferably with 6-8. We did it with 7 and had lots of fun.
great team building activity. i have picked this activity for our team at work! it was great! i can highly recommend it to everyone who wants to have some fun and do something completely new.

Great!. Great escape room in Amsterdam, in English, so also great for non-Dutch speakers. Most exciting and surprising experience. Everyone in our group wanted to find and book a new game somewhere immediately! Can't wait for the new one opening in March...

Feeling young again!. Amazing. If you want to feel young again, DO IT! So much fun, and such a cool way to get to know friends or new people in a totally different way. The details in the room and the way it is all build and set up are brilliant.
