Wonderful. This was my first experience with an Escape room, and it blew me away! Lovely attention to detail, and so much surprises! You get on a ride which doesn't stop till you leave the room. WE WANT MORE!

Most exciting mystery of Amsterdam. Right in the center of Amsterdam, Sherlocked comes with a creative concept and an exciting story full of secrets! It has been an adventurous hour deep down in the masonry of the old stock exchange of the 17th century.

Exciting, engaging and all-round utter excellence. The minute we we were led downstairs into the aged cellars of the Beurs, it felt like we were walking straight into a chapter from one of Doyle's books itself and this suspension from reality was maintained throughout the entire experience. The room itself was an hour of pure adventure: challenging, exciting and brilliantly thought out. Each member of the group felt important and there was always something for everyone to do. The puzzles are extremely well designed, to the point that I genuinely squealed at a point when our next challenge opened up in a very exciting and unique way - if I told you more, I'd have to kill you etc etc.Brilliant concept, perfect for groups, definitely recommend!
Cool game!. for adults and kids. Really good group game. We were 4 people and everyone felt really good about solving puzzles and working together

Fun, inspiring, and all around awesome!. How often have you watched a movie in which the characters need to work together to solve a problem, only to be frustrated by the poor decisions they make. You and your friends would surely be much smarter. Well, here's your chance to test that theory. Nothing can prepare you for Sherlocked. And in my opinion, that's a good thing. I believe that if you go in without any preparation or preconceptions it will only make your experience more fun.It is a truly amazing experience. Just try it. The Sherlock-staff will take good care of you, they'll ensure you'll all have a great time!-Avinash

One word: AMAZING!. I didn't know what to expect but it was an amazing experience. The atmosphere of the historical building, the mystery and puzzles you have to solve to get out of the room. Go there and be surprised, you won't be disappointed.

Fantastic midnight experience! . Brilliant experience with 3 of my friends. As a group of 4 early 20's girls it was a random choice for us but we enjoyed every second!!!! Challenging, engaging and such an adrenaline rush. Perfect for something different to do, we did ours at midnight. Solve the clues to get out of a locked room! Really recommended, hostess was lovely!! think it needs to be ranked #1, I can't rate it highly enough! Thank you sherlocked, worth every penny. X

Have a go at it - you will enjoy it!. We are a family of four with two children aged 15 and 11. Everyone thought this was one of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam. It is based in an old building about 5 minutes walk from the station. Without giving too much away, you are put in a locked room and have to find your way out. It is not claustrophobic or scary and very much like the many escape games you can play on apps. It becomes apparent that you are being watched all the time and there is a phone in the room in the which you can contact the organiser and vice versa. He phones up periodically and offers hints (which you do not have to take if you don't want to) to help you on your way. There is time pressure (for some reason you are given 67 minutes exactly). Everyone can participate and everyone can contribute. First rate activity which everyone in our family though was one of the highlights of our trip. They even take a photo of your group at the end and email it to you, which is a nice touch.

Amazing experience!. The Sherlocked escape room truly was beyond expectations. Our hostess was very friendly and definitely hooked all of us into the story of the "Society of the Crossed Keys".The game is full of unexpected turns. It's really great as a team to feel the rush of solving a mystery, while only a couple of minutes everyone is puzzled about the next challenge.Looking forward to the next escape room already!

Challenging, Exciting And Fun!. An incredibly exciting mystery game that really gives you an adrenaline kick! There are twists and turns at every corner... Without giving too much away the manner in which the game is built is sheer brilliance... Very beautifully designed down to every detail and very clever use of technology to take mystery gaming to the next level. Such a great game to play with friends... I feel like we know each other better too, because of it. Can't wait for another from Sherlocked!

Very fun experience. I played this game with 6 other people I didn't know on forehand and it really was a pretty cool experience! I guess we where pretty smart because we solved it pretty quick. Too bad we can't play this room again, now we need to wait for the development of the second room. Can't nearly wait!

Amazing experience. What a great experience! First of all, the escape room is beautiful and has a lot of details. The game is an amazing experience. You have to collaborate as a team. While making progress, the game will amaze the players more and more. The difficulty is quite good. The game requires more instinct and 'thinking different', then general knowledge. When you're stuck in the game, a telephone is available to get hints. This means that you can get the full experience of the game, which is great. The staff is awesome! The game is available in Dutch and English, which is perfect. I'd definitely recommend this game to everyone!

Exciting and fun!. The game is a great way to excercize your brains and have loads of fun. Trying to solve the mystery makes you feel like Sherlock or the Scooby gang (which ever you prefer!) and the when you do you feel like a kid in a candy store!

So much fun with The family. This is a really fun thing to do with your Family! Worling together to solve all the puzzles. Wouter was a good host and led is through this amazing, technical high standard room.

Everyone should try this! Amazing!. This was a fantastic experience, we had so much fun. The staff (Sam) was super friendly and enthusiastic and the hidden clue room has been created with so much detail. If you are looking for something a bit different and a fun way to spend an afternoon then I would definitely suggest you give this experience a go! Sherlocked 5 stars!

Like being in a movie!. First I didn't know what to expect, but my mind was blown afterwards! It all starts with someone telling you an exciting story, then you can be part of that story. Truly amazing. It's like being in a movie! The exercises are challenging, you really have to concentrate. The goal is to escape the room within 67 minutes. I had the time of my life. This is far better than all those boring touristy stuff. Best thing in town!

Perfect experience!. We are the hosts of Berlage meet and workspace, and enjoyed this great experience with our team. If you have any doubts, just book it and prepare to be amazed about the amount of work these people have put into this espace room!

Absolutely superb!. The escape room is absolutely superb, so very clever and everything else that’s great! We’re really happy that we’ve made it out of the room in time! I’m sure Berlage is looking down on us with big smile on his face, his eyes filled with pride! This game is a once in a lifetime experience and you can play it with friends, family or co-workers! But, be sure to put on your thinking caps, you'll need them!
Awesome hour of entertainment!. I visited Sherlocked today with my colleagues and it was an amazing experience. Love the details they put in and and the little games in the game.
Amazing. First experience with this kind of attraction. It was really original, mysterious and exciting. I'd really recommend it to anyone who wants to do something different and challenging.

Shermazing. Experience all your senses and trust on your fellow team members. Sharing = multiplying. Get enchanted in Sherlocked. Get Shermazed ;) Our fire department crew almost had to call the actual shift to extricate us ;) be prepared! Richard

Awesome experience. This escape room was great! I went with a group of 5 friends. The story, the little secrets, the puzzles, the time pressure, the looks and feel, the excitement, the riddles: it made our day! I can recommend this experience to everyone! We are still talking about it and it definitely motivated me to look for other experience to hopefully match this great trip!

Get your detective on!. At first, finding the right door to enter Sherlocked in the grand Beurs van Berlage building seemed like part of the puzzle. Once discovered we entered and were greeted very warmly by the lovely lady who would be our guide and storyteller to the Secret Room, and the puzzle of the Society of Crossed Keys. From there, you are locked inside a wonderfully theatrical room full of antiquities and secrets to piece together the ultimate answer - escape.Terrific enjoyment, couldn't recommend any higher.

Amazing. This was a really good experience. I have always loved to solve riddles and to be able to experience them in real life, together with a few friends, definitely made the experience a special one. It was exciting, entertaining, difficult (though not too difficult) and we had a lot of fun.
Fascinating. This escape-room gives you a great hour of entertainment. Nice story, authentic details, great puzzles. All outside help comes too late :-)

Wonderful experience!. Today we went to Sherlocked at the Beurs van Berlage. I really didn't know what to expect. We were kindly welcomed and led to the room. Unfortunately I cannot tell you what happened there. All I can say is that it really was an experience! The crew has really put effort into it. Teamwork, solving puzzles, time pressure, excitement, heart beating in my chest, rushing, amazement.... beautiful location in the historic Beurs van Berlage. I do think that the crew can do something about the hints, some puzzles might need some minor technical tweaking and I would have liked some really intellectual puzzles, but those are really the only small things I can remark about it. Great experience. Really a fantastic activity to do with a small group!
Great for team event. Great opportunity to challenge a tram to work together towards one common goal.... and at the same time, have some fun.

Marvelous flow experience. The beautiful location was the hook, the attention to detail in decor and challenging puzzles were the line and sinker. For an hour I forgot the time as the story, sense of achievement and awe built up as we overcame each obstacle (some of which were mechanically magnificent). It was a marvelous display of story-telling and suspense, and a must experience for anyone in Amsterdam.

Great escape room, loads of fun. Sherlocked is designed with love, care and dedication. It is set in an amazing historical building (Beurs van Berlage) in the very center of Amsterdam and filled with artifacts from the last couple of centuries, thus, it's very atmospheric and authentic. I was there with 3 friends and there was not a dull moment in this hour of eureka moments, setbacks, serendipitous finds and annoying misses. Highly recommended!

Awesome experience! Please organize a new one!. I'm so proud and glad for backing up this initiative on Kickstarter... the outcome was incredibly nice! I joined the campaing with the amount that allowed me and another person to join the experience, but in the end they allowed 4 of us to team up. I really hope they'll organize another escape room in Amsterdam very soon!

Outstanding experience. That was an amazing experience. I have some experience in the quest rooms, but so far, this is the best one. All types of riddles differ from each other, some unexpected moves and definitely an excellent final riddle. It is quite hard, though lots of fun. I strongly recommend it! So far the best activity experience in Amsterdam. Thank you guys!

A lot of fun and excitement. With a group of 6 friends we got locked into a beautiful early-20th century room in the basement of the just as amazing Beurs van Berlage building. The room and the great amount of puzzles it contained were created with a lot of attention to detail and drama. For 65 minutes (we had only 2 minutes left on the clock when we escaped the room) we were detectiving away, using all our senses and combined puzzle-solving skills to crack one after the other fantastic puzzle. It's an awful lot of fun, and the feel of accomplishment after solving each puzzle, and eventually escaping the room, is fantastic. We were all first-timers, but it left us with a taste for a lot more. Can't wait for Sherlocked to open their next escape room!

Sherlocked; the best group activity I have done in years!. Yesterday night we were locked inside a beautiful 19th century room. With artifacts, clues, riddles etc. We had a bit over an hour to get out and it was an unforgettable hour! (I went to bed with images of the quest we have forfilled, and woke up with my head trying to get round the last clues!)We needed the different skills the people of our group had, to find our way out.I can recommend this magnificent hour for any kind of group. Colleagues, friends, family!

Needs to part of your Amsterdam visit. I was visiting Amsterdam with some friends and it was a fun way to learn a bit about the city's mysterious history. Most of all, the room is really well made and challenging as well as exciting in many ways. Don't miss it!

Great experience!!. This was my first room escape and I was impressed!! Sherlocked was definitely a great experience and a fun extraordinary activity to do with friends. I am looking forward to your next room escape

Incredible experience. This is one of the best things I have ever done. Being locked up with a group of friends (5 in our case) for an hour that seemed to be over in mere seconds. Writing anything about what we did would ruin the experience, so lets just say that an hour of puzzling, thinking, trying and being blown away by how clever this is done was simply awesome.Afterwards, we spent over 4 hours hopping up and down in excitement, discussing what we did (and did not) see, and suddenly seeing secret messages, codes and doors just about everywhere :)Not just highly recommended, but something you just really must do.

unprecedented suprising and exceeding expectations. As one of the first ones attending the Sherlocked Escape room, I can say it exceeded all expectations I had. Feeling liberated at every step in the puzzle, a feeling I only get when I win a 6 hours board game, the feeling of solving these puzzles together is so incredibly rewarding. To be active with your hands and head, together your friends... wow!I can recommend this to anyone, and I want to do more and more and more escape rooms! :D

Mysterious, stylish and very exciting!. Wow! This room has style. The best aspect about Sherlocked is how all the little parts and puzzles build a great story together. All our senses got stimulated and besides testing our problem solving skills, the Sherlocked experience really challenged us to think and work as a team!

Exciting and surprising. Some hard puzzles and some simple, but the important thing: with each solution, a burst of delighted excitement ran threw our group, and drove us on to find the next puzzle. We left glowing.

A unique experience. I really enjoyed diving into this alternative reality. It is like being in a movie, only that the time goes by faster...Probably because some of the riddles were really challenging me. I wished I could have this experience every week :)

Mind bogglingly awesome!. I've been sworn to secrecy, but all I can say this was the most riveting experience I've had in my entire visit of Amsterdam.I went with two business relations/friends, my wife and my two children (who were sharper with most of the puzzles than I was). My friends loved it and have booked a game for their whole company team, so I can't really recommend this gem highly enough.

The most intelligent escape room so far.. We've done lots of escape rooms around the world by now. Alongside with one in Bangkok, this has to be the very very best. The puzzles are detailed, smart and exciting and you get to use more than one of your senses, which most rooms don't do. It's so much more than just locks and combinations - Wow. SO EXCITING! We got out 2 minutes before the end when usually we're much faster in other rooms. And the location is only a 4 minute walk from Centraal station in an amazingly beautiful building, which my guests really enjoyed. The room itself is gorgeously decorated and they probably had the best backstory I've ever heard. I would highly recommend this room, which has only been open since August I think.

Fun and engaging family activity!. Our first escape room. It was fun for everyone. After we escaped The Hacker we really wanted to stay to try the BirdCage as well but it was already booked. We will be back for more...

Fun evening out!. If you're a beginner at these sorts of things and are worried whether you'll like it....read on.We thought we'd try it out as it was something different to do in Amsterdam other than the usual. It was just me, my wife, and daughter in the Hacker room and we were all complete novices!Our host started by explaining to us the concept, she was very friendly and helpful. I won't spoil it by going into detail but we got off to a reasonable start (beginners luck!)and then got stuck a couple of times but our host was there watching over us and helped us along the way.We didn't complete it but that didn't matter to us as we all agreed afterwards that even though we were pretty useless at it, we really enjoyed it which is the main thing.We would definitely do another one and maybe next time we will be a little bit wiser and better at it. You need to embrace it for what it is, think a little bit outside the box, and have fun!
Awesome game!. This was one of the best escape rooms we've tried.Very tricky but still very fun to do.We did the hacker room.
The hacker....excellent. Had a great afternoon doing the hacker room......very challenging...... Did not quite make it..... Very close..... Very interactive and challenging...

Must-do in Amsterdam!. If you're looking for something a little different and a lot of fun, this is the perfect activity! The series of challenges provide the perfect activity that is unique and so memorable. Our host Stef was great and super helpful with suggestion other activities for the rest of our stay. Highly recommend.
Really great time . Was a lot of fun, very tricky which is great. The host was really lovely and helpful, and super friendly. Definitely a fun date night or group outing!
Excellent Experience. We booked both rooms and had a boys vs girls. It was brilliant. If you visit Amsterdam you must visit Room of Riddles.
Great attraction, loved it.. We came to room of riddles while visiting amsterdam for the weekend and it did not disappoint. We obviously got out in record time Highly recommended

Excellent adventure!. We had a really nice first time in the Hacker room. Cleverly made room, lots of good codes and challenges. Marta was a really good riddlemaster, and after finishing the Hackerroom we also had a game in the birdcageroom. Superb! We totally recomend Room of riddles place everyone!
Classtrip adventure. During our classtrip in Amsterdam we tried to escape the room of riddles. It was great fun and we had the pleasure to be introduced by our kind and entertaining host Steff :)

Amazing. Guys, if you are nearby Amsterdam you have to check this out! It is so much fun and very exciting. It is something I have never done before, but I will do it again for sure. It is the perfect game for rainy and sunny days. You will enjoy it.

Loved it!! Truly immersive experience!!. We were not very confident at the beginning, but with just the right amount of help we've got -pointing us to look at the right things, just so we can get the hang of it- we even managed to get out!!!Hooray!!

The shortest hour in my life. I spent in the Room of Riddles my shortest hour ever. It seemed to be easy at the beginning. Just solve a few puzzles and the objective, opening the exit door is achieved. Despite our brainstorming the "bomb blew up". The hour was too short.
Fantastic entertainment. Recommend it to all.

So much fun! . We had never done one of these rooms before and struggled slightly at the start but Marta was so helpful and pointed us in the right direction a few times without giving anything away. Would definitely recommend room of riddles to anyone and especially the birdcage experience.

Awesome experience. It was me and my cousin's first time doing an escape room and we loved it. Marta, our hostess, was super nice and gave us just the right hints, without revealing too much. Overall an awesome experience!

Good Escape Room Experience. Having done over 28 escape rooms in Canada, I was very excited to do an escape room during my time in Amsterdam. The location was a bit far from the downtown core area but not too bad in a taxi. The room itself (the Bird Cage) was pretty good - the puzzles were fun and the theming was interesting. We didn't find the puzzles too difficult - but seeing as we had some newbies with us - it was a good room to introduce them to escape rooms. Marta was also really great at giving hints and debriefing us after we finished! We had 7 people in the room, and we did find at times that at times some people were left with not a lot to do so I would definitely recommend coming with 4 or 5 people max. I also really liked that after we finished we all got a beverage - it was definitely a nice way to end a pleasant experience!

A fun adventure with the birds. We did both rooms in two groups at a team outing. My group had the Bird Cage, which is nicely built around the bird and flight theme. The puzzles didn't have a lot of variety and the final puzzle was a little too math-dependant for the taste of some in our group, myself included, but overall it was a fun experience and the host was extremely nice. I wouldn't say it was too challenging or difficult, but our group is rather versed in puzzle-solving, so don't be disappointed if you don't manage to escape in the 60 minutes you have.

Thanks Marta for The Hacker . Having done a lot of escape rooms in the UK, my partner and I booked this for the two of us to see how we would get along. Was really fun and had a great time. Would definitely recommend for anyone starting out with these things wanting to see how they get on. We did the harder room and had a great time.

Great fun, great challenge!. My son (13 yrs) and I had great fun trying (and not quite managing) to solve 'the hacker' game at Room of Riddles. Marta, our cheerful host, was really helpful and was careful to give us just enough clues to keep up our enthusiasm levels but without making things too easy. A great way to end our short trip to Amsterdam.

Very enjoyable experience and lovely people. The whole experience was stimulating and very enjoyable. I would recommend this to anyone willing to try something different with friends. Our riddle master was a very nice woman called Martha and without her help I doubt we would have got far.

New room. The room is brandnew and the puzzles are really cool. It was a little bit difficult for us (2 people) but with the help of our very nice and competent host Marta, we were able to escape in time.

Such a fun experience. Never having done an escape room before, a friend and I decided to give it a go after seeing good reviews online. We decided Room of Riddles as it was one of the cheaper ones available for two people. Our host Stef understood it was our first time so gave us tips without giving away the answer, and even gave us some extra time at the end so we could finish. I was a bit surprised about the location in an office building, but I think that just adds to the quirkiness of it. Would definitely recommend.

So fun!. Went with my parents and two younger sisters, it wasn't our first escapre room ant yet we were so excited! The riddles are sophisticated and challenging and the room itself is so forward with electronical devices. A big adventage is that there are many parking spots available. The owner is lovely and welcoming. Super recommended.

Fantastic experience. Me and my partner visited room of riddles and thought it was a brilliant experience. We had never tried an escape room before but will definitely be doing more in the future! Marta was very friendly and helpful throughout the experience. Would recommend it to everyone!

Nice. Really enjoyed this room of riddles and had a chance to try "The Hacker" room.Instructions are clear, games are fun (and easy but maybe that's because i'm a genius).Last but not least, high recommendation for Marta, as riddle master: she rocks !

Excellent fun time. I booked this for my hen party and we had a fantastic time. We very nearly managed to escape, just needed a few more minutesDefinitely recommend it.It takes around 20 mins from the centre of Amsterdam by tram and only cost a few euros each way.Its right next to tram stop so very easy to find. Its in a suburban area so not much near it. We got there early and a few blocks away we found a supermarket and café but it was hidden away so you would have to ask for helpThe lady at room of riddles - Marta - I think that was her name - was great - really helpful and gave us a couple of clues as we went along

A fun but frustrating experience!. My partner, 17 y/o son and myself visited the Room of Riddles and really didnt know what to expect, never having done anything like this before. Directions to the building were very clear and the coffee shop on the ground floor is a nice place to wait if you are early for your booking. Our guide Marta was very helpful and friendly. The riddle room itself was much more challenging than we had anticipated and we needed a lot of help as we kept seeing useful info and objects but didnt understand their significance. It did leave us feeling rather stupid and frustrated because we didnt manage to solve the puzzle in the allotted time! It was fun and definitely something new for us. It was very professionally designed and equipped. We would definitely go back and try the other room another time. Good for families with teenagers or groups of friends.

Challenging room for 7. This was only my second room escape but me and my team managed to escape with some 2 minutes left. Excellent guide, although he did forget his cell in the room which made him enter, we'll forgive him for it ;)

First time escape-experience. An exiting thing to do as a family. My two daughters (on 18 and 20) and I had a really good time solving escape room puzzles for the first time. We played The Birdcage and found it to be very engaging. It was challenging, but with a little help at the right moments, we got the clues we needed to move forward. Our host was superfriendly from the minute we entered the building. When the time ran out and he saw that we almost had the solution, he let us spend the extra 1 or 2 minutes to unlock the keys. As a father, I really enjoyed solving puzzles with my two grown-up daughters and we are alredy searching for more escape rooms to visit.

Awesome!. I visited Room of Riddles two times and I can highly recommend it! Specially the new room "The Hacker" was awesome. We had a great riddle master Marta who made the visit both warm and welcoming. Totally recommended for groups of friends, but was also nice with two kids. Lekker!

Super nice experience!!!. We visited Room of Riddles already second time. This time we got to escape the brand new room, that was very exciting! I highly recommend Room of Riddles of Amsterdam to groups of friends and families (with kids 10 years old and older). It's great for team building too! The staff is very nice and helpful. Special thanks to Marta, our riddle master, who made the experience even cooler for us!

Escape Room, Amsterdam. I bought this experience as a birthday present for my Dad, we did it as a group of 5 people and had a great time. Stef was a brilliant host and the puzzle room completely exceeded all expectations - the puzzles were fun and challenging but not too difficult! We escaped with 8 minutes to spare and would definitely do it again.

Team work a must.. Super pleased that as a group of 3 we were able to get out of "The Hacker". A sleek room where they have invested in a diverse range of clues, tasks and riddles - communication and team work is a must.Staff are very friendly, will head back for the birdcage for sure.

Amazing. This was our first time trying to play "escape room" and we're trying it again for sure. We had a great time at Room of Riddles and our host Fatima was amazing!! :)You should try it, you won't be dissapointed!

The hacker . Did the Hacker escape and it was great. Many gadgets and cool technology were part of the challenge, which made it challenging, yet cool and new age. Martha, the host, was like a reliable parent in the amount of positive nudging in the right direction she offered. It was just right to prevent getting stuck, and to have the feelings of accomplishment once completed. Great setup altogether.

They have great gadgets. I've been to both the bird cage and the hacker. Although both are relatively small spaces, with a single room, they have very cool gadgets and creative puzzles.Our guide Marta was really enthusiastic about the rooms and gave good hints when needed.
Marta's Angels. Marta was amazing! We loved every second of it. And with Marta helping us out was even better. So cool! Really recommend it to anyone! Thank you so much!Myrthe

Great riddles!. It's a great escape room. You would not expect it when you come to the building but room of riddles has changed an office into a room filled with difficult riddles. It's was a good challenge for the four of us. Teamwork, communication is need to solve all of them. The hosts were very friendly and they make the experience even better with their enthusiasm.

Great room, Great expirience. We went to to test the Hacker escape room. Was really nice expirience :) I really recomend it to everyone that wants to see a bit of a different Amsterdam. Guys are great! Free soft drinks, cool place and really neat room:) only one word GREAT!

I can't get enough!. We got the chance to play the new escape room, The Hacker! It was so much better than I could have imagined. I loved the thrill of being locked in a room and just having to figure it out! It was only the 4 of us, but so amazing to see how everybody approaches a problem from a slightly different angle. What a fun and creative way to use your brains and work together! Will definitely be doing more of this!!

New Escape Game One Of A Kind Experience at Room Of Riddles. Great host and a great game! pretty much anything you'd expect while playing an escape game.
We played the new escape room and it was really awesome, we worked as a team to escape (just in time). I played escape games before but this was definitely the best escape game i've played so far!!

Such good fun!. Room of riddles was recommended to my husband and I by a friend. I booked it about 2 months before and lucky we did because they seemed quite booked up. It is a tram ride away from central Amsterdam and takes about 15 minutes. Only costs €5.40 for 2.We found it fun and irritating at the same time! You go into a room and have to find clues to get yourself out, took us 20 minutes to turn the lights on using the first clue! We had fun and will Deffo do it again !
Unless you enjoy solving algebraic riddles, choose something else. We were left in the dark for way too long. Solving math equations is not my idea of a good escape game.

Amazing moment with friends! . Room of riddles in Amsterdam was great! We had so much fun. If you want to do an original activity in Amsterdam go for room of riddles with your friends! The girl in charge of our trap room was very niceThank you

Awesome experience!. There was a small group of us in Amsterdam for a bachelor party. We've seen escape rooms in other cities, but most of us had never tried one. We liked solving the first room so much, we did the second room! Marta was very welcoming and helpful. We had a chance to meet the owner as well, it was cool to meet the person who thought up the puzzles. We would definitely come back once more rooms are ready.

Great time in the Room of Riddles. Six of us were visiting Amsterdam from Canada over the weekend for a bachelor party, and had booked a room on Saturday to give us something to do during the day. For five of the group, an escape room was a completely new experience. In case you haven't experienced one before, I won't go into detail, as part of the fun is the whole surprise. We were greeted by our host Marta, who gave us a summary of how to play the game, then we were locked in our room. We had such a great time escaping the first one, that we actually did the second available room right afterwards.Marta was a wonderful host, and we also got to meet the owner, who is a cool guy as well. The whole experience from the time we showed up to the building to when we left, was top notch. I highly recommend if you happen to be in Amsterdam, and have a few people to go with. You'll have a great time.

Amsterdam must do!. I would highly recommend this if you are looking for a fun activity in Amsterdam! The staff are extremely kind and helpful and go above and beyond - even walking the streets of Amsterdam to find us when we got lost!! The Game was probably the best we have done and the staff made it even more exciting! We would definitely go again
The Birthday Bash. It was quite a challenge to escape from the Room of Riddles, with very cleverly hidden clues to crack your brain. The room was nicely set and Martha was very welcoming.

The different escape Game. We were in Amsterdam to visit the UpTheGame Escape Game Convention. Of course we had to play some games.We booked Room Of Riddles the day we played....so last minute.Its good that it is possible.As we run an escape game ourselves we are very critical.As soon as we arrived we had to go through what we call "dutch way to enter an escape game"....means you have to call someone.Fatima our host or Riddle Master opened the door and we were in a good mood instantly.You feel that she loves her job and the game she hosts.After a little briefing we started to play. The game itself is very different to other escape games. There is no storyline but a room full of riddles. Different approach but not bad.We struggled very much to solve those riddles and did not make it within 60 minutes but we had much fun.This game is designed for people who like to solve proper logic riddles and its very important to work precise.Big Ups for Fatima who did a perfect job. We felt very much welcome and she took time for a longer chat afterwards even if it was the last slot of the day and quite late already.Thank you very much!
Fun and clever. And our host was excellent. The room is clever and the puzzles well thouht out. We got out in the last minute! Escape games are fun!

Challenging team build activity !. Great team build activity. It was our first escape game and the Bird Cage was the challenge we were looking for! Absolutely not that evident to get out of there! In fact it took us 70 minutes! I absolutely suggest it! :)

Must experience in Amsterdam . Room of Riddles was one of the highlights of our trip. We arrived early and Stef (who was so friendly and helpful throughout our visit) invited us in and we started immediately. We decided to take on 'Birdcage' as a pair and having never done an escape room before, we found it just the right amount of challenging and very fun. Stef was very welcoming and chatted to us before and after our visit, making us feel very relaxed and at ease. I throughly recommend this experience and look forward to trying others in the future. A big thank you to Stef for being so accommodating and friendly!

Fun, challenging and great team work. We went to the Room of Riddles on a Saturday evening, a group of 6 persons. Some of us have never been to escape rooms before and none of us is speaking Dutch or English as native languages, so we were a bit nervous.It was amazing !! We had lots of fun and enjoyed the challenges as they are smart and well thought. It's not too easy and not too hard. And it requires all different skills so it made it very suited for team work.Marta was very friendly and gave just the right tips so we don't stay in the room forever. We also enjoyed her recommendations and advice before and after. Thank you Marta !
Was really awesome playing here. We did a lot of escapes rooms and this one, surely is one of the best. There are 2 difficulty levels

Both room completed. Last year 3 of us tried the Birdcage and had a great time, this year 6 of us raced against each over 3 vs 3. The rooms are challenging but they offer clues to help if needed so you don't feel overwhelmed.Stef said about a new room that we will try next year. A must if travelling to Amsterdam A+++

Great fun. 10 of us visited the Room of Riddles on a hen weekend. It was such a blast and who knew how competitive we could all be. Obviously pleased my team won of course. Great fun, highly recommend.

Fun, fun, fun!. My daughter and I had a day and a half to spend in Amsterdam. As we had been there before, we were looking for something a bit different and this fit the bill. Steff was our guide thru the entire process and we almost made it within the 60 minutes. The puzzles were interesting and Steff watches you over a closed circuit TV to help you stay on the right path or give you additional hints if needed (which we did). I really like the whole idea and can't wait to do this again! It would be great for a family or really any age. I think we laughed at our selves most of the time. It makes you really use those brain cells!

SUCH AN GREAT EXPERIENCE. Went yesterday to the room of riddles and me and my friend had a BLAST!We're gonna visit room of riddles Antwerp as soon as we can!!!want to thank Marta for the great time yesterday!!
Very funny. Very funny experience and our intructor Fatima was absolutely great! It's a bit outside from the city center (no problem with the tram) but definitely worth a visit.

Great fun!. We had a great time escaping the room, the puzzles were challenging and overall it was a really fun experience. The setting and location weren't what I was expecting though as it was a small area within a large office building and there wasn't much atmosphere. Also there was no theme or 'story' as such which I thought there would be. The game was still lots of fun but I've heard of other escape games which seemed to have more to offer. Had a great time though!

Had a great time with Stef and the Room of Riddles!. We had such a great time in the Traveller's Suite. It was so much fun. Stef was our Riddle Master for the day and he was great, really friendly and helpful. We didn't need his help in the room, but were glad that he was there watching! We were on a stag do for our friend who loves puzzles and games and things like that, and she absolutely loved it. I would definitely recommend going if you're in amsterdam and it's really worth it.

Great fun but low tech and weak theme. I've done both rooms at Room of Riddles. The rooms are both good challenges and fun but the themes are not strong and there is little technology invested in them. From an overall experience point of view there are other rooms in Amsterdam that are much better.

Amazing experience, so much better than expected!. As a whole, the experience was so so so good! The setting for it in an office block was rather strange but if anything that added too the experience. Once all the rules had been explained and we started its quite daunting at first but once you get into it, its so much fun.Marta was equally amazing, genuinely nice and funny person, made the whole day that much better.Recommend it to anyone that's thinking of going.Team H.A.R.D!

we managed to get out, but with a lot of help from Marta!. Thank you so much Marta for helping us in the travellers room, we could not have done it without you! was a fascinating experience and we hope to come again soon!

Such a fun experience . I have never done anything like this before and didn't know what to expect but was so much fun and would definitely do it again! Four of us completed the travellers room in 59 mins. It was challenging and we needed help a few times but managed to figure it out eventually! The room is located in an office block so we wasn't sure we're at the correct place at first so don't be put off by this as the staff come down and bring you up. Overall a great evening - highly recommended :)
Loved it!. Went tonight as part of a friend's birthday weekend. None of us had done anything like this so we struggled a bit but finished and escaped! Definitely worth going!

ABSOLUTELY BRILLANT!!!. My seven friends and I had no idea what to expect and this experience certainly achieved even more than we thought! Such a great team building activity suitable for any adults young or old. We were split up into two groups of four and it worked so smoothly. Stef who was our Riddle Master was so kind and friendly and great throughout the whole experience. Thank you for such a fun and exciting opportunity! Can't wait for the new room!
Lovely team building event!. We went here for a team buidlding outing and it is a lovely way to work together to get out of the room in time. The whole team enjoyed the experience a lot!

SOOOO Brilliant!. Room of Riddles was absolutely a highlight of my visit to Amsterdam! I didn't really know what to expect when I booked it but it was just so much fun. Steph (or Stef) was our host and he was just fantastic! He kept it all really mysterious and was a big part of how fun it was, such a great fun guy! The room itself was such a test, I've never done anything like it and will certainly be back to try the other room and keep seeking out this activity every time I travel. It was so different and fun. I definitely recommend to anyone who wants to try something strange and different! Thanks again to our brilliant host!!!P.S. It's not scary and not claustrophobic like I imagined it to be - genuinely just really chilled and enjoyable!
Hen do at riddles . Great activity, we had 2 teams, all really happy with it and definitely good value for money. Riddle master was lovely too.

Great for teambuilding!. We went to the room of riddles as a teambuilding activity. We were welcomed by a nice lady named Martha who gave a very clear explanation and made us feel welcome. The room of riddles was challenging and very fun to do. It definitely drew everybody closer to each other. Very happy with the activity and very pleased with the results. Would definitely recommend others
Lovely challenge!. Just did the "Bird room". Just do it! Beat 49 minutes. But not so easy so you need your brain to get hot. Recommend to spend some time in it when you are in Amsterdam

Great end to a great week!. Despite being very tired, after 3 days of enjoying all Amsterdam has to offer we stumbled up to the home of riddles. We struggled at first but Stef helped us through! I'd recommend this even for those who have severe learning disabilities!! Xoxo The Wavey Gang

Mastering the Riddles. We had a really great experience at Room of Riddles this afternoon. Nine of us split between two rooms. Marta was superb in her role as riddle master. We all had lots of fun, laughed until our ribs ached and left with lots of happy memories. Very easy to get to on the No 2 tram from Dam Square. Make sure you add this to your "to do" list when visiting Amsterdam.
Great time!. It was our first time doing something like this and we really enjoyed it!! Marta was a great riddle master! Really fun way to spend an hour! Highly recommend :)

Original experience. Our group of 6 had a lot of fun doing the bird cage which was just challenging enough. Plenty of different types of riddles and mechanism. Stef was a very very nice host who was able to guide us just when it was getting too frustrating. I just found the room a bit big which made it harder to teamwork and communicate.I however would completely recommend this experience to any 3+ group of people, it is a great way to spend time together

Wonderfully strange. I really wasn't sure what I'd gotten myself into having travelled what seemed like so far out of town and ending up outside a block of offices. My confusion continued when we met Stef, our riddle master who brought us into a little room with sweets and quirky toys. He was very friendly and welcoming and really kept the air of mystery about the place going in our briefing. The game itself was fantastic, very clever and great fun. We escaped the advanced room with 15 minutes remaining, not an easy task. The quality of the game itself was excellent, but the Room of Riddles must be congratulated for its super friendly and welcoming staff, it's quirky grounds and it's unique atmosphere. We even met the owner after the game who chatted to us for another 20 minutes after offering us a soda and dressing us up for a photo. Highly recommend.

New experience in Amsterdam 😀. Booked Room of Riddles with friends to celebrate my husbands 50th! 8 of us in total, split into two rooms......the girls in Birdcage (harder room) and boys in Travelroom. Naturally the girls triumphed! . Fab afternoon, highly recommended
Great experience. We took the advanced escape room, it was challenging and fun, we really enjoyed and we still talk about it..
Room of riddles - birdcage. We really enjoyed our experience with riddle master Stef. We escaped the bird cage with 2.5 minutes to spare.

Something different!. We had Fatima who was great fun, really helpful and so enthusiastic. We had never done an escape room before so didn't know what to expect but Fatima was quick to put us at ease and explain how it was going to work. We were in the travellers room and got out in 46 minutes. Highly recommend this - is something to talk about and is so different to the normal things offered whilst travelling. Easy to get to on the tram from dam square too. Was also one of the most reasonable of all the escape rooms in Amsterdam. It was our anniversary and Fatima lit a candle on a cake for us which was a nice touch. Give it a go you won't regret it!

Brilliant birthday surprise. I booked Room of Riddles for my friends birthday surprise, there were 6 of us. We arrived 10 minutes early, the location is quite confusing and middle of what seems like a business park. We saw a small sign saying to ring the phone number to be collected. Our guide was Fatima who was really lovely and informative. We sat in a room with mini games and sweets in, we were then explained all the rules of the game and given a walkie talkie. I won't say what's in the room so it's kept a surprise but it's REALLY fun. It makes you use your basic skills and work as a team. You can use the walkie talkie if you get really stuck to get some extra hints. Unfortunately we ran out of time and went around 5 minutes over the time, we didn't give up and finished the game which was very rewarding. Fatima bought out a mini cake and a candle for our friend and we sang him happy birthday and then we were given props and 1 soft drink and had our photos taken. It was such fun and I would defiantly recommend you do this when you visit Amsterdam!

Very good experience! . We tried room of riddles last night and it was a very pleasant activity. It was the first time for us and we almost got out of the room in time thanks to Marta's advices.Thank you for your welcome!
Loved it!. Our host, Stef, was fantastic! The experience was exciting, fun and hugely challenging. I totally loved doing this with my team - it was my first time and I'd LOVE to do another one soon!
Amazing!. Really great time. A lot of fun and our riddle master was fantastic. It was really easy to get to on the tram. Thoroughly recommend.

Very entertaining (and a bonus!). we went to the room of riddles for my girlfriend's birthday (a fact i made sure to let them know in advance).The pre-game explanation was clear and the room was moderately difficult. The atmosphere and idea are really nice.The extra bonus, however, came in the form of a birthday cupcake, treats and even a small present. that for me (and for my girlfriend) made this a great experience.Thanks!

Riddle Delight. My friend and I struggled with finding the place so were flustered on arrival but our lovely host Marta was quick enough to make us feel welcome and relaxed. We had such a laugh struggling to get out of the room. We must of been a laugh to watch as well.Our host Marta was fantastic at encouraging us along the way. Once complete we were given a can of juice got a silly picture and chatted away to Marta about the company and riddle rooms. Overall fantastic will definitely be back. Thank you again to Marta.

Exciting Riddle. We visited the bird cage room and it was so much fun! A lot of riddles to solve with a lot of twist. It will be perfect if it has background story to the room to build the vibe of the game. But still this is enjoyable. Oh and the souvenirs also give it a plus!!

Gone in 60 minutes. Just did this today. First of all - Fatima was an excellent host at Room of Riddles!After few rules and a short chat we got into our room (the little bit harder one I was told).And the clock starts with 60 minutes. First time I looked we had wasted 15 minutes.Second time I looked we had spent 30 minutes.With about 2 minutes left we got out of the room. It was one of the fastests hours in my life. Room of Riddles felt a little bit different than other room escapes we've done. But it was just as excellent or even better.My tip to others - do not be afraid to ask for help from the host. And yeah - the place is located in a office building and you have to call when you arrive.If you have the possibility to visit Room of Riddles, do not hesitate to book it for your trip.

Great riddles, love it!. We were with 5 persons in 'The BirdCage', we probably did a lot of things that makde the staff laugh but hey, we had a great time.Unfortunately we didn't escape...yes, I know, our ego's are damaged for the rest of thje year ;)
Room of riddle at Amsterdam. Great attraction!!!!! Great experiance. We had a wonderfull time. Stephan was very nice and welcoming- highly reccomended.

Wonderful Birthday Experience. We had a great time solving The Birdcage at Room of Riddles. This was everyone's first time trying an escape room (we were slightly nervous) and Marta helped us feel more comfortable about the experience. The puzzles were fun and doable and we finished with 16:02 remaining. I would definitely like to go back and try their other room. Overall it was a wonderful experience.

Overrated. The staff was very nice and welcoming, but the rooms are in an office building which lacks atmosphere. We did the travelers room and there was not much decor - the riddles were mainly about opening locks and nothing exciting or unexpected. If you have to choose, go for Logic Locks: without any doubt a much better escape room with amazing and challenging riddles.

Very cool activity. Much better than expected, even hungover... A group of us booked this the day before on a whim as it seemed like something totally new. We felt like we regretted booking a mentally challenging activity the morning before but actually it seemed to blow of the cobwebs and wake us all up. It was just the right level of challenging. Our host was Fatima and she was great, really friendly and hospitable. I would definitely go back to try the second room in future, hopefully she'd be there again!

Room of Riddles 'Traveller's Suite' - Best thing we did in Amsterdam!. Myself and my boyfriend visited Room of Riddles on a recent trip to Amsterdam. It was, by far, the best activity we did over the weekend and, much to our surprise, we managed to get out within the time!Stef was our riddle-master and he really added to the experience as he was a fantastic host!Highly recommended!

Excellent game!. This was my first time in an escape room and it was so much fun! My girlfriend and I tried the Birdcage room and very nearly escaped in time. We're planning on going back to try the other room because we had such a good time. We weren't sure what to expect but the riddles were really varied and required creative thought and teamwork to solve. Our guide was fun and friendly despite the fact we were pretty late!The only problem we had is that the location was not signposted so we ended up getting a little bit lost in the local area looking for it. Tip: it's the big professional building with Nest and a recruitment company inside.Thanks Room of Riddles for a great morning :)

Totally brilliant!. We visited for my husbands 30th. .. It was our first time at this type of thing and we totally loved it! Our hostess (fatima ) was absolutely amazing! Even got my husband a little cake with a candle :-) can't wait to try it again x

Awesome experience!. Me and three friends were told about room of riddles and were so excited to try it for ourselves! When we arrived Fatima was so friendly and helpful and explained what we needed to do so well. She offered us free sweets, so I instantly fell in love... In the traveller room it was a fantastic experience, really interesting riddles to solve and the time went so quickly. Fatima was there on the other side of the walkie talkie to help us with anything we needed and really looked after us. Fatima and the room was the best part of this experience! I would give her 6 stars if I could!Can't wait to go back and try the birdcage next time!

Room of Riddles was great fun!. Room of Riddles was a great experience. There are two rooms: the Birdcage and The Travellers room. Me and my wife booked the Travellers room. The room was challenging enough and the puzzles were fun to solve. Our hostess (or Riddlemaster) Fatima was very kind and provided good explanation. She would check our progress once in a while and provide hints if stuck but without spoiling the game. Beware that room of riddles is very easy to travel by public transport, but is located outside the city centre of Amsterdam. All in all a very fun thing to do!

First time at this type of game. Me and my two mates went there with the intention of completing it within the hr time slot, unfortunately we not as smart as we thought we were, lol , they allowed us to run over by 15mins so at least we had the satisfaction of completing it, in my opinion it was very entertaining as we couldn't stop talking about it on trip back into city, challenging but not to tricky to stump you.

7 November 2015. I've been in the bird cage with a few friends on 7/11/2015. It was really awesome to do and the person who helped us was really nice! Thanks Marta for helping us! We had a really great time.

Great Escape Room!. My boyfriend and I completed the Birdcage with 2 minutes to spare! We have done escape rooms before and this one was one of our favourites. Room was fun and well laid out, and Fatima was a great riddle leader! Very enthusiastic and informative. We also liked the little touch of a free drink at the end and sweets on the table. Seems a bit far out on the map but is so easy to get to on the tram.
Great fun!. Loved the room of riddles, harder than it looks but great fun to do. We couldn't have escaped with out the help of our great riddle master Marta!
Duchies brothers. Just escaped with my brothers. Very nice escape room . We will visit the room of riddles again . Enjoyed it very much

Great fun!. Booked our visit to the Room of Riddles because we had already heard positive reviews from friends. Were a group of 5 and it was a very fun experience were you work together and think hard but have fun at the same time. The riddle master who welcomed us and guided us was very nice and welcoming. Definitely worth a visit.

Great time!!. My husband and I did the Birdcage room and had a great time! A little frustrating, but we figured it out and had a lot of fun doing it. Highly recommended! Our riddle master was great too!

A++++. Started with a really good welcome (thank you Stef), then the challenge began... Locked in a room for 1 hour in order to find the key that will give you back your freedom. Teamwork and logical spirit are the key to get through that amazing expérience!

Once-in-a- lifetime experience :). Dear Riddles Team,Thank you so much for the great fun and exciting experience! Special thanks goes to Marta for making our engagement event really unforgettable moment!
So much fun. I went with my fiancée. We had never heard of escape rooms but was so much fun. Fatima looked after us and was amazing and very friendly.

Good set-up. Having done quite a few escape rooms in many cities, one in Amsterdam was a must. We were a group of 6 and did both rooms in smaller groups. Our quiz master was charming and helpful and helped out where needed only. Even with our experience, getting past the first clue here (in both rooms) was the most difficult part. Something that was different was that in the TV which showed our time remaining, every 15 minutes or so a hint at a clue would pop up. We were often already past that clue, but it could be helpful for some teams who are falling behind. Overall a fun experience and Fatima was a great hostess!
Riddles fun. Enjoyed our first experience of a locked room. We got out with 1.47 mins to spare. We all enjoyed the game and will defo do another. Worth a visit in Amsterdam.

Defiantly recommend!. Went with my boyfriend as something to do whilst in Amsterdam. This was thoughly enjoyable and made our trip! We enjoyed our time in the room and worked together to escape the room just in time. The girl working there (with curly hair) was amazing and very accommodating and helpful.Would defiantly suggest anyone considering it to go, you won't regret it We were staying in the centre of Amsterdam and was roughly 15 minute bike ride but was a lovely ride through a beautiful park and we spend time on the way back to stop and see more of Amsterdam.

Dots Gals had a great time . This was a great experience and something different to do on our city break. The room was difficult without being too hard and we had lots of fun. We would definitely recommend it whilst you're in Amsterdam! (A group of five ladies)

Go Go Go - it is a must expiriance. we went as a cupple and this was the first time both of us tried an escape room - we both LOVED IT!!!!!!Patima was our lovely host she was kind and fun and gave extra value to our experience.price is a little high but was worth every cent.for an our we felt like kids but also like sherlok holms.even thow we did not get out in time it did not reduse our joy and fun from this attraction.as my subject line say - GO GO GO - this is a great place

Escape from the Bird Cage. My wife and I (from Barcelona) went on holiday to Holland and we love escape games. We already did several of them in Barcelona and we wanted to do it in our holidays to make them more special. We chose Room of Riddles and the experience was truly awesome. Fatima (our Riddle Master) welcomed us in the lobby of the building and she was really friendly all the time. We talked a little bit about the game rules and then we started our challenge! It was super funny! We got stuck a couple of times but with the hints we could escape with 5:40 minutes left. After that, Fatima invited us to a drink while we chatted about our escape. We definitely recommend this experience to everyone who wants to have a great time in Amsterdam. ROOM OF RIDDLES RULES!!!!!

Awesome time in the cage. One of my friends and I decided to do the Bird Cage while on our trip to Amsterdam. Our game master Fatima was really amazing. She spent time briefing us on what to do and genuinely being friendly. The setup of the room was quite nice. It was a bit tricky at times but definitely doable. The drinks and chat afterwards were awesome. Thanks for the wonderful experience!
Fun, fun, fun!!!. We had so much fun here! The time flew by as we hunted for clues! Clever setup to make the little grey cells work!
The travellers room . Great game , great hostess, awesome fun, highly recommended for puzzle lovers. Good value for money. We will be back to do another room X

Stuck in the Bird Cage. Getting there is easy since it's on the trolley line. It's a bit pricey, so I'd only do it once. Okay, so maybe I'm not much of a riddle figure outer. There was two of us and it took us quite a while to figure out the lights! Ha! We did get some hints given to us. Overall it was a fun experience.

Great place to have a mystery of a time. Thanks to Fatima this place is the epitomy of a good time, with the first riddle being the main entrance. It gets you so in the mood that while Fatima was preparing the room we actually thought the game had started and we proceeded to look around the lobby ecstatically. All in all the game is pretty straightforward in theory but the fun of having clues thrown at you (and some help if needed) while you try to combine playful riddles had us laughing hard. A real must.

Had a great time!. We're Americans that were visiting Amsterdam, and we were glad to see this different type of entertainment.
The directions to find the building were clear, and we found it without a problem.
Our hostess, Marta, was very helpful and pleasant.
We recommend this for anyone looking for a couples or group activity.
Rooms of Riddle. Lots of fun!!! Fatima was a great instructor and host! 👍Even by bicycle you can quickly get there...

Evolution of the Game!!. For the generation that spent hours and hours infront of the computer screen trying to solve mindbreaking riddles und puzzles, the Room takes the Adventure Games to a whole new level.We didn't have any previous experience with this kind of 'Rooms'and the choose of the 'difficult' one was a little bit of challenge for the beginning...We didn't escape from the Room but we surely escape into something completely new and refreshing!Just get off your seats and try to escape from the Room!!Room of Riddles gives another good reason to visit and revisit the beautiful city of Amsterdam!!P.S Fatima ur the best Hostess and Riddle Master!!Thanks for a fantastic experience!Nikolas-Ismini

We left the best for the last. Greatest experience I had throughout my stay. We went as a group of 8 friends and split up into 2 teams. One team did the Traveller's room and the others did the Bird Cage. It was tons of fun and Fatima (our Riddle Master) was so friendly and helpful. This was our first time trying an escape game but I really want to try another one very soon.

Highlight of the trip!. We were unsure of what to expect from Room of Riddles as we had not taken part in an escape game before. Marta was an excellent host who was extremely helpful when we were stuck! We would definitely go to an escape game again.

Best 60mins locked up ever!. Had a brilliant time at room of riddles in amsterdam with our host Fatima. She made us feel very welcome and explained the game brilliantly! The clues were good and we escaped with 2mins 50secs to spare. Definitely recommend it!

Fun for the whole family. We were in Amsterdam for my son's birthday. He loves puzzles and riddles, so we thought this might be something fun and different from all the museums and historical sites we've been dragging our kids to. Room of Riddles turned out to be just that! We had a 5pm reservation and were done in time for dinner, so it's nice that it doesn't take the whole day. Location is a bit outside the center of town, but an easy street car ride and short walk to a nondescript office building. There's no doorbell, so you have to make a phone call to be let in, which can be inconvenient as an international traveler. Luckily, we arrived at the same time as another group, so we didn't have to deal with this part. We were greeted warmly by Marta--our excellent puzzle mistress. She gave us a thorough briefing in a conference room before showing us into the Travelers' Room (for beginners). I don't want to give away too much, but, for one hour, our family of four was locked in a room. To get out of the room, we had to work together to follow clues, and solve various riddles and puzzles. Our team was made up of 2 adults (we both have PhDs, which didn't help), a 13 year old boy, and a 9 year old boy. We barely made it out in time, and only because our puzzle mistress gave us subtle yet helpful hints at the end (She was able to communicate with us over a walkie talkie). Afterwards, we met up in the conference room again for soft drinks, treats, and photos. It was fun to hear from the other group about their experience with the more advanced Bird Cage room. Everyone was giddy from the experience, especially our 9 year old birthday boy. He wants to plan our next vacation to Barcelona because a Room of Riddles is supposed to open there. This was a fun and refreshing activity, highly recommended for families looking for a museum break!

Very fun, highly recommended!. We weren't sure what exactly we should expect from this attraction. We were looking for something indoors to do as the weather was not great. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor we decided to try it out and we were not disappointed. We did the Traveler's room and we really got into it. Marta, our riddle master was very helpful and nice and recommended a great lunch spot for after. We went as a couple and it was really great. We will definitely be returning and recommend the Room of Riddles to everyone!
Great fun. . So we went slightly over our allocated hour but we managed to escape. Solving the riddles took some thinking. Was great fun will do others.

An alternative attraction. A different way to spend an afternoon, very enjoyable. Thank you to Marta for the helpful clues. The riddles are challenging but not impossible, having played similar computer games before helped a bit.

Fun and good value alternative entertainment. Four of us enjoyed our time at the room of riddles. We did the "bird cage" room and while we found it pretty difficult (it was our first attempt at an escape room for all of us), Marta, our excellent host was on hand to give us a nudge in the right direction when we were desperate. It was challenging enough even with the extra hints, but we escaped in the end! I would recommend this activity for any group of friends/family looking for alternative entertainment!

Riddles and mystery. An interesting experience of solving riddles and puzzle to get your way out :)Stimulates team work and teases your brain.We enjoyed a detailed introduction and aftermath with Marta, the riddle master.Recommend to everyone :)
Great puzzles. Me and my girlfriend had a great time at the room of riddles, the host Marta was fantastic and made the whole experience great. Would definitely come back to try the other room

Highlight of our Vacation!. We were a family of 5 that did the Bird Cage. We were not quite sure what to expect but it was one of the top things that we did on our vacation. We had never done a real life escape room before and didn't know what to expect but it was awesome. Marta was the perfect Riddle Master and we really appreciated her tips. Highly recommend!

Wow!. My father made us reservation for 9 pm. My girlfriend was a little but scary and suspicious in the beginning - after 10 min inside she was so into it!! It was our first time in escape game, and it was just fantastic!! Must go place! 5 stars !!

Riddle till you're an addict ;-). Traveller's Suite; good room for beginners, lots of puzzles to solve. It's all about the codes in this room. Advise 3 to 4 people.Bird Cage: a lot more challenging. Work systematically or you miss too many clues. Use your eyes and really look around! Advise 3 to 4 people.Stef, thanks for the great support and being such a lovely Riddle Master. You have made me an addict for this kind of games!

Stuck in the riddle with you.... Had a great time at Room of Riddles. Went with my wife who was skeptical at first but came out raving about it. Was quite challenging but we made it out on right at the end! Marta was a great host and helped when required without giving the game away. Would highly recommend it, you'll still be talking about it throughout the day!

Excellent!. Me and my partner had a great time at the Room of Riddles. It was our first time in a real life escape room and solving the clues were challenging yet fun. Our host, Marta, made us feel welcome and explained the concept well. Thanks for the lovely experience!

A great new experience. Visited the Room of Riddles in Amsterdam with my family of 4 and we had a great time. In the room of riddles you are 'locked' (there is an exit if required) in a room and have an hour to escape by solving Riddles of different varieties. The staff were wonderful offering everything from helpful advice to free refreshments and all with a friendly manner. This was our first experience at the room of riddles but won't be the last.
Excellent teaser. Great welcome from Steph at the entrance, which led to a very entertaining, enjoyable and yes, puzzling 60 minutes.No more clues..just book it!!

Great first escape room. Little out of town, but on a good tram route and very easy to find with the directions given in the booking confirmation. Slightly inconvenient not having its own doorbell if you have issues with using your phone abroad but it sort of adds to the mystery! We've never played an escape room before so it was a great first experience. Our host Stef was very friendly and helpful, giving clues when asked and nudges in the right direction when we were a little stuck. We played the travellers room, well suited to first timers and we managed to get out before time. We had a really good time and are really looking forward to doing this sort of thing again!

Fun activity in Amsterdam. We can definitely recomment the Room of Riddles for a stay in Amsterdam. You can solve the puzzles and riddles without any specific knowledge and you will definitely have a fun time trying to get out of the room.

Room of riddles - great fun. Worth a try!. Highly recommend this game event challenge. It's on the outskirts of Amsterdam central. We used tram 2.We went as a pair, 60 mins is the perfect amount of time. We weren't brilliant at it. We needed lots of help from Marta (thanks again Marta!) but we still managed to solve some of the clues by ourselves and none the less had a lot of fun trying.It's a bit expensive so budget for it and book in advance. The only thing I would add, you need to call them to get in. We found the building (modern green glass office type) very easily thanks to a helpful tram conductor and clear road sign, but it would have been better if there was a poster or sign for Room of riddles outside the building, but even more so a doorbell! Having signal on your phone etc is vital to get in. Not very helpful for tourists paying a phone bill abroad.Otherwise fab! You should go if you fancy doing something different that not all your friends will have done in Amsterdam.

Bird Cage. Visited with our 2 teenage kids. We had a fab time. It was a really good way to spend a couple of hours with the kids. We needed the clues provided by Violet but managed to get out in just over 60 minutes. Would definitely recommend this place. Hoping to go back and try another room soon. Thanks Violet for a fab experience, you were great x

Great fun although a little freaky at first.. I play quite a few escape games when I'm chilling out, so when I saw this advertised on here under 'things to do' I thought it would be quite cool to play in real life. Was booked solid but they contacted me the day before to tell me a space had become available which was great.Originally booked The Birdcage but ended up doing the Traveler's Escape as our guide Marta suggested that for just two people it might be better suited, so I don't know what the Birdcage is like but the one we did was fun. The game itself is very well thought out & plays through in a good, logical order and Marta was helpful with only a couple of questioning type hints at what seemed like the exact right times for her to comment as we must have looked like we'd gotten stuck, so 10/10 for her guidance and friendliness over the entire time we were there, thank you. :0)Only thing that was a little disappointing was when you get there was there's no great way to tell them you've arrived if your phone doesn't work/has no signal, especially as it generally costs a fortune to call when you're abroad, so a buzzer/doorbell or summat would be handy. We sort of wandered around and eventually found it, and no-one else in the building seemed to know who they were to direct us, but it's a minor point that hopefully they can sort out. To be fair, it does say in the confirmation to email them prior if calling might be a problem, but I was too busy holidaying to read it in full. :0)All in all, a little out the way, but a fun couple of hours which I think even my skeptical girlfriend enjoyed more than she thought she would.Go Team Black!! :0D
Great fun. We sucked pretty bad at the game, but had a great time doing it. Just the right amount of challenging with plenty of hints when we inevitably got stuck - thanks Marta!

Really nice experience. Marta was a great help in getting us through the riddles! She helps out when you are stuck and made the experience very worthwhile. The only negative point was that the room was very simply decorated and actually looked like a spare office room transformed into an escape room. There was a lack of story and immersion, but nevertheless I enjoyed the experiences a lot.

Great escape game!. We've played a number of escape games and Room of Riddles (The Bird Cage room) is now one of our favourites. Great balance of challenging but achievable with a clue here and there from the Games Master (Fatima who was lovely!). A number of unique features and twists that we haven't seen elsewhere make this great for newcomers or experienced Escape Gamers alike. Would definitely return to try the other room!

A great game. We won Our riddle master was Fatima the sweetest girl gave us the instructions and was really considerate and helpful Provided us with riddles when we needed help Because it was our first time she recommended the travel bag room I played this game in sevral phone appsBut the reality is so much more fun
Great!. We had a really fun experiense (in the bird cage)! I liked the NES a lot hehe... Marta was a big help for us and fun to speak with!

Thrilling and Challenging!. Incredible, incredible, incredible! Staff was super friendly and the room was fabulous with so much to do! Thanks Marta, our Riddle Master, for a superb time. We did the Travelers Room and hoping to do the Birdcage Room next. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. It's a must do!
Fun!. Really enjoyed the Birdcage. My husband and I found it challenging and intriguing. We were able to escape which was a great achievement. Our game host Marta was amazing and helpful.

More then challenging. Room of riddles is really a perfect way to spend the day with friends or colleagues. Its more then challenging to get from hint to hint working your way out. Also the lovely Fatima is more then a good host with her energetic way of bringing the game! Recommendation for everybody to do!

One of the highlights of our trip. We escaped the bird cage, which was challenging yet feasible enough not to be frustrating. The experience, from the moment of the reservation the experience was simply great.When we got to the building we were lucky enough to meet Fatima, who was absolutely amazing!! Nice, helpful and sweet, and - as we told her - it would not have been the same without her!Highly recommended!

Terrific hosts, difficulty level of room sufficient. A few weeks ago I was locked up in the Bird Cage and managed to escape with some time to spare. Overall had a great experience, no complaints. Hosts were very accommodating (we were welcomed by the couple who co-founded Room of Riddles) and did a good job dropping hints (in the form of more riddles ;) ) whenever we got stuck. I felt the room itself was nicely set-up in its range of props and the difficulty of the puzzles/riddles were sufficient--I would say the Bird Cage has the ideal difficulty level for those who are new to the escape room scene.
Great evening. Fantastic time with the escape game, and the host was terrific.Puzzles were challenging but some timely clues helped a lot!

Great experience for all the family. We had a great time in the Room of Riddles - definitely helps to have kids who are naturally logical! As it was our first puzzle room we went for the Travellers room and managed to complete it while having a great time. Fatima was a great puzzle master and would fully recommend this as part of your visit to Amsterdam.
''comfort''. #Room of Riddles Amsterdam is next to rooms of Paradise believe me after gettting comfort in all means #Room of Paradise...

Great morning out. Wasn't sure what to expect, but went along at friends suggestion! We had so much fun solving all the riddles, sadly we missed solving the last clue by only a couple of minutes, however the riddle master... Fatima was very helpful and encouraging. A great activity for all ages!

So Awesome!. The host was so great and the experience was so much fun. A great team building exercise or a great way for a family to work together and get to know each other better.We celebrated our escape for hours afterwards and won't soon forget the Room of Riddles.A big thanks to Fatima.Vincent Family.

Found Freedom !. We were caged like a bird and had to solve some fun riddles to find our freedom. Fun experience !
At the end we were offered a soft drink and a cool photo !

Rocking the Room of Riddles!. A family of 5 with three teenage children, as a family that loves games upon recommendation we decided to give Room of Riddles a try while on our European vacation. We did the Bird Cage with Marta as our "game master". She was great and we had a fantastic experience. Great team/family building experience. Everyone contributed and we really enjoyed it. Would recommend it to any group of friends and family looking for a challenge, with a willingness to work together while having a fun time and plenty of laughs!

Great for anyone who enjoys riddles!. My boyfriend and I have done both the Traveler's Suite and the Birdcage and we loved both. The Traveler's Suite requires some very basic geography knowledge (I really mean very basic, we're both terrible at geography but we managed) and the Birdcage requires some maths ability.It's a nice little touch that they give you an extra riddle to take away after you've completed the room.Overall the rooms are fantastic, just a little bit gutted that we didn't quite beat the record escape time for the Birdcage (9 seconds off)!

Caged like a Bird. This was a wonderful, brainy experience. Full of Riddles, plenty of locks and a soft drink to celebrate victory after getting out.- good customer care with emails, and recommendations- a photo afterwards- a certificate after you've gotten out of the room- some warm-up activities which spiked my interest from the beginningHighly recommended!
