Good escape room for a two people try : ). Good escaping game and nice staff. It is our first time playing the game and with some hints, we got out of bird cage!
So much fun!. This was a great experience for me and my family. It was really fun and challenging. The host was friendly and welcoming. I will definately go there again next time I come to Amsterdam.

The craziest attraction in Amsterdam. That's a must-do for people, who enjoy riddles, puzzles, detective games etc. Whole game is prepared in an excellent way and makes your brain steam all the time. If you want to experience something unusual on your trip to Amsterdam, that's definitely a place to drop by.

great adventure, challanging escape room. This is my first escape room- it was great and special.they have 2 different rooms threre - the couple that we met there tried many escape rooms before - they said it was a "different and surprising one".my 12 year old daughter enjoyed it as well.a bit far from Amsterdam central city - takes a bit time to arrive but worth the effort!

Amazing...want to do it all over again!. Me and my 3 travel buddies absolutely loved this, and cannot recommend it highly enough!Katie, our riddle master lady, was amazing...very welcoming, and made sure we understood exactly what we were doing. she was also good at pointing is the right direction when we got stuck!If you are looking for something fun and a little bit different, this is definitely for you! we love it so much, that we have looked for similar activities to do here in the UK! :)

Very fun...learned a lot about the people I was with. My headline kind of says it all. But to point out some highlights....due to my own miscalculations we were running several minutes late to the appointment time but with a phone call they were very amendable to holding our slot letting us participate. I think my most memorable moment was realizing how horrible I am at stuff like this and how surprisingly good some of the people I was with were at it. Great experience and well worth the very reasonable fee.

So much fun!. What a great way to end our visit to Amsterdam! I booked our reservation a few months in advance, and the communication from the staff from them til our visit was top notch. Their directions were perfect (it's right off the tram stop a good distance from the city center where we were staying) and since I wasn't using my phone because of the international cost, they said they could come down and get us as long as we were there 15 minutes ahead of time.When we arrived, Violet came down and got us and took us upstairs. She went over all the rules and then literally walked us into the Travelers Room... and left. Gulp. It was so fun trying to figure out everything and especially working as a team with my fiance. We made it out with maybe 30 seconds to spare - phew!

Lovely Experience, Expert Staff.. This was our first escape room and we came in not knowing what to expect.We were very pleasantly surprised by the experience and had an absolute blast solving the riddles to escape the room.The location was quite good as we took the train out from Amsterdam Sloterdijk to Heemstedestraat (It is right next to the station). Once we had finished we took the number 2 tram into Amsterdam Central which had many interesting attractions along the way.Our host was fantastic also, thank you Violet for being so welcoming and friendly.Overall I would definitely recommend this room.

Extremely Pleasant Visit!. It was our first escape room attempt and the staff was extremely nice and amiable from the moment we met her! She ensured that we were comfortable and understood the game (: overall the game was enjoyable and its definitely worth a visit!

Not the best room in Amsterdam. My husband and I visited Room of Riddles on a long weekend in Amsterdam, as well as The Escape Room Experience and TimeTrip (see my other reviews, TimeTrip was by far the best).Room of Riddles is fun, but is very different to other rooms I've done. We did the Birdcage room, in which there isn't a cohesive or consistent theme. It's nice when there's a 'point' to escape rooms, like you're escaping a prison or stealing blueprints or going on a medieval quest...Room of Riddles is literally JUST a room full of riddles, without a connecting theme.As another reviewer has mentioned, the Birdcage room is also full of 4-digit combination locks. This is extremely frustrating, as every single time you solve a riddle to get a 4-digit code, you have to try it in SEVERAL locks, which is incredibly time-wasting. There are also a couple of riddles that only one person can participate in. This was frustrating enough as a group of two, and I can imagine it really impeding and annoying a group of 3 or more.Finally, the location is a little out of the way as well. We spent around 25 minutes on the tram from Centraal station, and there's really not much going on around in the area that Room of Riddles is located. The game is in an office block, so you have to phone them up on your mobile and someone comes to collect you from the foyer. This can be tricky for overseas visitors!This review sounds quite critical, but I do think it's worth highlighting some of the key differences between this game and most others out there - if you're looking for a themed adventure style escape room, then Room of Riddles is not for you. The Birdcage does have one cool physical aspect, but is overwhelmingly based on mental and logic puzzles - not so much on teamwork or physical games. We did have a good time, and did get out within the hour time limit!

Great experience, fabulous riddle master. Great game !! We have done this with six people, we did not know what to expect so it was even more fun and exciting. All the riddles and puzzles were well put together. Great riddle master, the fabulous Fatima! definitely a must do.

Superduper!. The enthusiastic introduction and debriefing was very clear and helpful. The attempt to escape was super fun! Despite one clue that appeared to be lacking in the room (we found out only afterwards), we were able to play the game and escape in time. Much recommended and a little cheaper than the other escape rooms in Amsterdam!

Do it. This place is brilliant, if you've got an hour spare and a group of friends down for riddlin' definitely check this place out. Fatima, our riddle master, was a great host and they even managed to rejiggle their bookings to ensure our group of 8 could play at the same time. We had no idea what to expect before we went but we all left pleasantly surprised. Bare in mind that it is based quite a way out from Central Amsterdam so its not a comfortable walking distance. If you have bikes though you'll get there in no time.

Amazing. Just want to say a big thank you to our riddle master Fatima.I was recommended this by a friend, I came here with a group of friends not really knowing what to expect but we all loved it & would recommend to anyone who is going to Amsterdam to do it as its really fun & a good group bonding excercise. I'm not looking into where there are other rooms of riddles as I had so much fun. We escaped the room with 7 minutes & 17 seconds to go woooow :) then to top it off I had a little cake with a candle in for my birthday :)

Amazing!. Would defiantly recommend, it's a must do in Amsterdam! The first time we've done a Riddle Room, it lasts an hour and is so much fun when you're in there with some clues along the way to help! The host was lovely and spent time talking to us before and after, as well as recommending some places to eat at and to go to. It's not difficult to get to in terms of metro but you have to look for a tall building that looks like offices and it's in there. Il be doing one again, a great experience. Well worth the money and much better than some of the non-value for money tourists attractions in Amsterdam.Thanks for a great time!

fun and joyful experience must do. We had never heard of these experience before. We love riddles , and fun games.We had an amazing time, Katie was a great host and are thinking of doing second room on the last,day. It is a little out of city center, but the #2 tram take10-15 minutes and you are there

Great experience. This was the first time that we had an escape room adventure. We were three of us and all liked the game a lot. As there were no available hours for the traveller's suite, we had to take the bird's cage. We could managed to get out. (thanks for the help at walkie talkie :)) The activity was completely extraordinary for us. Still talking about it :) I think you should give a try...

Very amusing!. That was our 1st experience in an escape room and I think room of riddles was the best place that we could have it. We were 2 people joining the game and though the riddles were challenging, they weren't frustrating hard. Especially for new starters. The game master was a very helpful and joyful girl who completed the nice picture of the game. All in all, it was an excellent experience and I'd recommend it.
Great fun. Had such good fun in Room of Riddles, put together very well and was run by a lovely young girl. Was offered drinks and snacks on our arrival and enjoyed out mini photo shoot afterwards.

My visit to Room of Riddles was absolutely awesome!! My team and I had so much fun!!. I highly recommend this attraction to everyone! It is a total different experience than the usual highlights of a city. Also to get to know the others in the team in a better and different way, it's really helpful. The Riddle Master was very welcoming and the attraction is very easy to reach.

Birthday Surprise!. Best birthday surprise ever!! It was an amazing experience and Katie (our host) was amazing!! I recommend this to anyone out looking for a fun adventure!! I had a blast working together with my hubby!

Disappointing, but still had a good time . 5 of us were keen on trying an escape room game in Amsterdam so I booked this one because another one we wanted to try was fully booked. I would say that first off, it's very strange to have to call to be let into the building - not too much of a problem but still rather odd. The location of the rooms is in an office building so I guess it can't be helped. Katie was great - friendly, accommodating and helpful. No complaints about her as riddle master! As for the escape room itself, it started off pretty well. We had the Traveller's Room. We got frustrated a couple of times in between as usual with escape rooms but with the hints' help we managed to get through in about 45 minutes. However, in hindsight we all realized that other escape rooms we had tried were so much more challenging and fun. Something about this room just felt too simplistic - some more complications or plot twists would have been nice. It was still enjoyable for us though! Good for a first time in an escape room, perhaps. Maybe the birdcage would have been better for veterans like us. Other minor points - The briefing room is nice. You get sweets, and after the game you get drinks as well. I like the fact that they prepare props for you to take pictures with after you complete the game. So the conclusion is that service is great but the room we tried could be better. If they change things up then it would be awesome!

There are much better rooms in Amsterdam!. Room of Riddles was one of the first escape rooms in Amsterdam, but out of the 4 or so rooms I tried in Netherlands, it was by far the least fun room. Pros:- Our host, Katie: she was incredibly nice & welcoming, and made us feel comfortable right away. She did say to us that experienced Escape Room players may find their rooms easy (we did the harder Bird Room).- Overall clean production, would have been better for us if we were not veterans of the genre- Can get to the room via public transit + a short 7 min walk- Puzzles are pretty straightforward and are mostly fairCons- Expensive: there are not alot of bells & whistles or fancy effects here. Just lots & lots of lockboxes. They are all 4 digit as well which means that even when you get a right combination you will have to try it several times!- Decor is pretty plain: lots of quick amazon items, no magnetic locks- Requires you call to get into the building, can be difficult for foreign visitors without cell accessOverall I think the room itself is probably average, but the cost puts it into the 'poor' category - this is highly ranked because it was one of the first room, but they really need to invest some time & money to up their game! Their strongest point is their excellent staff (they always seem to be mentioned in all their reviews)!

A great introduction. We'd never tried an escape room before and I wasn't sure how well we'd do, but it was great fun and we completed it in a pretty good time. Our guide was really friendly and laid back, making the whole thing a lot of fun.

Definitely give it a go! . I've been wanting to try an escape game for a while now so decided to book up while in Amsterdam for my boyfriends birthday. There were a few different options, Room of riddles was the cheapest and also was the only option for two players.Katie our riddle master was very friendly and the game itself was great. It was all very entertaining and a great experience over all. We chose 'The travellers room' but there is also 'the bird cage' which is the slightly harder version.Can't say much more as it would ruin it for others but definitely give it a go!

Really enjoyed our work team outing!. I booked this activity as a fun team bonding exercise for my colleagues and I, and it exceeding my expectations. We did the Birdcage game, 7 of us, and it took us almost the full hour to escape (2mins to spare). For us, it was complicated and challenging. Some parts were simple, others parts took more time, but with 7 brains, 7 pairs of hands and lots of different things to explore and wonder about, all over the room, it certainly was not easy! Group members might each feel they only made small contributions to the escape, but those small (seemingly random at the time) contributions, all get you out in the end, and it's a funny sense of achievement! We had fun, and I'd really recommend this game to other small teams that work together, or just a bunch of friends or family members. None of my group had done an escape game before, but I for one am excited to book the next one in Amsterdam as I was impressed with Room of Riddles, and it's quite addictive! Katie did a good job of welcoming and hosting us too, so thanks to her for the experience, along with everyone at Room of Riddles for cleverly conjuring up the whole thing!

So fun!. I met up with two amazing friends in Amsterdam for a week, and we were looking for things to do beyond your typical sight-seeing and museum stops. My best friend found this experienced and immediately booked it for us. We had absolutely no idea what to expect, and were a little nervous, but everything was SO fun! I'll admit, we were a little nervous that we had to call from outside to get let into the building, but from the moment our amazing host came to get us, everything was fine. You work in a team to solve riddles and earn your freedom - and we loved every minute! :) If you have some free time in Amsterdam, definitely check this out - it's so worth it!

Great fun!. Really great fun! We played as a team of two in the more complicated room and really enjoyed the whole experience. We have played in escape rooms before but this one was much more about completing riddles (as the name indicates :) ) than the others we had played, which was great! The staff were great too and helped give us some recommendations of other places to see whilst in Amsterdam.

Room of Riddles was exciting, entertaining, exhasusting and seriously a friendship breaker! (In the good way!). We wen't three guys to try our skills against the travelers suit in Room of Riddles, i can't say to much because it will ruin the awesome experiance that stunned us!You'll be forced to work together, or atleast forced to constrain your lust to strangle your teammates when the time comes! All in all a seriously great experiance fun game to play with your family, friends, lover etc.!

So much fun!. We were a group of four: two moms and two daughters, 12 and 14 years old. We booked one of the rooms for one hour. It's in an ordinary office building, which we at first thought was a little strange - but it really doesn't matter. We were met by a host who spoke excellent English. She told us how to play the game, without telling too much. And then we were locked in the room...... I will not say any more, but one hour went by so incredibly fast and it was such a lot of fun!! The girls were really eager and solved many of the riddles. We were also a little stuck at times, but got some clues along the way. I think it is safe to say it was the highlight of our weekend in Amsterdam!!!

Very good fun!. I have done an 'escape the room' style game before, however this one was of a much higher standard, both in the room itself and in the riddles too. Not stupidly vague, but still got myself and my two friends really scratching our heads at times. A little pricey, but it is a very high quality game and the girl that served us was very friendly (particularly enjoyed the free can of soda at the end, was a nice touch!)

The most fun I've had in ages!. Wasn't really sure what to expect but it was great fun! Can't tell you much as don't want to give it away........... But! We giggled, stressed, got infuriated and then finally whooped with joy all in 51 minutes! Will definitely be returning to attempt the other room.

THE BIRD CAGE. A must do if in Amsterdam! Booked as a group of 7, we took two taxis to the Rooms of Riddle which cost around 40 euros a taxi but we took the tram (No2) back to central station which cost around 3 euros each so a big difference.The Room itself was great fun and Fatima the girl running our day was fantastic. We as a group would do it again and we would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a challenge and a laugh.

Awesome. We booked this for some fun whilst in Amsterdam...it was awesome!!! So cleverly thought out and I can't wait to do this again. An absolute must if you visit Amsterdam. Our host was so welcoming and friendly. I cannot recommend this enough!!

Escape the bird cage.. Hello, eh hello. Can someone get me out. Just as well I was with a group that could think logically and we got out with 3, yes 3 seconds to spare. Great fun and the little bit that I added (believe me it was little) gives you a great sense of achievement. The young girl who was the host was very pleasant and the whole thing was just good fun. It is tough going but you don't have to dig tunnels or send up a rescue flare. Would do it again and I still probably wouldn't solve it without some genius to help me.

A Right Riveting Review for the Room of Riddles!. I've always wanted to try an Escape Room and the Room of Riddles certainly lived up to its excellent reviews and reputation! I booked this mini Dutch adventure for my wonderful wife Tracey who is the brains of our outfit! She certainly didn't disappoint me and although we never made it out of the room within the hour, we did unlock the door in 64 mins & 45 secs. What a really difficult time we had working out all the different clues, the red herrings and also working together to achieve the objective! Apparently we had the very difficult room too! Kate was an excellent host and was very warm and gregarious. Whoever's employing this young lady you've got a great employee! Many thanks for a really different and positive experience! It's a AAA+ from Mr & Mrs H ❤️
Very good . Amazing without spoiling anything we tried the bird cage which is the more advanced of the 2 certainly tests your logical thinking our hosts were amazing will be coming back 👍👍

very clever puzzles. this was my 3rd escape game and I highly reccommend this if you have a bunch of friends visiting Amsterdam. It not only kept us out of the pub for a while ,. It had us talking and laughing about it for the whole weekend. Great game .

Very fun and different/unique experience!. As my last review was, this is much overdue. Finally trying to get good about reviewing though. We visited Amsterdam last September and while searching things to do, ran across this here on TripAdvisor. After seeing everyone's fun times had we decided to give it a shot. I think we got very lucky getting a booking for the short trip there, so would recommend getting a jump on it if you want to try it. They reserve a spot just for your group so it's not one of those things you can drop in on. Totally worth it though. In a nutshell, it's much like the name indicates, you complete series of riddles/puzzles to get out of the room. A riddle master can communicate with you via walkie talkie, but only if you are really stuck, so you do feel on your own trying to escape. We had a fantastic time, was fun to see the things each of us were better at than the other too. Wasjust me and my boyfriend this time but I could see this being a really fun group activity or team building type of thing too. If you like puzzles or solving things this is definitely something you should try. I'd never done one of the escape rooms before but will keep my eyes out on next trips for sure. Our riddle master was great too and I wish I could recall her name, but she made sure not to give you too much of a hint so you really felt you were getting through it all yourself. This particular company is run by a husband/wife team, both of which were there and eager to know what we thought and how to make things even more fun. Always nice to have that personal touch. Not far outside the city center and really a neat time to get away from the usual touristy stuff.

Great fun, great staff.. I've played a few of these escape type games, and they have all impressed me. I've always had fun, no matter the result of our game.What stood out more with Room of Riddles was the staff and customer service. Post-game drinks, pre-game run down, and overall nice people working at this establishment allowed us to feel more comfortable, and to have more fun. I'm also happy to say that we were able to clear the room.Enjoy it if you plan on going. If you have decided against going, then you should rethink that decision.
Fun. This was a fun thing to do. We enjoyed the puzzles, it was a bit on the easy side though, and we would have loved to have seen a bit more variety.

Excellent Escape Room and great host. As total rookies to the hip and happening concept of escape rooms we visited the Room of Riddles in Amsterdam in March 2015. We were a bit on the late side but fortunately this was not problem. Our Riddle Master Katie was a great host. She clearly explained the rules of the game and also provided us with just the right amount of valuable hints during gameplay at times we seemed to get stuck. Eventually we managed to crack the safe (in which our key to escape was hidden) in 54 minutes, which is under the time limit of an hour.We were with 6 persons and everybody felt as if they contributed to the final outcome, so I guess this particular room (named Bird Cage) suits fairly large groups. Although the activity is quite on the expensive side we had a great time! After the game we asked Katie for a comfy restaurant and she recommended us Drovers Dog, which turned out to be a good burger place at just a few minutes walking distance from the Room of Riddles.If you're willing to put down approx. EUR 20,- pp, this is a great attraction to practise your detective skills and have a great time while doing so!

Refreshingly different.. As previous reviews have stated, this is an amazing experience and one that is a must for anyone looking for something that bit different.Two of us attempted the birdcage which challenged us throughout the 60 minute session.Don't be alarmed by the office type appearance on the outside, for me it just made the whole experience even more surreal and bizarre.Highly recommend this one.

What are you waiting for?!. What an amazing experience!! We weren't exactly sure what to expect when we booked our visit to the Room of Riddles, but our experience exceeded any of our expectations. We were warmly greeted by our Riddle Master, Fatima, who explained the game to us then locked us away in The Birdcage! The room itself is filled with fantastic puzzles that you must solve in order to unlock the safe that contains the key for the door. It was stressful watching the time tick down on the television, but we were given a walkie-talkie to radio Fatima if we were in dire need of a clue. Overall, I'd say the Room of Riddles was a highlight of our trip in Amsterdam. Don't miss out, you won't be disappointed!
Amazing. I played the Room of Riddles with my friends and out Riddle Master fatima was an awesome host! She made the whole game a great experience.

Wow!. What a amazing experience! We did the travellers-room and were surprised! It's so much fun! More than we thought it would be! The riddles are well thought, and we managed to escape within the hour (with a little help of the lovely ladies workin for Room of Riddles). Don't hesitate! You won't regret! Greetz!

Fantastic . We did the birdcage room this morning. Challenging for sure and a lot of fun.Fatima was incredibly nice and helpful, and made us feel really welcome.We got out with 5 minutes to spare ! It's not impossible but it is a tough enough challenge to stretch you. We really enjoyed it.Thanks Fatima !Cliff, Sylvia, Lizzy and Darius.

Fun times for the family. My family of 5 did the Birdcage and absolutely loved it. We went on a cold wet night and were not in the greatest mood when we arrived. Katie quickly brought us out of our funk and set us up for the game. What a memorable hour. My kids (9, 12, and 15) loved it and were great at it. The adults enjoyed it too. We all recommend Room of Riddles Amsterdam. It really was one of the best things we did in our 4 days in the city. My only small complaint is that it was a bit hard finding it. It is in a room in an office building and this wasn't clear to us when we were looking for it. A simple sign at the door would fix this and i am sure will be done soon.

Amazing experience!. My friend and I wanted to do something different and decided to book Room of Riddles. It's a MUST do in Amsterdam. Violet, our host was absolutely amazing and helpful. We didn't know what to expect but it exceeded our expectations. The room was well set up and it was a great fun. After we gad escaped we were offered a cold drink and sat down for another 20 mins talking to Violet who gave us a few tips on what to see in Amsterdam. Thank you for a great experience. Loved it.

Definitely do this when you visit Amsterdam!. I booked to go to Room of Riddles for my boyfriends birthday as I wanted to do something a little bit different! And it was fantastic! Violet, our host was lovely and helped us to find the building as we a got a little lost! The room we had was really fun too (can't reveal too much!) and we met a lovely Scottish couple who had booked a different room. Overall the whole experience was awesome and we definitely want to do this again! Highly recommend!

Awesome!. This was so fun! Having never played an escape game before, I didn't know what to expect. This. Was. Awesome! So well set up and just enough time to put the pressure on without it being too hard. I wanted to do another one straight away! Fatima, our riddle master, was fun and energetic and gave us lots of cool tips for the rest of our time in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend this to anyone who comes to Amsterdam.
Fantastic. Fantastic set up and really enjoyable visit to room of riddles. The team at ROR were great too! Would recommend to anyone.

Must try! . you should definitely visit room of riddles. Everything was well balanced and it was good fun. Our host was awesome, she helped us when we were stuck a few times. You need to pre book your appointment online so dont just go there.

Challenging but fun!. My partner, my mom and I decided to do the room of riddles birdcage escape room for my partners 22nd birthday. The lady who briefed us was so nice and really entertaining. The room was extremely challenging but really fun. I'd definitely recommend it and I will be doing the other room in the future.
The best hour in Amsterdam!. We had a blast on this experience! It was realy funny, and the time flyed by!! Felt like 10 min. We are going back!!

Loved it.. My girlfriend and I took a trip to visit the Room in Jan. Cold, wet and slightly lost we stumbled upon the office block which houses the room.Once inside, Fatima, our host was a joy to be with. Kind, and open - Thanks F.The room holds many secrets and it was a tense 1hr, but we got out with 15 mins to spare! Loved it.Only complaint - you have to ring up and as someone from UK, cost me £££ to use my phone - and the directions to the building, in the dark, weren’t the best. Still the actual attraction, amazing fun and would recommend it to all!
Brilliant!. Me and my partner loved it! We did the bird room and be sure to do the new room on our next visit! The riddle master Fatima was great also 👍 xxx

A great, unique expereince. My girl friends and I took two night trip to Amsterdam. After going through Pinterest for fun stuff to do we found a pin that lead us to the Room of Riddles. We had a great time, we were a little nervous at first (being locked in a room in the middle of nowhere??) but it ended up being so so fun. We solved the travelers room with 11 minutes to spare. The Riddle Master was very happy and answered all of our questions and even showed us a glimpse of the Bird Cage room which made us want to come back to do that room. It had a ball pit!! So we came back the next day for the second room and did that with four seconds to spare! Haha. Would defiantly recommend this trip to everyone!
Lots of fun.. I really enjoyed this much more then I thought I would. I am not particularly good at riddles but this was a great family activity.

Very Exciting!. I took my family 2 daughters(9 and 13) and husband. We thoroughly enjoyed the game! We had so much fun! Definitely a thrill!!! Totally recommend it!! There was a couple who was there at the same time and they had a more difficult game! Their room was called the Bird Cage!

Completely unexpected fun!. I attended with 2 of my best friends as something alternative to do in Amsterdam and we had so much fun, completely unexpected and the riddle master Fatima was just fab and so friendly. Can't wait to go back and do the birdcage room next!

Highlight of our trip . We went to room of riddles as a team of six girls. A little difficult to find the place as it was night time. We were welcomed by Katie who was brilliant. We had an absolutely amazing time, definite highlight of our trip.Would definitely recommend!!

A wonderful experience for a curious and ambitious team.. Excellent experience. we were with a team of colleagues from Dell how we're challenged to the fullest. A trully unique chance to test your teamwork and logic. The organizers were really friendly and eager to help while at the same time really professional as well.

Intensely fun night in Amsterdam. We had an amazing experience at Room of Riddles, I don't want to give away anything because that is all part of the fun and anticipation of the experience. We were in a group of 2 and experienced the Traveler room, we enjoyed it so much that we wanted to do the Birdcage while we were still in Amsterdam, but we missed out because it was fully booked. Katie is a great host - she made the night a lot of fun. We made it out in 43:28 minutes and scored 2nd top time for the day. You wont regret this experience.

Exceeded my expectations!. Me and my fiancé visited Room of Riddles for our anniversary after seeing about it on Facebook. The mystery surrounding it really contributes to the experience and although I understood the concept I didn't fully know what to expect. The experience fully exceeded my expectations and would love to try the birdcage room another time (although it may prove too difficult for us!) I would 100% recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam and think it is worth every euro! Finally a massive thank you to our lovely host Fatima who added brilliantly to the experience!

Definitely worth it. I've been there with three friends on 27th January 2015 and we challenged The Birdcage. It was definitely a fun experience and totally worth it. I won't reveal any detail about anything, becuse "mistery" is part of the thing, so I will just give some "information".The email they send you after your booking contains all the informations you need to get to the place: basically, you need to take the tram number 2 and wait for the stop (I don't remember which one but it's in the email). The building is around 50 meters backwards comparing to the bus stop. It's an offices building with green-ish glasses on the left side of the road (on the other side there's a canal, so).The girl who picked us up and explained the game was very very kind, and after the game she dedicated us a lot of time to give us some advices about places to see and things to do in Amsterdam.We managed to escape in around 44 minutes and I liked it at the point I would do it again to see what's in the other room.

Great Fun. Our family of 3 had a Funtime during the 60 minute countdown trying to solve the clues and find the key to escape . Great time . Will definitely recommend if u like puzzles/riddles etc. Thank you to Katie our host.

Great Fun. Really enjoyed our time at the Room of Riddles. 6 lads in our group, each of us were involved in cracking the safe. It is a great bonding experience for people that don't know each other well also. 10/10 would try escape again!
Awesome puzzles. This was my first time doing an escaperoom and it was amazing! I'm totally addicted and would highly recommend trying this out.

A must do!. We travelled to Amsterdam in a group of 12 for my husbands birthday. I found Room of Riddles via Trip Advisor and thought I would book it up as something different to do. Really glad I did, everyone loved it.
Fatima was lovely and made it a really fun experience.
Definitely recommend to everyone.

Coolest spot in Amsterdam!!!! . Too much fun. If you are with friends or family, this will either make or break your relationships! Haha. This is a place that requires teamwork to get out the room! The concept is so well put together; Violet and her team (or maybe it was just her) are super genius for creating this. If you are in Amsterdam, YOU HAVE TO GO!!!! Best fun!My team and I finished the room with 40 seconds left on the clock. still got out though! HahaFrom The New York dudes
Fantastic!. Me and my brothers had so much fun solving our way out the room. I recommend this place to anyone who visits Amsterdam.

A very interesting experience.. This experience has been very interesting and out of the ordinary to do while being a tourist in a country, it was extremely fun and unique. The rooms were hard to solve but very fun and brain stimulating..its great for a group activity,to test out different aspects of your personality. The room is very easy to get to, and we were greeted by a very frendly worker,which helped us with hints when clues got hard. She even helped us with tips and recommendations after the game of things to do in Amsterdam.all in all, it is definitely a thing to try out and you wont regret.

great fun!. Had so much fun visiting the new room of riddles room in Amsterdam last weekend. Really something different and unexpected, although we enjoyed this as a couple, I imagine it will be even more fun as a big group. Really friendly staff members and our riddle master Katie made the whole thing even more enjoyable. Once you've done it you'll want to try more!

Great for team building or just for fun. We did this as a team building activity and had a blast. Would definitely recommend this to anyone though as something to do just for fun. Hoping to go back soon to do it again, although I'm not sure if they change the rooms around or if its the same puzzles again. Either way, I'll likely go back to do the other room.
Good fun!. Went in a group of 3 and went for the Bird Cage room. Good fun! Fatima was a great host, a lot of energy and kept us entertained. We found it difficult but when required clues will come!

Good fun. This is easy to get to by tram. It's a good fun way to spend an hour or so. Without giving anything a way, you have to work out how to find the key to release yourself from a locked room in a finite amount of time.Great idea for a group. We did it as a pair and it was quite hard to get to the end on time, but great fun. Would do this again as they have more than one room to escape from......

Brilliant experience. The room of riddles was great fun, there was a group of 12 of us looked after by Fatima, who was friendly, professional and welcoming. I would definitely do this again! Great ideas and challenges, I wish them every success!

Good, intelligent fun for an hour!. My wife, 15-year old son and myself arrived on the No. 2 Tram from Centraal Station yesterday afternoon (Sunday) for a game and was met by Fatima, our Riddle Master. We were the only participants in the room and after the briefing, were locked in to solve the riddles.We managed to get out with not many minutes to spare before the hour was up and were assisted by a combination of on-screen clues and 'suggestions' remotely from Fatima at key stages in the process.It would have been great to work with 2-3 other people in the room but was nevertheless an enjoyable family activity on a rainy afternoon! Thank you Fatima for your excellent & cheerful hospitality.

Excellent experience. We went as a group of 4 and had the best time. A unique experience. If you want something to do other than sightseeing its a must. It was nice to be greeted with a lovely friendly face...our Riddle Master was Fatima and she was great. We were all a little apprehensive as we did not know what to expect, but we had such fun and after we had finished found it even funnier talking about our experience...I wish I had been a fly on the wall watching us all in the Room of Riddles! They were about to open a third Riddle Room a few days after we had been there, all I can say is I can't wait to try that. Thanks for an unexpected funny afternoon.

One of the coolest experiences ever!. Room of Riddles is fantastic. The difficulty level is hard, but not impossible. It gives a great sense of accomplishment to succeed in the Room of Riddles. I will definitely visit other rooms in the future. Our host, Katie, was really sweet and nice. Thumbs up!!

Excellent experience in all senses!. For those who enjoy puzzles, riddles, and a great time with friends or love ones this experience is a must. They treated us with excellence and even gave us a tiny cupcake at the end as we were celebrating a birthday. The game was fun and perfectly well organize, we can wait to go back again!

Something different. Went as a group of 5 and it was something different that we all enjoyed. Got a taxi there as it is not in the city centre. Girl runs this was brilliant and made the experience enjoyable.

A unique experience. Room of Riddles is great fun. The host, Fatima, is extremely welcoming and helpful (at times) throughout the game, and the brain-teasing puzzles are sure to get your heart racing. While I've played escape games on my phone before, this took things to a whole new level. Safe to say I've got the bug.

Great Adventure. Me and my friend were looking for a good time in Amsterdam but by doing something we had never did before! The room of riddles was a great adventure mainly cause we had no idea what to expect! If you get the time, go for it, definitely worth it. Liesbeth is great, and she made this an even greater memory for me and my friend! Thanks :)

So much fun and worth the price!!. We booked in advance as we arrived in Amsterdam on Christmas Eve and knew that most attractions would be closed on the Christmas day. The number 2 tram stops right at the Room of Riddles. We were greeted by Katie our Riddle Master who was very nice. We've never played an escape game before and it was amazing!!! We had such a good time!! Great attraction and worth the price. Thank you Katie and Room of Riddles Amsterdam for this exprience

Great!. It was our first experience in this kind of games, i think maybe a bit more explanation would be great, and it's the only reason i don't give it 5 stars! after leaving the room i just wanted to try again new rooms!a must go!!

So much fun. Don't be put off by the fact it's out of town and more than a bit tricky to find just make sure you've got googlemaps. Definitely worth it. My boyfriend and I went on new years day and loved it. They've got a new room to escape opening soon so will no doubt go back.
Extraordinary Experience. Thanks to the guys at room of riddles for this amazing and unique experience.. Definitely one of the best things to do in Amsterdam.. Really worth trying... Well done 😃😃👍👍

Great fun - Money well spent!. Bought as a present for my boyfriend as we were visiting Amsterdam over New Years. Had done something similar before, and this was just as great if not better! Fatima the host was so friendly and really made the whole experience enjoyable. We are already thinking of a second holiday to Amsterdam just so we can try out the new room when it opens.. Note - when you get off the tram, the building is behind the bridge, with Tento sign

WOW - what an experienxe. We booked this experience due to the reviews on here.We booked this for our last evening in Amsterdam and what a great way to end our trip.We were booked in for 9pm, so when we arrived it was dark outside. The cab pulled up and I was very dubious about it - the experience is situated at the end of a road made up of flats and is in an office block. We called the number and were met by a lovely guy who took us upstairs and explained the way the experience works. It was his first day working there so he was very nervous, but was also very professional.We went into the room and started our task of trying to get out. I won't go into any detail, but the whole experience was very well thought out and very tough. It was just my husband and I in the room and we managed to get the key to exit the room with 13 mins and 21 seconds left on the clock. We cannot wait to return to try out the second room which was being made up when we went there.Well done room of riddles - amazing idea and a very fun experience :)

Racing heart and hard working brain! . We booked this to waste an hour or so. Wow, it was awesome! We were locked in a room and told to find and the key to escape! Sounds simple, well the quickest hour of my life had my wife and I working together (sometimes not) to get clues which lead to the conclusion. We managed it but only just. We left with a smile on our faces and are looking for other similar activities. The young lady who was our host/guide was charming and gave us the odd hint. I would recommend this to anyone, couples, work colleagues, mates or families. A fun time that will have you talking about what you did for ages afterwards. Thank you

i06 on a calculator. A unique experience, letting you escape to a world of childhood and adventure. We loved the challenge of trying to solve the puzzles, which themselves are puzzles to be found. There are no rules. There are no clues. You have the freedom to try anything and everything. One clue leads to another. And luckily we made it out alive, with 11 minutes to spare...

Awesome!. Went to Room of Riddles today, 1 Jan 15. It was simply outstanding! Fatima was our riddle master, and she made the whole experience interesting and great fun from start to finish.We were with our two teenage boys and we all had such a great time, and we escaped in just under 50 mins!A must do!!!

Great fun!. We were very well looked after by our host Katie. She also helped us out whenever we got stuck for a clue (which was quite often). This a really fun thing to do with a girlfriend/boyfriend. One thing I would say is that its a shame you have to ring from outside to be let in as I had to turn on my mobile data on so that phone call probably cost me a little bit. Katie also recommended us some great places to eat for our weekend as well (we went to the Italian and the Thai place and they were both amazing).If you are looking for something a little different to do with an evening in Amsterdam, I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to Room of Riddles.

Fun event for the family. Room of Riddles is what it says...You enter a room and need to use the clues to open a safe and get the key to let you out. You get 60 minutes.We were a family of four and we thought it would be a fun binding activity while on vacation in Amsterdam. Located outside the city center in an office building was not what I expected, but that did not detract from a fun time.The game was based on travel. The Riddle host watches you on TV in their office and does help with clues (I think too many). They want you to get out.It is a wonderful concept; one that can work for many group functions from corporate team building to just good fun with friends or family.

Great Family Fun!. Our family, with 2 children 11 and 13 years, visited the Room of Riddles last week. The reviews of this event compelled us to choose Amsterdam for a vacation as our son loves riddles and puzzles. Indeed, this was a fantastic experience for all four of us. This was the highlight of the kids' trip to Amsterdam. It was a really fun family experience for all of us.

Very fun. This was a very fun family thing to do. A welcome break from visiting museums and being a typical tourist. This is anything but typical. They lock you in a room with a bunch of clues, and you have one hour to discover the way out. It's called an escape game. If you've ever played computer games like Myst you know what it's like, but you don't have to be a computer game player to enjoy. The woman who ran our session was especially nice, even though she may have been a bit less forthcoming with her clues than I wanted her to be. Fun for everyone.
Great fun, great host!. Riddle master Fatima met our every need. So welcoming - the best host! A hidden gem. The new puzzle room looks fab. Thank you from Team Glasgow!
Jolly good fun.. What a great concept. Want something different to do in Amsterdam this is it. Friendly welcome and fun game. Definitely worth a visit.

Great experience, great guide. We've been there last week and we had a superb time there. Especially Fatima, our guide, was very nice and we talked a lot afterwards. She was funny and gave us some tipps for Amsterdam. The game itself is super exciting and is based on the typical escape games you can play on smartphones. But way better! We can totally recommend to go there and have some good time, too. And for those who have already been there: There is a new room coming soon, so keep it in mind if you're going to Amsterdam next time.

Exciting and fun! Fantastic!!!!. We wanted to experience something fun and different, that is exactly what you get from Room of Riddles! An amazing experience which is very fun and charming! Fatima was lovely and explained the game wonderfully - it is easy to grasp and you'll have loads of laughs!!! Place was fairly easy to find, just remember to take their contact with you :)

Brilliant Fun. I have never done anything like this before but this was great fun and host and riddle master Fatima was lovely and looked after us well. I highly recommend this but maybe not our strategy of a bull at a gate! :-)
Merseybeats. Excellent experience. Visited December and Fatima was a lovely host. Met up with some American genius who solved a riddle in two minutes which took the owner two weeks.....

Fun, fun, fun!. This is a really different 1 hour experience trying to get you and your team out of a locked room by solving the game through answering riddles and getting the code to unlock the safe that contains the key to the door.

Loads of fun!! . My boyfriend and I had been waiting for this for quite a while, and it didn't disappoint! I had seen online that it gets booked up in advance - so make sure you book in early. We went on 21/12 and I had to book back in the beginning of November to ensure our booking for when we wanted. Make sure you have a mobile phone as you need to make a call to get in to the building when you arrive. The no.2 tram stops right outside the building, so it's pretty easy to get to! I wont give too much away, other than to say how worthwhile it was! it was our first escape room experience and we managed to solve all the riddles and get out! Fatima was our riddle master and she was fantastic, lots of fun and really hospitable! It was nice to have a drink and go through the game plan at the end. I'd really recommend this to anyone, it was so much fun and one of the highlights of our visit to Amsterdam!

Great fun on Xmas day. My fiancée and I had a great time in the Room of Riddles. The whole experience from arrival, to doing the activity, to reliving it over lemonade and lollies afterwards was really fun. Fatima, our Riddle Master, was friendly, helpful and really made the activity a whole lot of fun. They're in the process of developing a new room with new riddles, we would definitely go back to give it a go.

Room of Riddles a truly unique experience. Didn't know what to exactly expect before we went, but we were happily surprised. Excellent to do with a couple of friends or family members. The riddles are challenging, but only require general knowledge and adequate English skills. The people in charge were very helpful and friendly, everything was well organised. Solving the riddles was an exhilarating and gratifying experience. Especially trying to solve the room within the allotted time is very exciting and a continuous race against the clock. We warmly recommend trying it yourself!

So much fun!!!. My husband and I did this on 25.12.2014 Katie our riddle master was very nice and gave us a super warm welcome. Great experience something different and fun! We escaped with 2 min remaining!! Thank you room of riddles and Katie for this great experience.

So much fun!!. My husband and I decided to try this on our recent vacation in Amsterdam. We booked a week prior and the only availability was on a Saturday at 9am so we ate breakfast and trekked out there early. Fatima answered my phone call right away and came downstairs to greet us and bring us inside. She was so cheerful and helpful at explaining how everything would work. My husband and I were playing against a British couple and we were thrilled that we got out of the room first! Both my husband and I have played quite a few video games, and I have played escape games online and this was very similar. So much fun, I highly recommend this!
A must!. Never done anything of the sort before, really interesting and would totally do it again. A test of teamwork and thinking. Special mention to Violet who took care of us throughout! :)

Great fun! . We had no idea what to expect but we keenly booked with intrigue & Room of Riddles definitely did not disappoint! Would recommend to anyone looking for something fun & different to do. I would like to try other escape games now!!

You need to think outside the box. Although on the outskirts of the city a simple tram ride got us there in 20 minutes. On arrival we were met by the lovely Fatima who gave us a welcome coffee with an in depth brief. Easy we thought be out of here in no time. Think again this was a challenge. Even with help from Fatima. We eventually escaped but only after time ran out. If visiting Amsterdam this is a must.

Never done anything like it before. Amazing!. Such a great experience. We were looked after by Katie who was brilliant, she really understands customer service. The difficulty of the riddles was just right; not too easy, but they really made you think too. I can't fault Room of Riddles at all, it was definitely a highlight of my holiday to Amsterdam. Perfect for couples and groups of friends, Must do!

Great fun for groups or couple. We visited this place in November as a group of 4 lads. It's was difficult to find initially but once your there it's well worth it. I'm not going to give anything away but you will have to club together in order to escape.A very different concept that's worth the money.

Fantastic experience for Team Building. Fantastic experience for Team Building. Highly recommended. Very well locted in a very nice office area with all the necessary facilities. Also very easy reachable by public transport and very close to central station. Most fun wit small team up to 4 people.

Unique experience, a MUST DO. Gave this as a Bday present to my girlfriend. In the beginning u think, what have I got myself into?After u start looking for clues, it's really a lot of fun! My gf and I had a nice work together to get out of that room. Was our first escape experience, but definitely not our last!Also the host Katie was very kind a helpful during our adventure. A must do if your visiting Amsterdam!
great experience. Highly recommended. been there last month and enjoyd every minute.a little far from the center of but worth the ride...

A unique, mind tingling experience. Booked for a "something different" activity for spouses birthday. Great experience. A nice diversion from typical tourist activity (would also be great as a team building experience). Staff was friendly and informative too.Will definitely look to do it again here or in another city.

Room of Riddles - Amsterdam, well worth visiting. We booked Room of Riddles, Amsterdam almost two months in advance, it gets booked up very quickly! Didnt know what to expect but it exceeded expectations! Don't be fooled by first impressions! We had a brilliant time and got quite competative with the other team! It's amazing how much you get into it once you are in that room! Was talking about it for ages afterwards! I was even given a little cake with a candle as it was my birthday! Nice touch! A number 2 tram takes you from Centraal to room of riddles, you need to ring their telephone to enter the building. A little advice, one lock is a bit stiff so pull it hard and ask for advice!Would recommend and Fatima was a brilliant host.
Great fun!. A fun challenge for a group of friends of all ages - looking forward to the next room is ready for playing!

Great, interesting and just enough of a challenge.... Booked on the basis of reviews on here, fantastic and alternative attraction, easy to get to and enjoy. Logic is king, and it's interesting doing it as a group as everyone thinks they know best! Give it a try, something different to sex, drugs and Anne Frank's abode.

Really great experience . My boyfriend and I came to Amsterdam for a weekend away and as a surprise he took me here. Our helper Fatima was really lovely and very friendly (she gave us recommendations on places to visit during our stay). The game itself was really good fun, challenging and overall a great experience! Would definitely recommend to visitors and locals alike...

Fun! But also some critical notes.... We were in a team of 5, and as the girl who hosted us rightfully commented, we were perhaps with too many. However, we had a really good time, and it is definitely recommendable to anyone who likes escapes room and to anyone who doesn't know the concept to it yet! I only felt the entire environment (not only the fact we were in one of the most boring parts of Amsterdam) of this escape room was disappointing. The room itself lacked any atmosphere, but that's just what I like to see I guess. Sherlocked was in that sense much better (sorry). Still, four stars, very amusing!

Challenging. The Room of Riddles was such a fun thing to do, it's so exciting to do because you have no idea what clues you're looking for until you start finding random things. Would definitely recommend.

Excellent expderience. This is such an amazing game. As soon as we made it out of the room, I wanted to play again!!!! The lady there (Katie) explained everything so well and had a great sense of humor. Would definitely recommend and I would even go again myself.Amazing game of riddles :)

A new enterprise with bags of potential.. I booked a long weekend for my wife's 40th and it was our first time in Amsterdam. I saw Room of Riddles on trip advisor and as we both love this sort of thing I thought it would be a fun activity we could attempt together. Only a few slots left available so grabbed a 7pm slot. It was dark so the colour guidance to which building did not help nor did the wrong directions from a local man on a bike... when you come out of the metro it is immediately over to the left on the opposite side of the road, 1 min walk! We rang and soon got guided to the right place and we had a drink waiting for us on the table. We were early but Fatima was so welcoming we felt at ease immediately. We had never done this sort of thing before and were a little nervous. We were against another couple in the opposing room to add a little edge to the challenge. We were given snacks and told of the rules very clearly. Off we went and shut in the room. We soon got the gist of play and if we needed a ruling were able to ask for clarification via the walkie talkie. With 9 minutes to spare we let ourselves out and Fatima congratulated us with more drinks. We thoroughly enjoyed our time and had a sneak preview of the new room being constructed. We hadn't eaten so Fatima went out of her way to ring a restaurant to check availability and we were able to have a lovely meal after our puzzle fun. I recommended to our hotel that they should advertise Room of Riddles and would recommend anyone to have a go. More than happy to answer any questions. We plan to revist from the UK when the new rooms are up and running just to have another challenge and to support this great venture.

Great experience. *** I would have given it 5 stars but I am writing on behalf of me and a friend and their view is that nothing is perfect***We book the Room for early in the day, but due to a slow moving cruise and coach we would have missed our opportunity play during our short time in Amsterdam. Katie was absolutely wonderful, she along with her colleague organised for herself to stay later and allow us to play that day.As for the Room itself it was very fun, highly recommended for a first experience of an 'escape room'.The only pitfall for me was the price, but is worth doing.Do it!

Extremely good fun, friendly team, almost excellent.. My husband & I booked the room, weeks in advance as recommended by another reviewer. So glad we did, we are both puzzle lovers and were not disappointed. I would recommend anyone who likes some mind challenge and bits of daft fun to book your room. Special thanks to Nils (hope I have spelt that correct) and Violet, both extremely friendly and informative. The only reason I didn't give excellent is the drinks at the end are only soft drinks. A nice wine would've been nice but maybe there's a licensing issue.

Fantastic Fun. One of the best things we've done! Loved,loved,loved it. If you love riddles, solving mysteries and are competitive then this is for you. You have 60 mins to get the clues, find the code, open the safe for the key.......Friendly staff, great concept.

fun fun fun. Get a grip of yourself if you do not enjoy this. It is a relaxing laugh. My wife booked this for us as part of her birthday week in The Dam. It was a pleasant experience and Niels and Violet (the game masters) helped make it so before and after the game. It was not as difficult as I thought but that helped (as game started) put any reservations behind me. Let's give the people behind this a big hand for trying something new. We had an Italian quartet playing this with little Dutch/English between them but at the end they were so happy as we were. The drinks offered were of the soft variety which we were not expecting so that was a negative...a wee wine or beer would have soothed this Scottish soul. Teenagers would enjoy this and not just us folk in mid fifties !!!! What you thought we were younger !!!! Antwerp then world domination for these folk....oh and the offer of the Scottish franchise is still most acceptable. EDINBURGH would love it !!!!

You have to play this, it's awesome!!!. We stayed in amsterdam for 3 nights and booked this game for an unusual farewell to amsterdam... So glad I booked it as it made our stay very memorable! We were greeted by Katie who I must say was lovely and very welcoming! I'm not very good a riddles but I was interested so thought why not??!! The hour goes so fast but it's such fun and wished it lasted longer, but that would defeat the point!! This is a must if you are in amsterdam and it's something you probably will never get the chance to do as I've never seen this type of game before... Anywhere!! We'll done room of riddles.... Can't wait for your new room!!!!!

Excellent. Despite no experience of these sort of games and not knowing what to expect, we had to try The Room after reading all the great reviews. Nice short trip out of the city centre on the No2 tram and then greeted by our excellent host, who provided a humorous introduction before the game began. Great fun as the clock ticks down and the excitement builds. So much fun we didn't want it to end but that would kind of defeat the object of the game!! Something different and a highly enjoyable change from the usual Amsterdam stuff. Can't wait to return and try the next challenge.

Brilliant start to our weekend.. This was an excellent start to a fantastic weekend.We headed to Room of Riddles straight from the airport (a very helpful lady told us what train to get and to get off at Amsterdam Lelylaan then a short walk). We arrived at Room of Riddles a little bit early so we had a nice hot drink in the small cafe on the ground floor of the building. Unsure of what to expect we headed up stairs to meet our Riddle master (Elizabeth) she was lovely :). She explained all the do's and dont's of the game, we signed a wee disclaimer and then headed to the room to be locked in! As for what happens in there well that's a secret but we had brilliant fun involving great team work. I will say we did manage to escape with 23.57 minutes left so we were all really pleased. We sat and chatted following our escape and the Riddle master helped us look online to sort out where we were headed off to next, she even took us outside to show us where to get on a tram to head into the city centre.I would recommend as soon as you have booked your flights book this game as it gets booked up really fast. We were lucky to keep checking on the website and eventually a time slot opened up as initially it was fully booked and we were quite gutted as it was on our MUST do list. 100% recommend to anybody travelling to Amsterdam
Very fun experience. It was a very fun experience!!! Challenging yourself to find a solution as quick as possible. And it's a fun to do with a friend. It teaches you how you work with someone.

Exciting game!!!. We spend the weekend in Amsterdam with friends and played the game and it was amazing. It was very easy to find we traveled here with the tram. The riddle master was a very nice lady and before we started she explained the game in a nice way. I must admit it was a lot of thinking and it was challenging but it was also logical at the same time. They thought it well. I certainly recommend this game. You will have fun!

Lives up to expectation!. My wife and I booked a trip to the Room of Riddles almost 6 months ago and have been looking forward to it ever since! We do not have any of these room escape games back home (Calgary, Alberta, Canada) and have been eager to give them a try. I knew I would have a good time as I played games like Myst growing up and have a couple room escape games on my phone that I still play from time to time, but I was much more hesitant about my wife having a good experience as she had never done something like this before. She LOVED it! As a matter a fact, she booked another room escape game during our stay here in Amsterdam. Our quiz master (Lisebeth sorry if spelling is incorrect) was very fun and helpful before, during, and after the game.

A lot of fun!. Me and my friends had a lot of fun while playing room of riddles. Also the staff is extremely friendly. Good location easy to reach. Tram 2 seems to be one of the most beautifull tram rides in the world recording to national geographic!

Brilliant!. Came here on the advice of a friend after having a surprise birthday trip sprung on me by my girlfriend. Definitely one of the best things we did whilst in Amsterdam. Our riddle master Katie was welcoming, informative and really friendly. The room was really well thought out and exciting from beginning to end.

Loved it! Such a fun experience.. My husband and I spent 3 days in Amsterdam before heading to South Africa. This was such a fun and unique experience! It's easy to get to, I just wish there were pubs or places to eat close by. Who cares, we're so glad we went and we would totally do this again. Just go and do it!

Room of Riddles was THE surprise of the trip. The trip to Amsterdam was scheduled for a long time. Fortunately I started checking tripadvisor a weeks ahead to make some visit plan, else I am afraid I would have missed this. I am not into gaming, but I had heard quite a bit about escape games from my friends. I am too old for visiting a fair attraction, so the ad from Room of Riddles appeals to me.The first surprise was, that one needed a cell phone to get into the building. A friendly local helped me out, but be warned if you go there yourself.Then you are welcomed by the Riddle Master as a real guest. She explained the do's and don'ts and the we were on own.I won't spoil the story, but with a bit of help from the Riddle Master we made it in time. Without that, we probably would still be locked up! She gave us the feeling we were the most intelligent crew she had ever had and that made my day.Back outside in the rain, we caught the tram in front of the building to return to our hotel.We were so pleased with ourselves....:-)

Brilliant!. One of our favourite excursions in Amsterdam! Without giving much away, the aim of the game is to Is to solve a series of riddles to get out of the room. It was very well thought out and ran seamlessly. Fatima, our riddle master was very friendly and gave us hints when we struggled to find clues. She also recommended some other great attractions in Amsterdam and was in great spirits. I would recommend this to everyone!

Good even for the price. Room of riddles was really worth trying. My boyfriend and I saw all the reviews and thought we had to try it. We had no problems with the booking or getting there. If you look at google-maps before going there - you can see it's right next to the metro and tram, it only toke 30min. from our hotel (in centrum Amsterdam). I was a bit worried - didn't know what to expect and it was a little expensive. But it was such a great experience, a rush looking for all the codes and time went by quickly! The riddle master was a lovely, friendly and outgoing girl, she was extremely helpful both with the 'game' and after about getting to other attractions in area, with her references!
Excessive price. Its a regular room with riddles inside and you have one hour to get out of the room. It was nice but absolutely don't worth the money and time to drive over.

Awesome!. Me and my husband did something like this before in Malaysia but it was sooo complicated and difficult. Room of Riddles was much more interesting and the clues were helpful! I felt so nervous when I started hearing the couple in the other room figuring out things and that put more pressure on me! lolYou should definitely visit Room if Riddles when in Amestrdam.

Excellent fun. My girlfriend & I went here last night (9th November) and loved it. Fairly challenging, but given a few clues along the way, it's a good test of your logical thinking. We managed to get out with just a few minutes to spare! This game is probably best done with a few more people than 2 to aid with finding clues but we just about managed as a couple! Our riddlemaster (Violet) was great and helped us along the way when we needed it. She was especially great after the game giving us a few tips and advice about where to go and what to see in Amsterdam! Well worth a visit if you're interested in something a little different and 'off the beaten track'. Good luck!

Good fun, something a bit different. Could be a bit far but handy from Oud Zuid or with #2 tram. I booked this as something a bit different to do with 3 friends who were in town for the weekend. I didn't tell them what my 'secret planned activity' was so it was quite fun to watch them discover what we had to do. None of us had ever done anything like it before and as such we really enjoyed it. We had over 12 minutes left when we escaped so were pretty pleased with our effort. Had a lot of fun and would recommend it to others (but think the element of surprise added something for my gang to be sure!). Hard to get a booking as it's pretty popular but thought it was very well organised and Katie was really nice, we had good chats with her after. New room opening this month might make it easier to get a booking perhaps. Would be good if there was an option for 2 groups to play at the same time maybe, race each other; I don't think that's currently the case (may be wrong on this). Good as an option to do something a bit off the beaten track anyway...

Room of riddles. Room of riddles is defo worth trying. A friend saw reviews here and booked it. I didn't know what to expect! There was three of us and I thought it was a little expensive but would be cheaper if more people! I have to say it was worth it! It was such a buzz looking for all the codes! The riddle master was a very friendly girl who was extremely helpful about getting to other attractions in area! The room of riddles is very easy get to. It's right beside tram stop.
Great fun. Highly recommended. Great fun and a very clever concept! The staff go to great lengths to ensure your enjoyment. Thank you Violet :-)

Very fun evening, but please get a doorbell! . Despite the fact that this place is in the middle of nowhere and there aren't any signs, it is very easy to get to and find if you follow the instructions on the website. Without ruining the premise, the introduction was friendly and included refreshments, and the game itself was well organised and flowed logically and seamlessly. We'd like to try more of these games!
Very fun and original. We had a blast playin the game. Very nice staff. It was easy to find and it was something different than usual partying in Amsterdam.

Really pleased we went. Thought this would be a bit hum-drum, but as we were travelling with friends, thought it may be a laugh. it was great fun and was a highlight of the break. Its different, its fun, its exciting, its frustrating and its unique!!

Great fun to play!. We had a really great time at Room of Riddles in Amsterdam with two teenage kids to entertain - this was a really enjoyable hour. Thanks to Katie for being a great host and for providing a couple of hints when we were stuck. We were even top of the daily leaderboard for a while!

Fun and enjoyable!. We visited Room of Riddles on our second day. It is out of the centre but well worth the extra little travel!Staff were excellent (Violet) and Room Riddles were super!I agree with the comments about more of a story behind the room would have made the experience even better (if I am being picky!). Anyone worried or deliberating please just have a go!

Echt een aanrader!!!!. My sister and I never played a game like this before, but it was really nice and had lots of fun. Katie was a very good riddle master and the owners are super friendly. I would really recommend the game and enjoy your riddles.!!
LOU78. Came here on our last night of our holiday......It was brilliant....would defiantly recommend it to everyone.

Quirky and fun. The escape game concept was a completely new one to me and my boyfriend, meaning we had absolutely no idea what to expect. If you've done something like this before, you may find it slightly easier but otherwise, it really is a challenge! We had trouble finding the building (it's hard to see a green building when it's dark outside) but our Riddlemaster Niels came outside to find us. We were thinking our bad start didn't bode well for us solving the game but with a few helpful hints, we escaped! Niels kindly offered us some suggestions of where we could visit after completing the game which turned out to be a really cool live music bar. Overall, we had a great time and I'm now looking for escape rooms in every country I visit!

Good but not great. we did this as a couple, this was our second room in our trip. the reason we gave this a 4 is that although it was very much fun- it did lack somewhat in the plot department, which we found a bit disappointing.The staff were very nice, and the establishment was indeed very easy to find! One more thing, make sure you have credit on your phone, you will need it :)

A fantastic experience. We decided to go to room of riddles after reading the reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed. Violet was our host and looked after us throughout this unique experience. Our team of four, the wife, teenage twins and myself managed to escape from the room with two half minutes to spare! I would highly recommend anyone who visits Amsterdam books in for the room of riddles

Would definitely recommend!!. After reading great reviews on tripadvisor, 4 of us visited the room of riddles and we weren't disappointed. We were welcomed by the friendly owners and our riddle master Niels gave a short briefing before we were locked in the room and given 60 minutes to crack the code and escape!! My whole group laughed from start to finish, we had a brilliant time and would love to return if they create a new room. Would highly recommend this experience! Thanks again.

Entertainment in a room!. We did this thanks to my husbands enthusiasm... And it was totally worth it. Its a little far out from the heart of the city. But well connected by trams. Do book online well in advance as they seem to be very popular. You will enjoy solving the riddles which at times seem quite unattainable!! I wouldn't want to disclose more as it would spoil the fun!! A fun and different experience to try out for sure!!

Amazing!. I went here with a friend and it was amazing the escape game its self was really well planned out and had a great atmosphere and the staff were really helpful and friendly, highly recommended and i would definitely go again!

There is too much hype around it. Well, we booked in advanced the two rooms.The owners and staff are REALLY nice people, very friendly and helpful.The room itself was a bit of disappointment, we were hoping for much harder stuff, but I guess they needed to aim for the majority of people.Over all it was a fun experience.

Very worthwhile experience. Highly entertaining one hour of problem-solving. Finding the place is an enigma in and of itself. Violet was our riddle master and was very nice. I can't wait to try more escape games in other cities.

Omg!!. This was unique and so much fun. Having never experienced anything like it before I didn't know what to expect. We weren't disappointed. Liesbeth was a great riddle master. 60 minutes to solve the clues and escape,harder than it sounds. Would highly recommend.
Great fun. Visited on 23/10/14, best thing we did in Amsterdam. Great fun with 3 other friends. Solved it in about 45 minutes but a good challenge throughout

Enjoyable and unique experience!. Room of Riddles was a highlight of our Amsterdam trip! It was certainly an unique, unforgettable experience. We went as a group of four, and had a great time solving the 'riddle' - a series of puzzles in order to escape the room. The whole thing was extremely well planned and very clever. Our riddle master, Violet was funny, friendly and charming, and made us feel very welcome. She was even kind enough to give us some tips on Amsterdam afterwards!Only a couple of minor complaints - the location is slightly out of the way, and there are no eating establishments in close walking distance, so please avoid our mistake and eat beforehand! :-) The building itself is exactly how it's described on the website - a green glass modern office building - but it really doesn't look like the Room of Riddles is in there! We initially thought we were in the wrong place, despite the description! Also it was somewhat tricky to get into the building, as they don't have an official bell so you need to give the room a call upon arrival. This was made difficult for our group as we did not have an international SIM card and had to resort to borrowing a phone.Overall we had an awesome time, and would recommend the Room of Riddles to anyone planning a visit to Amsterdam!

Fun escape game in Amsterdam. This was so much fun. Don´t miss out on this experience. You will be locked in a room and then you have 1 hour to find clues so you can open the safe - and get the key to lock yourself out of the room again. A great teambuild event. Do it with friends or family.

!noitpo gnitseretni yrev a. Went there with my girlfriend. I feel bad cuz I don't remember our host's name, but he was ultra nice and even recommended a place to go after the game. The game itself is well designed and fun to play. Its about a 25 minute tram ride from leidsenplein, so if you follow national geographic advice on number 2 tram in amsterdam being one of the nicest tram rides in the world, you could take it from centraal about 40 minutes before your arrival time.I would do this again if I came back. Its a lot of fun. We didn't smoke before going in but i would advice against it as you have to be able to think straight. Nothing very difficult, but still. Don't smoke and play!

What a great game.... My wife and I and my parents-in-law decided to go for a challenge during our trip to Amsterdam and found this little piece of joy via TripAdvisor. Our riddle master was so lovely and the room itself was funny yet challenging. We loved every minute of it and would do it again immediately if there would be another room. We're eagerly awaiting the next room of riddles :) It is also a really really nice opportunity to do something off of normal tourist routes and typical sight seeing.
Fun and different. We did this as a family of three and it was something different. It only takes an hour but the time went really fast!

Perfect Game and an even better Riddle Master!!. The game is extremely fun and everything there is thought of (even the time spent waiting for other groups to finish). The riddles are really fun and creative and make sure you're occupied for almost 60 minutes. The game is just perfect and could hardly be better.However, our riddle master Liesbeth somehow managed to do that. She created a very nice, fun atmosphere (even gave us advice on bikes, music and entertainment in Amsterdam) and was probably the reason why we felt entertained throughout the 60 minutes. We could've spent the last 20 mins stuck in a riddle , hadn't it been for her hint. She made our experience literally unforgettable.There's another reason for this.
