We arrived there an hour late and thought that we wouldn't get a chance to play, especially since we only had 30 hours of stay left in Holland. Liesbeth however squeezed herself and her schedule and offered us not 1, but 2 other times to play. So we made use of this and played on the next day and had loads of fun. We are really thankful Liesbeth!!! Danke je!!

Great fun!. Found that others had favorably reviewed Room of Riddles and was looking for something different to do while in Amsterdam. Very glad we did this! Violet was a great riddle master. Make sure you book in advance!

Great Experience. My friend and I had a great experience at the Room of Riddles. Katie, our game master, is very friendly and energetic. Katie's bubbly personality set the tone very early for us and we had a blast thanks to Katie. The owners are very nice and engaging, we spent half an hour talking to them after the game.I would highly recommend this to anybody. Just be sure to arrive about 15 minutes for introduction and stuff.

So much fun!. We loved Room of Riddles! We were not sure what the expect when we signed up, but it was a blast! Katie was our Riddle Master. She was very friendly and helpful (as much as she could be). It was such a unique experience, and a great way for friends and/or couples to work together to accomplish a goal! We all had a great time.

Very cool experience. Being locked in a room with your partner for an hour, trying to get out, really tests your cooperation skills as a couple. This was a great experience. It was our first time in this type of attraction, but definitely not the last. They had thought trough riddles, which really put your mind on a test. Only bad thing was that this was the only game for the while, so we could not do another during our Amsterdam stay. This is however one of the things i will visit during my next stay in Amsterdam, given that they have another game rigged, which they promised they were working on.Awesome!

Something a little different! :-). We visited this a couple of weeks ago as it sounded a little different and had great reviews and we picked up a cancellation a week before we left for amsterdam -this books up very quickly! Book in advance. It's located out of the centre and so make time to get there - we knew this but had to fit in a drink at T'Arendsnest on Herengracht and so ended up rushing there on the bicycles we'd rented for the day. A little tricky to find in the dark and it feels a bit of a strange location. We had an anxious moment when our phones refused to call the number given and think they should make a doorbell of some kind. Fairly expensive for only 2 people, for costs see website, especially if solve the room quickly.We both really enjoyed the game and had great fun. Would do it again and happy to recommend it for couples or small groups. Our gamemaster was lovely, plied us with sweeties and insider amsterdam tips. Thanks :-)
Excellent. Super fun, slightly over-priced. Would not recommend more than 3 people per game. Staff is friendly.

Great Family Fun!. My husband, 20-year-old son and I decided to play this game and had a great time. The game itself was fun and challenging (but not too challenging). It was good to work as a family team (something that happens less as the children grow up). The facilitator and the facilities were top notch. And it was quite different from anything else we did in Amsterdam. I highly recommend it.

Great fun!. We did this on our visit to Amsterdam last weekend. There were 4 of us and none of us had done anything like this before. I had read about it on Tripadvisor and booked it 8 weeks ago, which is just as well as it books out very quickly.We got the no 2 tram but it was a lot further out of the town than we were expecting. It still only took 20-25 mins though.We managed to get out of the room after 52minutes- not a record by any means but we had such a laugh! We all said we would love to do one again. I didn't realise how competitive I was and was furious when I heard screaming from the room next door as the 4 Turkish lads got the key out of their safe!Good fun, definitely recommend!

Something different. It was the first time I had visited an attraction of this sort and had never really heard of it before but now I can't wait to visit more riddle type attractions. Riddle Master Katie was extremely friendly and fun and afterwards gave us some great local info for the rest of our stay in Amsterdam.We had very little idea of what to expect and were a little nervous when first shut in the room, however, we soon got the hang of things and had so many giggles and mini adrenaline rushes as you work against the clock. Such a fun thing to do as a group of friends, couple or family, although I can see how some may bicker when things aren't going so well :-)Would highly recommend a visit, although quite expensive for an hour it is worth it to do something a little different.Oh and the Christmas biscuits in the briefing room are yummy!!!!!!!! Thank you so much Katie...had a great time. will be back to trial the second roomBerni and Dave

Excellent Escape Game! . We came here during a recent trip to Amsterdam and had prebooked on account of the amazing tripadvisor reviews. We were a group of two so it was a little on the expensive side but it gets cheaper the more people in your group. Won't give anything away but it was a challenging and unique experience. Our quizmaster Fathima was the best! :) we'd definitely recommend this- a must do in Amsterdam :)

All we've expected and more!. Was such an amazing experience. It was all we have expected and more. The hostess was so nice and explaining us about the game and giving us food recommendations at the end. The game itself was exciting and the room itself, full of items really got us in to escaping mode!Was so much fun!

Great fun!. Met by Katie who was great, didn't know what to expect but high expectations following trip advisor . Not disappointed - went in the room and when we got into it , it was really good. We did it with 13 mins to go! From central station it is about half an hour by tram. Go left and you will see green office building - go in and enjoy!

A must visit . Can easily see why this is so popular, a must do whilst in Amsterdam.Such a unique idea and so well run by our riddle master Katie.It was amazing how quickly the hour goes and how stressful it can become when time is running out. Katie was certainly right when she said to think logically, I think the countdown on the clock makes your mind go to mush!It is right near the tram stop so a 10 minute ride from the centre.Will definitely do it again when their new room is ready.

Brilliant fun. I wanted to do something different in amsterdam so booked this for hubby and I , easy to find and get to from central amsterdam, coffee shop in the lobby if you're early, katie was an excellent clue master and gave us just enough but not too much help,we cracked the safe with 7 mins to spare. Total blast and great value, quickest hour of my life. Book and enjoy

Great fun, where did the 1 hour go?. You totally lose track of time inside that room! Everyone working towards the same goal, surprise after surprise, riddle after riddle. It mustn't be easy to assemble a game plan like that, but it is so fun to play it. Totally recommend the room of riddles, it is not that far if you take the tram 2, it stops just by the door.

Want to come back.... This is without a doubt one of the most fun things I have ever done. The idea of being stuck in a locked room for one hour doesn't seem like much fun but it is fantastic. Don't take my word for it, the reviews speak for themselves. The staff are lovely and friendly and helpful, giving recommendations for Amsterdam. I will definitely be back in the future.

Fantastic. Everything went smoothly from start to finish, from booking our time slot right through to saying goodbye to our fantastic riddle master Niels.It is a wee bit out of the centre but jump on a no.2 tram & it's not long until you get there.It was well thought out, easily explained & annoyingly tricky.We were made to feel welcome & thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, we'll be back to try & crack the second room when it is ready.

I want to have another go!. My boyfriend and I did this together. Loved everything about it except my own ability to think under stress. Thanks to some helpful hints we did make it out JUST in time. The first thing I thought when I finished was "I want to have another go!"

Very enjoyable. Highly recommended!. It is fun and different as everyone says. Book now! It was completely booked up when I looked weeks in advance but I continued to check back consistently nearer the time and a few slots opened up. Keep checking back if it's booked. Interest is too high for the organisers to email you if there was a cancellation but don't give up if booked up when you look at first.Neils was a brilliant riddle master. He helped make the experience even more fun. It was great chatting with him before and after the game to learn about the company and his recommendations in Amsterdam. Thanks, Neils!They are building another room so we hope to be back.

A different experi. We played this game last week and were divided in two groups of 4, paying €89 for each group. It was quite challenging, but we were given hints by the riddle master.I suggest that more riddles with different themes are created for second-time visitors.

Veru fun and different!! Worth the time!. We went there on our last day in Amsterdam, and left the city with a big smile!The room is a very fun attraction, suitable for all parties and ages. It's not too hard, just basic logic - so do not skip it because you're afraid you won't solve it (they won't let you).The staff was very kind, offered us help and instructions, cold drinks and even a riddle for home!Remember to book in advance, usually full for a week or more ahead!

Great time!! Worth the Hour!. My husband and I have been to Amsterdam a few times and were liking for something different to do, as well as keep us awake on the day we arrived! I saw Room of Riddles on trip Advisor about a month ago, it was #3 on the list at the time, I made a 9pm reservation. Best decision I made. After Niels met us at the tram stop, we could not see the green building at night, he gave us orientation and we were on our way! We wanted to be the best time of the day, so that got our adrenaline going right from the start. It was not easy, but it was challenging! We were second best of the day! Fun for a group or just 2 people. It is well worth the trek just outside the city centre! Go on and give your brain a challenge!!Niels was also very sweet, it was only his second day working there! Thanks for the suggestion about Bourbon Street, music was great and we definitely stayed up late, or should I say early, the day we arrived!

HILARIOUS FUN!. I would 100% recommend this! It is a little pricey (€35) compared to other stuff you can do in Amsterdam - so worth it! You need to get a tram from central station to get there but it is only a 2 minute walk from the stop so it's fine! Get your google maps out! Elizabeth was our guide and she was so enthusiastic and helpful! It wasn't as glamorous as the website made it out to be - you're "free drink" was a can of 7up. (LOL) but it was the best fun. Me and my girlfriend did it and were in the knots laughing half the time, mission impossible the other half! Really good for a small group of friends or a couple to do. There are two rooms if you have a large group so you can actually race each other! Hope they change it annually as I plan to return to Amsterdam next year and beat my time! Super fun!

Great fun and unusual treat. My partner and I booked a place here one evening as an alternative to the usual Amsterdam nightlife and it certainly didn't dissappoint.It's outside of the city centre so be prepared to travel if you're staying there, it's easy to access via tram, metro etc or a taxi will set you back about €30, it's well worth the trip though.Our host for the evening was extremely friendly and considering it was his second day working for RofR he gave a great introduction and was very courteous before leading us through to the 'room of riddles'. Discussing what you do would spoil the entire experience but what I will say is that it was one of the most fun and enjoyable evenings I've had in Amsterdam, it'll certainly get you thinking, working as a team and possibly generate the occasional argument.Overall it was a great way to spend a couple of hours during our evening, our host was even friendly enough to recommend places in the city centre to eat afterwards and as he used to be a tour guide his local knowledge was excellent. It's an experience I would definitely repeat again if the riddles change in the future and I would recommend it to anyone to try out atleast once.

Just brilliant . booked this after it came up on trip advisor. Thought 90 euros (for 4) was fine as long as it was good and it was absolutely worth every penny. Our riddle master, Fatima was friendly and full of energy. She made you feel at ease and prepared you for the game ahead. Can't say that much about the room but it's exciting, fun and frustrating all at once. We got a decent time having over 11 mins left to get out and as if 12.30 we had the best time so far! Apparently a new room is being planned out and we can't wait, would have done another room there and then if we could. Fantastic experience and a must do if your visiting Amsterdam

Highlight of the visit to amsterdam. Not done anything like it before.. Just left the game with my wife and another couple. Not going to say anything in the review to spoil it for anyone as, to me, it was a unique experience. A bit out of town but very easy to find from the tram downtown to the right station ! Easy to get from there to the airport. Knew nothing going into the room but all four of us had a great time. The facilitator was there when you need her and ours was great. Recommend it to anyone.

Time well spent. We visited the room of riddles on a Sunday morning, and though tempted to stay in bed instead, we don't regret the decision of going. We were a team of two and had no idea what to expect. It was a fun experience, and a nice break from exploring the city. It is a good activity for teamwork too. I recommend popping by for anyone who likes a riddle or some brain teasers
What a great time we had!!. An unforgettable adventure with the great team ever - my wife & girls... This is our first time to Amsterdam and to escape room...That one is a must for all riddles fans

A must do in Amsterdam!. My boyfriend and I cannot rate our experience at the room of riddles highly enough. we can see why it's rated #1 on the list of things to do in the beautiful city of Amsterdam! It's a fair trek from central Amsterdam. But don't let that put you off! It's absolutely worth it! It was a highlight of our trip - one we'll think about and laugh about for a long time. And such lovely staff. The magnificent Katie who was more then welcoming! And we thank her for her local restaurant recommendations. The owner came and introduced herself to us as well. Add this to your list of things to do! We look forward to returning some day, with a room full of new challenges! THANKS GUYS! x

So much fun. This was the first time me and my friend did anything like this. It was amazing. Our room master Katie was the best. Such a sweet person. And we got to meet the owner who was also awesome. This is really fun to do and something very different. It's a must do if your here. If I do get to make it back im Def doing it again.

Great attraction!. A great place to kill a bit of time, really looking forward for the next room to open!We were a group of 3 friends, and didn't really know what to look forward to, the person who briefed us (Katey I believe), did an excellent job, and in general the vibe of the place is very cool and mysterious.

Nice surprise in Amsterdam. My wife and I just returned from a two-week trip through the Netherlands, and spent a week in Amsterdam. TripAdvisor was a GREAT resource for us... and we're really glad that one of the things we found out about was the Room of Riddles.The concept is awesome, as is the execution. The crew was great, too. We enjoyed spending time with all three of our "riddle masters".Solving the Room was a blast, too. :)

Best thing we did on our trip!. I booked this as a birthday treat for my boyfriend and I ( same birthdays) and after the stress of navigating the city this was a welcome change! Our riddle master Fatima was brilliant and although we didn't know what to expect it was the best thing we did all trip! I would highly recommend it and I can't wait to do it again!

Very fun and unique expiriance. We played the game a few days ago and had a great time! It's a little expensive for those on a budget (we payed 80 euro for the 3 of us) but really worth it ! The riddle master was very nice. Only thing is that we felt that we got too many clues then we wanted...overall very fun and different. thanks a lot!

Time flew by in the Room of Riddles. My wife and I had a wonderful time in the room of riddles, an interactive game where you solve puzzles that allow you to escape from the room you are in. Similar to the old computer game "Mist". Make sure you bring a mobile phone to call when you arrive at the location.

Really fun time!. I booked this as a birthday present for my friend, and it was just the two of us.We arrived at night, so it was a little bit trickier to find the place, but we just called up and were given helpful directions and found it in no time!The game itself is so much fun, and the riddle master is very helpful when you get stuck. I won't give anything away, but I highly recommend giving this a go!Our riddle master was also very helpful with telling us good places to go around Amsterdam, marking things on our map!

Amazing!!. A group of 6 of us went (3 couples) & the boys weren't that excited, not as much as us girls anyway. So we got there & the lovely Riddle Master met us outside the building and took us up to the room, we were briefed on what the game entailed and provided with drinks and chocolate. We booked 2 rooms (boys v girls) & boy was it fun!!!!! I don't want to spoil it for anyone else that wants to go so I won't say too much but if you don't think you'll enjoy it you definitely will! I want to do another one already! The girls won.. obviously! & we were then offered a fizzy drink and some snacks, we then chilled and had a chat and were advised of some good places to visit. All in all a great time!! Thanks for having us Room of Riddles!

Brilliant and challenging!. We booked this as part of a birthday trip to Amsterdam and were very excited about it. Fortunately we were not disappointed, and it was easily one of our highlights! The staff were absolutely lovely and made us feel very welcome - Fatima was keen to show us all the best spots in Amsterdam for us to visit! We were given our instructions and a walkie talkie and torch before being locked in the dark room, with the first challenge being to figure out how to turn on the lights! After we'd made our way out despite missing one of the clues (still not entirely sure how we managed that), we were given a drink and chatted with the staff. It's a great way to bond and work as part of a team with your friends/loved ones, and a little bit of squabbling too! All in all a fantastic thing to do in Amsterdam, you really shouldn't miss it.

Loved it, well thought out.. Such an addictive concept, this is the second escape room we have tried and we just want to do more now, especially after this one which was just the right difficulty level. Do it, you will be buzzing by the end!

A great experience.... If you can figure it out..... The Room of Riddles is a new concept game that is tailor-fit to anyone who likes to solve riddles and figure out clues. I don't want to give away anything about what to expect, but it'll definitely be fun! So, get your McGyver on and just do it. I dare you....

Riddleculously good!. Found The Room of Riddles rated one of the top things to do in Amsterdam so me and my boyfriend thought it was definitely something we HAD to do as it was something we had never heard of before! We arrived a little earlier than our time slot being new to Amsterdam and the Riddle Room team were more than obliging offering drinks and snacks! The game was so much fun and the right amount of challenging! Perfect and that teamed with the fun, enthusiastic and helpful team just made the experience even more enjoyable and personal! Also pointed out a few things for us to do for the rest of our time in Amsterdam! Definitely a must! Thanks for everything! Team Manchester :)

Finally something different. Traveling exposes one to many new experiences and enhances someones knowledge. After having visited the standard must-do's, we wondered what to do next. I have become a bit careful to follow Tripadvisor recommendations as they not always are in line with my interests. However, I must admit that the experience of the "Room of Riddles" certainly received the right rating, at least for us. If you like intellectual challenges in a very friendly environment and do not want to spend too much money, than this is your event. The "riddle master" makes one feel at home and explains the challenges to which you will be exposed in the next hour. And when you get out, all exited, she has ample time to listen to your experiences. In addition we got some great advice on what to do in the rest of the evening. Nothing better than getting advices from a local.So, if you are in for something completely different than a tourist trap, this is the thing to do.Have as much fun as we had.John and family

So much fun!. Me and my husband Booked the Riddle room for Tuesday after seeing it was currently ranking No. 2 on trip advisor for top attractions in Amsterdam. We weren't sure what to expect but we were defiantly not disappointed! Our rep Katie was so funny and welcoming which really added to the whole experience. I think it's and activity that's great for all groups as well as couple. The only suggestion I have is the certificate at the end could have been better. Providing people with a nice momento. Would defiantly recommend this for something a little different from the usual tourist attractions.

TEAM IRELAND OUR EXPERIENCE. We went to room of riddles on 30th August this year and found it absolutely brilliant. Fatima was so welcoming and explained (as much as she could) about what we were about to experience. it was something we had never done before and found it brilliant. Fatima was on hand by walkie talkie to advise and helps us when we got stuck. it is a fabulous concept and well worth a visit. a buzzer outside would be a help and also to take peoples mobile numbers to text them regarding their booking would be an asset. it is sometimes hard to get to read your emails so texting would be better. definitely worth a visit when in Amsterdam and it is not difficult to reach. thanks once again to Fatima for her help. TEAM IRELAND

What a fun experience.. I booked this not really knowing what to expect. I went with my wife. It was brilliant. So much fun and the room was really well thought out. Our riddle master Fatima was also really great - friendly and always smiling. I would totally recommend this.
Amazing teambuilding. We were 12 bankers from Norway who played against eachother. What an amazing race - except that other team won! A MUST do in Amsterdam!

Great family activity. Game that keeps you on the ball, teamwork is a must and think logically.Fun activity, especially with teenager children as this was something we never tried before. Book in advance as most probably you might not find a convenient slot to book. Katie, our game leader was great ! Thanks for a lovely experience. XXXXX

Excellent!! Best Activity in the Dam! 100% Recommend!. Me and my family absolutely loved the 'Room of Riddles' experience. 100 times better than what i was expecting. Very exciting and mind boggling. Hoping for another room to open soon as i would travel back to Amsterdam just to do it again :-)

A must-do!. Me and my girlfriend have just got back from a 3 day trip in Amsterdam. We are both in complete agreement that this was the best activity of the whole holiday. Katie our riddle-master was so friendly and made the whole, already brilliant, experience even better. A must try for anyone looking for a unique experience in amsterdam!

Definitely a must do in Amsterdam!. We weren't sure what to expect, but given the great reviews we booked the room of riddles for our first night in Amsterdam ( this was the only slot as they were fully booked!). On arrival we were slightly apprehensive, but called the number on confirmation email, and were greeted by our riddle master, Fatima.From the very beginning Fatima was so friendly and made us feel at ease. She spoke great english too. We weren't given much detail, and were soon let lose in the room. We struggled to start but once we got into the game it was great! You really have to use your head and work as a team, but the riddle master was on hand when we got really stuck. It was a challenge but such good fun and something really different. Afterwards we had a drink with Fatima and she recommended some places for us to visit while in Amsterdam.Overall a brilliant experience and highly recommended...thanks Room of Riddles!!!

Room of Riddles.. Worth a visit!. We visited Room of Riddles yesterday on a somewhat mixed day of weather in Amsterdam. Despite reading reviews on finding the building, it was very easy to find! We were greeted by the riddle master who was really friendly and welcoming! We were not sure what to expect however the game was great fun and defiantly something we will not forget! Help is always to hand if you get stuck so that you can get the most of the game.We were offered a drink (from a huge selection) and were given some tour advice as where to go for the day on our bikes!! On a side note, the cycle to the building was a great way to see more of Amsterdam!

Do Not Miss!. So me and my boyfriend have just returned from a couple of days in Amsterdam and we love this place! I booked online as you have to reserve, hopped on a tram which is about 15 minutes from Amsterdam central, we did get lost trying to find the place but with a phone call we were right outside.Katie (the host) came down and greeted us, where she then led us upstairs to the rooms, she was extremely helpful!Overall it was the most fun we've had in a long time!!! I highly recommend this place!!

Great fun, recommended for everyone. Me and my boyfriend biked to the place from our hotel, once we arrived I called the number given in the instructions and Katie, our very nice host, collected us and led us to the room of riddles. The game was really entertaining, it left me wanting for more! :)

Go on... give it a go!. Saw this and booked it as me and my partner like something different to do having visited Amsterdam on many previous occassions. An interesting spot outside of the main canal belt and away from your normal tourist attractions and easily accessible via the number 2 tram. Our 'riddle master' was Katie who was very welcoming and genuinely interested in her job and the enjoyment of those taking part. The group booked in before us had not turned up for their Sunday morning slot and tut, tut, missed out on this experience... either sleping off a hangover or just too scared to leave their comfort zone!Will you leave your comfort zone? We did and it set our last day perfectly... What have you got to lose?

Excellent - book it now!. My husband and I took on the Room of Riddles challenge last week and loved it! Probably the best thing we did while in Amsterdam. Such an experience and our riddle master was great. Build another room and we'll come again! It's well worth the cost and although it's a little further out than most of Amsterdam's attractions, it's really easy to get to on the tram. Don't hesitate - book it now if you like a good riddle!

Great fun and a good laugh! . I booked this as the reviews on trip advisor were so good and I wasn't disappointed! Easy to find on the tram from central Amsterdam although the instructions given to get there were easy to follow. Greeted on entry by the riddle masters who were warm and welcoming. Challenge was good fun and we really enjoyed the challenge and when completed the debrief and chat with the hosts was a nice bonus. Thank you again for the experience, I definitely recommend room of Riddles and will make sure I recommend it to anyone I know travelling to Amsterdam.

Book in advance. Best way to explain the experiance would be to compare it to one of those games where you have to find clues and stuff in order to get out of the room.It was a good way to spend a rainy afternoon. Make sure you book in advance since it is quite fully booked. I would recommend 2-4 people.The building was a bit tricky to find but after a phonecall they explained it to us and it was probably just us being a bit stupid ;)
A must do if you are in Amsterdam. We really enjoyed the game, and the admins are very kind. You really should try this game if you are in Amsterdam
Best part of the trip. Our riddle master was super nice! It was fun, challenging and so worth while. Would recommend Room of Riddles to everyone!

Great activitiy and super nice people. My friend and I went there on our first night in Amsterdam. We had no idea what to expect and after having a few difficulties finding the building (it actually isn't hard to find) we were very excited what would happen next. Our riddle master had been new in the business so the owner of room of riddles assisted her but she did a great job!!! Before we got into the room she explained us the do's and don'ts of the game and we got less nervous. The game itself was so much fun and definitely something new and different. Afterwards we had a drink and she told us where to go in Amsterdam which was very helpful since we had arrived only a couple of hours before. They also showed us around - I guess we were the last team that evening. I definitley recommed Room of Riddles to everyone who wants to try something new, it is definitely worth it! And the people working there are super nice which is, in my opinion, very important cause you have to trust them quite a bit :)!

DONT MISS THIS!. An amazing experience and lovely staff! This was one of the best things we did in Amsterdam, makes you work as a team and think hard! If you can book a place this is a MUST! Be warned, don't aim to get there too early, as there isn't much else around. Would advise aiming to be around ten minutes before your slot. Oh and the tram stops right outside, which is handy!

Loads of fun and lots of laughs!. The 3 of us didn’t know what to expect when we arrived...we even thought the game had started before we met our “Riddle Master” (Violet) because we were at the address of the building...but we couldn’t figure out which number to press in order to ring someone up to get inside the building. There were no signs for “Room of Riddles” listed on the building directory. You see...I screwed up our reservation. Apparently, I accidentally booked it for the wrong Sunday evening...3 weeks ahead to be exact (perhaps one too many “coffee shops” visited). I didn’t realize this “momentary loss of judgement” until we saw a girl walking down the stairs, towards the entrance. Looking like the lost tourists we were, we asked if she knew where the “Room of Riddles” was—and by our chance encounter—this was the moment that Violet saved me from my embarrassment. Even though she could have told us, “too bad, so sad; good night”—she didn’t. In true awesomeness, Violet stayed, setup the room, and let us have our fun night at the “Room of Riddles”. On an added note, this was also the night of the 2014 World Cup final, which she missed out on—for us. Needless to say, Violet single-handedly made our last night in Amsterdam the best one. As for the “Room of Riddles” game, like the others before me mentioned, it was great fun and time really did go by in a flash. We were aiming to beat the record (something like 35 minutes)...haha, we didn’t come close (49 minutes)...but we had a great time trying! (Note: this review has been approved by all 3 of us—so it multiplies by 3!!!)

Great experience!. Me and my boyfriend booked Room of Riddles to try something new in Amsterdam. We didn't have a clue what to expect since it was out first time doing anything like that! We walked to room of riddles from out hotel it was about a 10min walk away, although trams stop right outside so you can get a tram there if needed. The 2 girls were really friendly and chatty, you get an 1 hour to solve Room of Riddles, so you need to be alert and focused since there's not much time! It was really good fun, we solved it in 49 mins, perfect for couples, families and friends!

Great Hen Do Experience!. I went to the room of riddles on a hen do this weekend and it was so much fun! There were five of us and we all loved it. The hen was totally surprised when she was told we were going to be locked in a room and have to find our way out. The couple who run it are lovely and deserve glowing reviews as they do this in their spare time. I would highly recommend if you want to try something different and you like a bit of competition!

Great Activitiy - Nice Team. If you feel like doing something different from Museums, Theathers and Walking through beautiful Amsterdam, then you should check out Room of Riddles. Its a cool experience trying to get out of the room!

Adventures, Emotions, and More. You want to have great fun in Amsterdam? You want to have an unforgettable adventure? Well, Room of Riddles is the place for you. I will tell you right away that it is a wonderful place to visit no matter if you are a family with young children, a group of friends, or even on a business trip. A challenge that will test your team work and ambition and it is absolutely worth your time and every cent spent! With the amazing atmosphere and the lovely hosts, you will feel like you are right where you want to be!

A great fun logical challenge. The room of riddles is outside the city centre but is very much worth the trip. A new business with a personal touch. Your locked in a room and have to find a way out. a great challenge!
Very nice.different.very expensive!. We r a family with 3 kidsThe expiriace is very nice but short and for 1 family it is more expensive than any museum in amsterdam

А Great Surprise. The Room of Riddles was hands down the best thing to do in Amsterdam. When I first stumbled on it on Trip Advisor I didn't know what to expect, but it sounded really fun, so I decided I would book a game and surprise my girlfriend. Along with us came two of our friends and needless to say, we had a blast. The hosts were super friendly and the room presented a genuinely interesting challenge. It's not something we've encountered before, but it's definitely something we'd like to encounter again. the riddles were very clever and the theme made the game constantly interesting as we raced against the clock. Overall, my favourite memory from amsterdam

Must do in Amsterdam!. I didn't know what to expect when when me and friends decided to go, but it ended up being one of the best experiences we had in Amsterdam. It is great for anyone, young and old and it was really clever and well thought through. The lady who was in charge of the experience was lovely and made us feel really welcome. Loved Room of Riddles!
An Amsterdam must=). A different, wonderful and super fun experience with wonderful staff (Violet)Real life brain training that puts you in a tricky spot that pushes your brain=)

Good time! Good challenge! . Looking for something to do? Like thinking outside the box? This is for you! The hosts are extremely friendly and this attraction offers an entertaining challenge! Make sure you take the time and enjoy this life size puzzle!

The hour flashed by. I was excited going into this and the experience did not disappoint. The riddles are perfectly designed to challenge you throughout the hour. Your riddle master (Violet is wonderful) will keep you on track!

A lot of fun!!!. This is a very good way to finish a sightseeing day in Amsterdam with some brain sport! Incredible how fast an hour can pass by! Thanks for the warm welcome. We are looking forward to resolve the new room :)

Best thing we did all holiday. Brilliant idea and really well executed!Went on a short break to Amsterdam with a friend and chanced upon a few reviews for 'the room of riddles'. As a huge fan of online room escape games i was thrilled at the idea.'Room of Riddles' completely exceeded both of our expectations, which were already high to begin with because of the fab reviews. If you are in Amsterdam DO NOT MISS OUT ON THIS! Fun for anyone, even if you're completely unfamiliar with real life room escape games like we were, you will have an absolutely brilliant time, i guarantee it!

A really fun activity!. The game is well thought out and so much fun! We were impressed with the details of the riddles. The people who work there are extremely nice and welcoming. We had no problem whatsoever with the booking process. The directions to get there are very clear. As a bonus, we got a last riddle in an envelope that we get to take home. We highly recommend this activity! We want more rooms so we can come back!

Fantastic Unique Experience. Had a thoroughly enjoyable time at the Room of Riddles. The staff were friendly and helpful (both via email and in person) and the event itself is something that I will always remember fondly. The puzzles were suitably challenging but straight forward enough to enable younger participants and those without an inclination for riddles to take part. I liked the themed room and I hope that more rooms will be added as this event continues. I would like to suggest some flexibility when it comes to booking confirmation. I absolutely understand the need for confirmation but I would like to see RoR offer flexibility in adding additional group members once the time slot is booked. I don't think it would matter much to the process if you bring along one or two more people after the initial booking as long as RoR are informed via email. I wouldn't count this as a negative but merely as a friendly suggestion for the future direction of the business. I look forward to seeing where RoR goes from here.
just a question. cant solo travelers play this game or need to be min 2 ? because on the reservation its required min to be 2

Brilliant idea! Great to do something different.. We visited the Room of Riddles as part of my amazing first weekend in Amsterdam. The concept is great, the Riddlemaster was attentive throughout and put us at our ease when we arrived as we didn't know what to expect. The location is a nice tram ride from the centre of Amsterdam, we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Amazing Experience!. Well as soon as heard this place existed I booked us in, getting there was easy and we were met at the entrance by Violet who was extremely nice. The experience itself was just brilliant and the whole room was very well thought out with great puzzles to solve (so easy to get frustrated with yourself tho) been in Amsterdam 4 days now and this was our fav part of the trip! I would recommend to EVERYONE to play this escape game!

The best part of our trip!. The Room of Riddles was AMAZING! It was so clever and well thought out...it was such a great ending to our trip. The puzzles were really good and challenging. The couple running the Room of Riddles were so fun and kind and made the experience absolutely wonderful. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone in or visiting Amsterdam! It is inexpensive and good for all ages!

Wonderful experience - A treat to the mind. I and my wife had been there on 29th June.It was our first real life escape adventure and trust me it was a wonderful experience.It was easily the most exciting things we have done in Holland.The hosts were very friendly and co-operative.The location is easily accessible."One of the must-do things in Holland"

'll you get out in time?. After one night of sleep, I'm still excited about what I experienced last night.We went to the first 'escape game' in Amsterdam by car. Not a clue what this 'game' meant beforehand.After a brief introduction, the words 'think logical' were still on my mind, when I went into the room.In one minute, this 'think logical' statement disappeared..."What do we need to do to get out of this room within 60 minutes?"So, when time is not on your side, you have to work together and cheer together when you solved a riddle. In the end, we were just in time, and luckily escaped!In conclusion: a nice, exciting new concept, which is challenging to play!

Multi-Generational Fun. Our group was multi-generational, which made it all the more fun. We didn't know what to expect, but ended up having a great time. As our guide told us, don't overthink and keep looking for clues. Our only disappointment was that we didn't get on the Facebook "Hall of Fame!"

A real life game you should play!. Awesome, fun and excited game to play! I’ve never played a game like this in real life. You must stay focused until the end to get out of the room in time. We had a great night at an easily accessible location in Amsterdam! It was something different.
Awesome and fun experience!. Fun, exciting and mindblowing escape game. Original theme and excellent set-up.A great activity to do with friends or colleagues.

Very entertaining and exciting game!. Last week I played The Room of Riddles, together with a friend. It's a very exciting game to play, which is a perfect activity when you visit Amsterdam. You get locked into a room, filled with all kinds of clues that you need to unlock boxes, suitcases, etc.. With every successfully opened box, you get another clue, in the end to find the key to the vault where the key of the door is located. While playing the game, there's a big countdown timer shown, which plays on your nerves!! In the end we managed to escape the room just under 60 minutes: what a relief! All in all a good addition to a night out in Amsterdam! Good price, nice hosts, and perfectly located. Loved it!
Nice evening game. Great game, lots of fun an very exciting. Loved it.I just escaped in time so I opened the door myself. So it actually was a "narrow escape".

Excellent escape game. I just love escape games and in every city where I have a spare evening to "waste" I look for local opportunities to play a game. Room of Riddles is a brand new set up, but the only one up and running in Amsterdam. So I expected a few hick-ups associated with a new game. NONE OF THIS! I played the game with some local friends and we were really challenged. Of course we made it in time, but there was some sweating with a few of the riddles. We did not need additional hints, so we were very proud of ourselves: the exact mood one wants to start a great night in town.So go and let you surprise. You'll love it.

Great fun! A truly special and unique real life/mind game experience.. Last night I played to Room of Riddles with a friend, we wanted to try a different and adventurous entertainment experience and this was a perfect solution!You enter a room and you have 60 minutes to figure out the code of the vault containing the key that will let you out: it's an exciting mind challenging journey where you will have to figure out your way through different hidden signs and codes around the theme of "Travels".Lovely hosts welcomed us in the modern building where the room is located, conveniently reachable by public transport or car, and gave us a short briefing. Great value for money and you get a drink included in the price.I would definitely recommend Room of Riddles to groups of friends, couples, family or even for a great team building session for companies!

Exiting "travel" escape game. Yesterday night we were in for something different then parties or theaters so we discovered the Room of Riddles. We had no clue what an escape game was, but as it was located conveniently next to a tram stop we gave it a go.The "Room" is located in a professional building in a safe area. After a warm welcome, the objective of the game was explained: You're locked in a room and you have to follow the hints to find the code of the safe that holds the key to open door within one hour. It appeared to be a great, intellectual adventure. We were only two brains, so it was a bit of a challenge, but we made it, be it with a few additional hints from the external supervisor.What a great challenge! We had a fantastic evening for a very modest Amsterdam price.
Nice experience. The Medieval Room was fun. The puzzles are of medium difficulty with some nice findings. The staff was very friendly indeed. A great evening event.

Great fun . Really good first experience although we have a lot of practice ahead of us to get better. The medieval room is really good and well thought out and we went with two of us but it is suitable for larger groups.
Nicely styled escape room. Near the centre of Amsterdam there are two very interesting escape rooms. Give them a shot, it's a lot of fun!
Frenetically fun activity . We all really enjoyed trying to escape from the jungle room and amazed we did with just 7 seconds on the clock. A very different activity but great fun for the four of us.

great room!. the room was great, nice riddles that keeps your interest up through the entire hour!
the workers were also very kind. enjoy!

I can't say anything without giving away too much. This was the first escape room experience for some of us. And it was one we will never forgot. However, I do think this escape room is challenging enough for those who do it more often (we had a couple of those too). The room is quite challenging, which we really enjoyed! Great experience!

Great fun. We were a group of four and tried the medieval room, we had a lot of fun and we made it out in about 50 minutes. The puzzles are varied and nicely made and there is a lot to do. It's a good room to start if you don't have a lot of experience of escape games, the level is quite accessible. The game master was very friendly and welcoming.
Awsome!. We've had an amazing time in the jungle Escape Room. We were a group of four. We made it out in 58 minutes. If you needed some help, they helped.
Great experience for the whole team. Time flew by. It was a nice experience to work as with the others. Next time we go to the jungle (next level ..)

Great fun with some nifty puzzles. We were with two playing the medival room. We made it out with no clues and in 50 minutes. Some really fun and creative puzzles and a good "flow" made us solve it all in a very decent time. Regarding improvement suggestions: on two occasions were we able to guess the solution rather than solving the puzzle. The host was extremely nice and welcoming! A really nice room for the new comers in the escape room world.
Time Trip was great!. Great fun, excellent help from the organisers and definitely would advise doing it if you like mentally challenging games!

Was our first room in AMS after more than 10 elsewhere. We had lots of fun in this room, although it's size.Puzzles were clear and easy to approach, but not easy to solve.The only problem we faced is the size of the room, which is not too small, but more than one part for a room is something necessary to keep you interested for an hour. That and the background story, which doesn't really affects the game.Overall we really had great time!Also - fits perfectly for first time escapers!

Very cool Escape Room. Very cool Escape Room with a wonderful Medieval feeling. Only the puzzles could be a little bit harder to find out. Some puzzles could be founded without thinking too much and using logic. Apparently the Jungle Room should be a little bit harder. But for a beginners room the Medieval Room was excellent.

Nice Escape Room, but could be better. It was a single, simple (jungle) room we did with 2 people. Nice challenge but the atmosphere of the room is simple, there's no story, the door's not locked, and some of the puzzles were broken. I would call this a puzzle room more than an escape room experience. There's far more immersive escape rooms in Amsterdam.

Our teenagers loved it!. This was one of the most fun things we did together on our 5 week Europe trip. My husband and daughters are very good at Logic problems and love strategy games and they rocked it! They got so excited every time they'd solve one of the challenges and a clue or key would drop down. So fun to see them engaged as much of our trip is just looking at things. Here we were working together and solving things to reach our goal! Highly recommend. It is challenging --we got out with time to spare not because it is too easy (we played the medieval game) but because they really are quite smart with this sort of thing. Even the worker said we did it really well!
Decorative and fun. This room is great for beginners. All the riddles are very clear and linear, and there are a lot of them.For experienced escapers this room might be a bit easy.
Great Room for beginners. excellent Staff, great room for your first experience, we go as a couple and it was our 2nd room.... we finished it in 1H and 15M with one hint.i recommend it!!!!!

Totally romped it!!. The staff were friendly, was easy to find and a done to a good standard. The games were challenging but not really hard. We escaped 10 minutes before the end and there were 2 of us.Great fun!!

Fun, challenging and engaging escape room.. We loved the experience the TimeTrip staff provided us with. The Medieval escape room's puzzles were challenging and engaging. We loved the fact that the room had a very coherent theme and all the puzzles were in this theme. We were even asked to wear knights outfits, which were provided by the staff, and we could ask Merlin for hints. These factors had a very immersive effect on our time in the room. All in all, we really enjoyed our time in the TimeTrip Medival escape room. The puzzles were innovative and fun. We would recommend everyone to check it out for themselves.
Extremely fun and brilliant staff. This was our second ever escape room and it was fantastic. Staff are excellent and the prices are almost unbeatable for 2 people.

Mindbending fun..... Good experience. Interesting puzzles. Helpful and gracious puzzle master. Only giving 4 stars instead of 5 because of a faulty sensor or two in puzzles and room temp being a bit warm for summer.
We would go again....

Fun time in the jungle survival room. Had a great time at TimeTrip's Jungle Survival Room. The game was challenging, but it made for an even better experience. This escape room isn't as flashy as many that I've been to, but it didn't take away from the challenge. Staff was also very friendly.
Medieval escape room. We had a nice experience. Friendly working people. The room was a bit difficult but a great challenge.

Great experience @escape room. I visited the escape room with 2 other friends and we had a really enjoyable time. We opted for the Medieval game room and it was a great choice! The puzzles were intriguing to solve and each one was linked to the next game. With some hint from the game creator, we managed to escape with 2minutes to spare. Would highly recommend this to try out! do check out their website as they do have certain discounts available.

Medieval themed room fun for the family!!. My wife and 10 year oth son did the medieval room and had a great time. As advertised, the puzzles were challenging but did allow engagement from the younger people in the group. I think it would be great with a group of five because the was harder to keep the kids engaged full time and still make it out! Overall a very well done themed room and tons of fun with unique puzzles.
Jungle escape awesome time. Friendly staff great escape room lots of games puzzles. We want to go next to the mediaval room because this was a great experience ( jungle room) :)

Great first up escape room experience. A friend and I decided to give the Medieval Room a go on a wet day and it was a great, fun experience. We did finish it just on the allotted time and reflecting back, some of the puzzles we should have cracked earlier, but it's just getting your brain engaged. There is help if you need and the odd little hint does assist, if you're heading down the wrong path.At 70 Euros for an hours entertainment it's good value and it's located in a lovely part of the city. The guys running it were very friendly and for a return visit offered a 20% discount, which is nice.Highly recommend as a thing to try and as a first up one, this is a great way to start your escape room crusade. I'll definitely be doing another one!
Good service and great challenge. Must do. The games, puzzels are great.We went twice with four friends. Hopefully there are making more rooms!

Great experience at the medieval room. It is a great escape room (I have done 5 so far)The puzzles are not insanely hard, but you do need to think in order to solve themIn my opinion it is a good room for first timersThe team running the place was very kind and helpfulme and my friend had a lot of fun!

Medieval room. We did this room with 4 people. We did like all the puzzles and the artwork of the room. The puzzles weren't too hard. This was also the first escape room we did and after this experience we will definetly do more!

Good beginner rooms!. If you are new to escape rooms then I would recommend to start here. The rooms are fun but more on the easy side. If you are an experienced escape room player I would recommend trying somewhere else as you will not be challenged enough and finish quite quickly. Its always a nice feeling to escape but if its under 40mins the room either isn't challenging enough, its short of puzzles.... or you've played too many escape rooms ;) ! We have done both rooms here and the same comments apply for both. Fun rooms but for escape room beginners

A bit easy, but great for a first escaperoom experience!. Very central in Amsterdam, warm welcome. We did the medieval room, it was a bit easy, but very nice bonding experience and now I definitely want to try another (more difficult) escape room.
Great experience. Cool place!We had lots of fun in the Medieval Room. The guy working there was really friendly. The price is aligned with the other escape rooms in Amsterdam

Very nice experience!. We had a very good experience with the escape room (medieval) from time trip! We were with the two of us, and both liked it a lot! We want to go back to visit the other room! With the two of us we needed the whole hour. The staff was also very nice!!

Great and fun experience with friends!. I booked two rooms as part of my birthday celebration. None of the people in our group had any experience with escape rooms, but all liked it greatly. Solving the puzzles in two groups was a real treat. Thank you TimeTrip!
Very good fun. The room has a great flow and we had a lot of fun. 5 guys lots of fun had a great time solving riddels
Escape room. Very original and challenging. Went with my boyfriend and we were able to get out using the full hour. Would recommend a bigger group. Very fun
Vary Nice Escape Room. Very nice staff and good challenges. We did the Medieval room and it was awesome. It wasn't very difficult for us to escape but it was interesting and the puzzles were nice ;)

Escaped twice at Time Trip. Very caring staff and inventive rooms. I have done both challenges with two friends (the Jungle and Medieval). The first one is more about logic skills so a bit harder puzzles in the way to solve them; but the second being bigger in size, it is also fun to try to find your way in it among the many realistic props. We had a great experience at each visit, that is for sure!
Unexpected but fun. I didn't know what to expect and it wasn't this but I did enjoy and had a lot of fun.Surely want to do this again.

Very interesting activity. Well thought out activity - very interesting concept. I think the difficulty is just right to keep one on their toes. We did it as two people and did the medieval room and managed to do it within one minute before the timer ran out. .

Medieval fun!!. We were a group of 6 and really had fun figuring out the puzzles through the room!
Definitely recommend if it is your first time trying out a room escape game.

The Jungle Room - Bomb disarmed!!. We did it, yes!!! But, I have to admit that we had done the Medieval before, so we knew what we were in for. Great fun and great puzzels. Very sad there are no more games. Hopefully they will open another location son. Great host.
Cool and exciting. We are in the 10% group that solved it and disarmed the bomb. A lot of clever puzzles and a good flow to the game. The host was very good!

Escape game room. We did the Medieval Escape room and we had a lot of fun. We escaped after 45 minutes, so if you have done this kind of games before, it is not that difficult. But if you are looking for some teambuilding, you have to try this one!

Great escape room. It was a great escape room. Lots of good puzzles. We were with 4 people and had lots of fun. We recommend this to everyone. It's a pity the place was not in a busy street so most people won't notice it.

Great fun for the whole family. We did the jungle challenge and it was a great way to spend an hour or so together as a family. It was fun, challenging, and kept the interest of each family member. My 13 year old son and 12 year old daughter enjoyed the experience so much they want to tell their school to go there for team building lessons. If you enjoy playing games together, then I highly recommend TimeTrip.
Fun room. This was my fourth escaperoom and again a lot of fun. Downside we escaped after 41 minutes so a bit short experience. I think this room is great price/quality if this is your first escape!

Great Medieval Escape Room. With two couples we have done the medieval escape room and it was great fun. It was our first time so the puzzles were not too difficult to solve, but still very challenging. The tips they gave during the session helped us not getting stuck on something trivial. The room(s) were nicely decorated and it was a great addition to get a matching outfit. The employees were very nice and really took the time to explain everything. I would really recommend this for beginners, but also for people who have more experience with escape rooms.
Fun and cool room. Some nice effects and cool puzzles to solve! We had really much fun doing this escape room and it wasn't too hard or too easy. We will definitely return to do the Jungle Room!
Fun escape room. We have tried the medievil room with 4 ppl and we had nice fun. The puzzles are cool and the evironment nice. We made it in 47 min and we are very proud.

Great looking medieval escape room. We had a great experience in this room. The employee was nice, the room looked great, the puzzels were surprising, not too dificult. We managed to excape with two people within the hour, and had a fun time. The room is within walking distance of Damsquare.

Some nice surprises in the room. We had a great laugh during the game! It's challenging enough, with clear instructions. Not many loose items and a pretty logical "solve this puzzle and then you can do the next" strategy. Doesn't leave much room for trying a different game if you're stuck though.One puzzle in my opinion could do with a clue in the room instead of relying on people's knowledge. But we will certainly be back for the Jungle room!!!
Nice. We played the Medieval room with 4 persons and had a lot of fun. The puzzles were not too hard and me made it within 48 minutes.

Middleton agenda timetrip. As a frequent plagerig iwas pleasantly surprises. The room has got Someren interessting and out of the box puzzels andere compell you to work as a team. As a skilled plager the room might be a little to easy. But still a lot of fun.

loved it. went with 3 other friends- all first time in escape rooms and all had so much fun. We went to the medieval room and are already orgainising a date to come and try and escape from the jungle room! The staff were super friendly!
Awesome. Did both rooms, me + 1 :)Friendly staff, great difficulty.Jungle room a bit hard with 2 persons but we manage to get out

Disappointing, but apparently something kids might like. Medieval room has a few 'puzzle cases' in it, a poorly-painted set, looks very amateurish, seems like it was put together in a rush to jump on the escape room bandwagon (a sign in the 'waiting room' asks if you want to join the franchise). My heart sank when I saw it, but friends I was with had never been to an escape room, so I didn't say that this is kind of 'low end'. I'm not trying to be scathing or negative, but it was Not something I'd recommend. The helping guy was enthusiastic, and apologetic when a couple of things didn't work (getting the right answer/code and nothing happening, for instance).If you're expecting to be impressed, I would go somewhere else.
Brilliant !. Super friendly staff, very interesting riddles, great experience, managed to finish at the last second. I would really recommend visiting this place.
It was amazing. I was there last weekend. The room has a good location, easily reachable from public transportation. The staff is friendly. All the puzzles are well designed. I like that.

Great escape room in the heart of Amsterdam. A great time to spend in Amsterdam! We went on a rainy friday after-noon and it was the best decision for us, choosing the Jungle Survival Room. The puzzles were great and beautifully executed. Thank you to David to showing us a good time!

A lot of fun..!. My family ( with two teen agers) throughly enjoyed the experience. Challenging puzzles but the staff on site was very helpful. Took 61 minutes to solve it all, not too long not too short..

Awesome really awesome . Me and my wife went. First time in an escape room. But super friendly staff and well designed rooms. We booked Jungle survival. But it was so much fun we ended up doing medieval too. Highly recommended!

Great first experience in an escape room!. My first escape room experience was in Time Trip, the medieval room. I had heard so many good stories about escape rooms, but not this one in specific. We were very warmly welcomed and were dressed as real 'knights'. After 55 minutes of amazing puzzles and cool surprises, we came out of the room totally excited. I definitely would recommend this escape room!

Escape room experience. The employee greeted us warmly and gave us good explaination of what would go on inside the escae room. While in the exape room he gave us great tips and helped us get through puzzles we couldnt get through ourselves. The room was fun, with interesting tests and questions.

Nice escape room, good for puzzlers. We did both rooms with a group of colleagues and enjoyed the puzzles and the scenery very much. It was challenging but doable within an hour. Also our guide was really nice.
Enjoyed our first esape room.. Went here with 3 other friends. It was our first escape room, and we really liked it! The puzzles were fun to do.

Definitely worth a visit. The jungle room was a lot of fun and had a very diverse mix of puzzles & challenges to solve. We're planning to try the medieval room as wel soon! Staf was also extremely nice & helpful :)

fun hour!. we did the jungle room, puzzles are in chronological order, setting is great and a nice surprise coming from the sky :-)room is perfect for small groups, max 4 persons. it was a fun hour to spend!

Best Way to Determine Your Smartest Friend. I had never done an one before, but since it was pouring rain and these Escape Rooms were popping up all over TripAdvisor (wow #8 in Amsterdam, really?), we decided to give one a go. Definitely worth it and will do again. This is a great way to have fun as a couple or with a few friends before hitting the pubs later. The rooms are challenging but man it feels good when you unlock each challenge.We enjoyed it so much we came back and tried the Jungle one two days later. I was initially sceptical of these things, but they are a hoot.
Very good!. The medivel was very good! Had a lot of cool effects. Also the staff (Jente) was very nice. Definitely one of the top escape rooms we did.
Fun !. We escaped with just a couple of minutes left. Time flies while doing the puzzles & games. It was fun! The outfit is a nice add to the medieval atmosphere. Definitely recommendable!

Great fun. We escaped the medieval room with 8mins to spare super fun deffo recommend! Well thought out and the costumes simple as they are were a nice touch. Friends or family's it is a great team building fun activity.

Fun and exciting. My first escape room and I really love it!
We did the medival room and it was fun and exciting for the first time !
Great experience!!

Our first experience of an escape game.. This was our first experience of an escape game an my boyfriend and I really enjoyed it! We booked our time slot on their website, paid cash on the visit and found it good value for the experience. It was only the two of us took about an hour to complete the Medieval Room with several challenges that we're certainly challenging but not too hard. The guy running it was very friendly and helpful (and will give you hints if you need them!) and we hope the company keeps going well. When we come back we will certainly take on the jungle game too and will recommend a visit to any friends visiting Amsterdam. A great experience to mix up our visit.

Medieval escape room. Four of us went to TimeTrip for an evening of puzzle solving. They have two themes, the Jungle and Medieval. The Medieval is a classic escape room whilst the Jungle is more focussed on puzzle solving. We went to the Medieval room. It was a lot of fun. The setup was pretty ingenious and there were no idiosyncratic hops between sequential puzzle solving. All in all...good evening out for you and your friends. The person in charge is really a nice guy too!

A brilliant, fun adventure through time!. I visited TimeTrip with 4 friends, we all really enjoyed the experience and it provides something very different to do with your time in Amsterdam.We went in the medieval room and enjoyed the range of games, some were quite easy and some which were quite hard. We needed to get hints a couple of times which was easy as there are camera set up to watch your progress in the room and the hints we got were just enough to point us in the right direction, while still leaving us to work out what to do.I would reccomend this to my friends as a fun way to spend an hour or so in Amsterdam

Great Adventure. We`ve been looking for an escape game so we booked in for medieval room. The 2 of us finished it in quite a good time with about 10 min left (but we had some exp from other rooms) and so we decided to go to the jungle as well afterwards since it was free.Both really nice rooms friendly staff and good riddles.

Solid challenges, super friendly staff, so much fun! =D. Me and my friend (just the two of us) decided to take on the jungle room challenge! Boy did we underestimated it! We felt our brains melt at times haha but it was sooo worth it when we finally figured out a certain puzzle! Instant adrenaline rush! Granted we were provided a few tips here and there, a gentle nudge when we got stuck. Finished 3,5(!) minutes before the jungle went BOOM! =P Left with a huge grin on our faces! On a more practical note, the jungle room does not require you to interact with the room itself as much as some other escape games would. It is linear, and very much of a brain-game. But don't let it disappoint you, the puzzles are really well designed, the flow is great. What's funny is you'll even gain some "macgyver" skills you might put into real-life use who knows! Do it!!

Immersive puzzles & friendly staff. After escaping from the medieval room a few months back, it was now time for a jungle escape! Again, we enjoyed the experience. The staff introduced the room nicely. This one (jungle) was more linear and the puzzles were fun and got all of us (a team of 4) working on them together! We managed to escape with about 10 minutes to spare!!

Fun teambuilding experience. We had a great experience last friday the 22th of January with Herman as a host. Teambuilding at the Jungle Survival Room & Medieval room was really fun! We enjoyed it and maybe till next time..

Good fun, friendly staff, well worth a visit. Played the mediaeval room in a group of four, was really good fun, staff were friendly and helpful hints given when needed. Really good experience we all thoroughly enjoyed. Thanks

Both Rooms done. We were at Time Trip with 17 co workers and did both rooms in groups. Good for team spirit and lot of fun.
I wish there was a kind of waiting room too, to have a drink and chat.
But it was fun and we all did it in time!
Thanks guys.

Fun, but not too challenging. We visited the medieval room for the bachelorette party of our friend. We had great fun! It was not very difficult, but fun nonetheless. The 'costumes' were a nice bonus, something I haven't experienced anywhere else.

Nice and Exciting. We played the Medieval Room. We we're welcomed by a friendly face who explained the principal of the room to us. We we're first time users.
The whole experience was very fun and the puzzles are quite tricky. It left us wanting more!

Fun time with family. We played the Jungle room with a group of 4. Was the first time we played an escape room, so we needed to find things out. But one of the owner explained all very well and was friendly and helpfull.

Excellent choice for an afternoon. This was my first try of this kind of the activities and I must say that was amazing! A cosy place with friendly crew. You have 1 hour to find your way out of the rooms, however it is so much fine that you will not notice how fast that one hour will finish!If you are around Amsterdam centre specially in a rainy day and want to spend time with your friends or family members, you will not regret going there.

Awesome experience. This was our first experience of an escape room. We tried the Medieval room and totally loved it! Very exciting, challenging and enjoyable! Needs real team work, logic and non-linear thinking. Our guide was very friendly and also helped us in critical moments during the session! I definitely recommend TimeTrip Amsterdam to those interested in escape rooms.
Great fun time!. I loved everything about this super fun activity! We had an exciting hour, full of fun and joy! Strongly recommended.
top experienc. loved the place, the staff was very helpful, very clever riddles, cant wait to try out jungle room as well

Amazing you need. me my husband and our kids (boys with 14,15) did went to medieval room ... was our first time we did LOVED ... the feeling you have each time you solve something is amazing and you really need to work in team ... very nice for teens and parents ... Just miss one clock there to give us more pressure ...

Good team activity!. We did the escape room with colleagues. It is a really good team activity. I think it is a nice escape room to start with if you never did it before. There is a nice combination of knowledge and logical thinking.

A Time Trip of Fun.. TimeTrip allows you to play two different scenarios. One is in a jungle where you have to diffuse a bomb before it explodes, the other is where you are in the medieval ages trying to prove your worthiness as a knight for King Arthur through solving problems to escape from the room.It was the first time for my girl friend and I to experience this type of "puzzles" entertainment, and we found it to be a very fun activity that was emotionally and mentally engaging. The owner of the place David was incredibly friendly and made our first time experience enjoyable and comfortable. We would recommend the activity for 3-4 people. If you have 5-6 people you could squeeze into one room, but if thats the case, we would recommend that you just take both rooms and split into two teams of three.(This is a great rainy day activity).

Lots of fun!!!. Australians abroad doing an escape room for the first time. Just did a quick search and found this place was the cheapest of the ones near our hotel. We saw there was a spare time slot, walked there and asked for it and had problems. We didn't really know what to expect and were nervous when the employee said we were doing the harder one but he was very friendly and explained it all for us and gave us some helpful hints when needed. We did the jungle room and it was perfect for just 2 people. Would start getting a little cramped inside with a bigger group. Would love to have done the medieval room too but we were flying out the next day. Definitely recommend this place to game and puzzle enthusiasts.

Jungle room. The jungle room was very good. The staff was nice and friendly. And is located in a very nice part of the city. It was my first escape room but i realy liked it. Ill be back for the other room

Friendly & Fun. It was fun, we got out in time (because we are very smart, and good team players) and were disappointed when the game was over.Good fun, friendly person receiving us and explaining the game.
Great fun!. I went with 3 friends to the medieval escape room. Friendly staff and nice riddles. We had great fun.

We did it!. My husband and I chose the medieval escape room, this was our first escape room so we didn't know quite what to expect but the owner really put us at ease and we managed to complete the room within the allocated hour. TimeTrip is a bit of a walk from the centre through the pretty Jordaan area, a good chance to see a part of Amsterdam you may otherwise miss. We found that it was less expensive that other escape rooms we looked at. The building is a little basic but the room itself has plenty of fun challenges and you won't be disappointed. We'd love to Coke back on our next trip and tackle the jungle room.

Great fun experience. Perfect rainy day for a medival game! I went with two friends and we enjoyed it very much. It was our first time and for sure we want to do the jungle survival.We recommend it to every one who loves resolving puzzles.
Medieval adventure. Really nice experience, tricky escape room with nice puzzles. We really enjoyed the way the room progressed when solving the tricks.

Both rooms, LOTS of fun.. We did both rooms and had a great time. The Jungle is more a puzzle room, so this room was more of a challenge. The Medieval room was more like the classic escape room.
Both looked very nice and were alot of fun. Would recommend this to everyone!
Great hosts, Good looking rooms and clever puzzles. 10/10

Super awesome!. We had an amazing time getting out of both escape rooms! We booked the Jungle room and got out in 40min. And because the group that was supposed to do the Medieval room their flight got delayed, we could do the second room with discount. We got out of there under 45 min!Both rooms very different, but if I had to choose I would recommend the Medieval one. All puzzels and games were handmade and super cool!I want to go again!!!!

Great experience!. A couple of weeks ago I went here with two friends. None of us had been to an escape room before so we didn't really know what to expect. It was great fun! At arrival we were greeted by one of the employees. He gave us a great introduction and even took the time for a little chat. Once in the room we really had a great time. We tried the medieval room and everything was really in medieval style. They clearly put a lot of thought and effort in it. We even got a Knights costume to enhance our experience. The puzzles were well made and gave us enough challenge to complete the challenge. There wasn't a dull moment the entire time. As I said before, we had a great time! We will definitely come back her to try the other room.

Very nice and a bit complicated. Nice hosts also!. I really liked this TimeTrip because I it was not too easy or too difficult. The hosts where nice, the coffee was okay.. The puzzels are nicely made (hand-made i heard) and the location is very central

Very nice rooms! very nice people!. What an experience! We really liked both rooms. The host was amazing, and the games were really well put together and super exciting. The rooms looked amazing. The hint system is really working well, had an absolute great time! Would recommend it to everyone!

Good escape room! Nice staff. We really enjoyed the escaperoom from TimeTrip. We did the mediaval room and that was fun. It could be a little more challenging but I understood that the jungle room offers that. I certainly will try-out that one!

Nice escape room combo. Nice combination of an easier and a more complicated escape room. Suitable for beginners and intermediate escape room artists. Friendly and helpfull personel. Due to a misunderstanding in a booking confirmation me and my friends could not get to the desired room. This was solved in a high degree of customer friendliness by one of the owners, which I am still very grateful for. I wish the hosts all the best and look already forward to them opening more new rooms, which I can hopefully this time escape from without help. :)

jungle room. Nice experience and exciting. Are we smart enough to solve all the puzzles and challenges. we needed a lot of help though! The volume of the helpline was a bit soft that could be improved.

Exciting moment with teenagers. First time doing an escape game, and quite liked it (almost blew the jungle with only 2 minutes remaining). Parents and 13 years old enjoyed, the 9 year old had difficulty to understand the exercise but did get the excitement too.Setting of the place is a bit basic, but once you are starting the game, it doesn't really matter anymore.

Two great escape rooms. This is a nice set of two escape rooms run by some really nice hosts. The medieval room has some cool physical puzzles and is very thoughtfully decorated. The jungle room is on the small side, but it's well-decorated and focusses heavily on puzzles (as opposed to physical puzzles or finding things) which is nice if you're looking for a change from the usual escape rooms.

First escape games. Me and my girlfriend went as a couple not quite knowing what to expect. Had a great time and had a lot of fun. Daniel was a massive help as we didn't book online before going however he did that part for us. We came back about 2 hours later and he had the room set up for us and gave us a few hints when we got stuck. Very friendly guy. Easy going and enjoyable to talk to. Would definitely recommend.

Warm welcome & exciting room!. Communication and booking beforehand went smooth. There was a little technical issue in the room, but the staff handled this very well. I would definitely recommend this room!

Nice setup. We have been to several escape rooms before and we also did the other room (Medieval) at the same location. Fun escape room, we finished very fast with about 28 minutes left. Some supportive hints in the room were not necessary for us, but it did not affect the fun factor.
Dave james . Went there with 5 friends and it was great fun. Won't spoil anything but deffo worth it. Going to go back and do the other room before we go home.
